title: 2007-AT-17040-P
contents:
2007-AT-17040-P

---

Works and studies for upgrading the Wien-Bratislava railway line (6 sub-projects)

---

Part of Priority Project 17

---

This project is part of the Priority Project 17 railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava which targets the provision of a continuous new and upgraded high speed railway line from Paris to Bratislava for both freight and passenger transport.

title: the cross-border section Wien (Vienna)-Bratislava aims to link the new Vienna central railway station to the Vienna and Bratislava airports – contributing to the connectivity of Central and Eastern Europe as a whole.

id: This project includes both studies and works for each of the three sub-projects in greater Vienna:
• connection of new Vienna’s Central railway station to East
title: West  and  South  railway  stations  (6  km)
created: merging  all  of  the  railway  lines  (north
project_type: south
contents: east
topics: west)  in  a  new  through  station
image: the Vienna Central railway station

id: • Klederinger loop: connection between Vienna’s Central railway station and Vienna Airport by connecting the east railway line to the airport suburban railway line (2 km)
• Goetzendorfer clip: studies on the future double track construction connecting the airport to the East railway station and further to Bratislava (14.2 km)

Construction works are nearing completion at Vienna Central station and in the South and East areas. Works are on-going at the Klederinger loop. The EIA for sub-project Götzendorfer clip was issued in May 2011
title: but  has  been  confronted  with  several  appeals

title: 2007-AT-17170-P
contents:
2007-AT-17170-P

---

Works for the modernisation of the cross border section Salzburg–German border

---

Part of Priority Project 17 

---

The aim of this project is the removal of an important bottleneck located in a cross-border section on the Priority Project 17 railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava.

The project covers a 6 km section between Freilassing and Salzburg on the German/Austrian border where only two tracks are currently available to service local and long distance traffic.

The Action foresees construction of a third track on the 5 km of Austrian territory. It includes renovating or replacing all bridges in the section - in particular the bridge crossing the Salzach River. The overall technical standards for communication
topics: security and catenaries of the track will also be upgraded.

id: Implementation of the Action is approaching its completion
title: with  Salzburg  Aiglhof
project_type: Salzburg  Taxham  and  Salzburg  Liefering  stations  and  Salzach  bridge  completed  and  turned  into  operation.  The  Environmental  Impact  Assessment  (EIA)  certificate  for  the  cross-border  Saalach  bridge  was  delivered  by  the  competent  authorities.  Apart  from  some  minor  completion  works
contents: the remaining activities relate primarily to the works on the cross-border Saalach bridge.

Works for the construction of a high speed line between Wendlingen and Ulm

---

Part of Priority Project 17 

---

This project implements a new
topics: 60  km  rail  section  in  an  area  located  between  Stuttgart  and  Munich
image: and is part of Priority Project 17
column8: railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava). The new line of double tracks is designed for a maximum speed of 250 km/h and is expected to serve both long distance and light freight trains.

id: The project connects to the projects Stuttgart 21 and Neu-Ulm 21. The track location between Wendlingen and Ulm requires the crossing of the Swabian Mountains
title: with its specific geological structure. Just over 50% of its length will be constructed as tunnels. Those tunnels exceeding 1 km will be implemented in two separate tubes.

id: A number of the necessary studies for the planning procedures
title: including  environmental  and  noise  protection
created: have  been  completed.  For  the  Albvorland
project_type: Albaufstieg
contents: Albhochfläche  and  Albabstieg  sections
topics: preliminary  works  such  as  laying  cables  have  started.  Concerning  tunnels
image: shell construction of the tunnels "Boßler " and "Steinbühl " (3000m of tunnel excavated) "Widderstall " and the tunnel "Albabstieg " have started. For the Ulm Hauptbahnhof section planning is ongoing. The Donaubrücke section was completed in 2012.

title: 2007-DE-17020-P
contents:
2007-DE-17020-P

---

Works and studies for upgrading of the section München-Mühldorf-Freilassing
topics:
cross-border section DE/AT---

Part of Priority Project 17 

---

This project will remove an important bottleneck from the Priority Project 17 railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava. The line between Freilassing and Salzburg is currently operating at full capacity and cannot cater to additional cross-border regional traffic.

id: The works concern the section between Freilassing and the German-Austrian border
title: where only two tracks are currently available.

id: Street and river crossings will be either enlarged or re-built before a third track is put into place. One additional platform and some tracks will be added at Freilassing station to handle the increased traffic. The railway control systems will also be upgraded.

The Liefering railway station was put in operation. The preliminary planning and execution plans for the construction of the 3rd track have been terminated. The construction of the works related to the 3rd track as such are expected to start in 2015.

title: 2007-DE-17200-P
contents:
2007-DE-17200-P

---

Works for the construction of the high speed line between Stuttgart and Wendlingen

---

Part of Priority Project 17 

---

This project is part of Priority Project 17 (Railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava). When implemented
topics: these works are expected to reduce the travel time on the entire PP 17 axis.

id: The project will replace the existing 16-track "dead-end " station by a 8-track through-station and connect the airport with the national rail system. All feeder lines in Stuttgart- and 30 km of the required 57 km of tracks - will be constructed as tunnels. The project will also improve local and regional commuter traffic. From the airport
title: the line will continue along the highway to join the Wendlingen-Ulm section.

id: The Action is ongoing. Public consultation procedures have been carried out in 2010 and 2011 which has led to a delay in the project implementation. After the consultation and a referendum the project was given permission to proceed implementation taking into account additional requirements for the protection of the environment as well as the population. Planning approval was granted for the following sections: 'Anteil Neue Verkehrsstation'
title: 'Anteil  Gleisvorfeld'
project_type: 'Zuführung Feuerbach/ Bad Cannstatt and 'Zuführung Ober-Untertürkheim'.

2007-DE-24060-P

---

Works for construction and re-construction of the partially existing railway section between Karlsruhe and Basel

---

Part of Priority Project 24

---

This rail project
topics: part of the Priority Project 24 Railway axis Lyon/Genova-Basel-Duisburg-Rotterdam/Antwerpen
image: will increase the capacity on the railway axis between Karlsruhe and Basel which is necessary to serve the new Alpine crossing in Switzerland.

id: The project encompasses 182 km of existing tracks to be upgraded to a maximum speed of 200 km/h and the construction of two new tracks with a maximum speed of 250 km/h. This will entail the provision of four tunnels with a total length of 17 km. Some construction works for this line were already funded under the 2000-2006 TEN-T programme.
The project aims to improve rail efficiency. In addition
title: the travel time between Karlsruhe and Basel will be reduced from 100 to 69 minutes.

id: The planning process for upgrading the stretch Karlsruhe and Rastatt-South is being finalised
title: including the Rastatter Tunnel. For the stretch Rastatt-South to Offenburg and the one from Offenburg to Basel the planning process is ongoing.

id: For all southern sections between Offenburg and Auggen
title: the  requests  for  the  work  permits  have  been  launched.  After  the  inauguration  of  the  Katzenbergtunnel  in  December  2012
project_type: between Schliengen and Eimeldingen and Haltlingen-Weil am Rhein are ongoing.

---

High speed railway line "LGV Est " section Vaires-Baudrecourt-Saarbrücken: Migration of ERTMS
topics:
corridor Paris-Frankfurt---

ERTMS Corridor C

id:
Part of Priority Project 17 

---

ERTMS (European Rail Traffic Management System) is designed to gradually replace the existing incompatible national systems throughout Europe.

The aim of the global project is to equip railway high speed line between Paris and Frankfurt with ERTMS. It covers both track side and on-board activities. Thanks to ERTMS equipment on the section Paris-Baudrecourt
title: the level of interoperability on Priority Project 17 (railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava) will be increased.

id: This specific project includes studies for the section Vaires-Baudrecourt-Saarbrücken. The study is concentrated on the elaboration of the specific transmission module (STM) for the trains equiped KVB
title: a French system of speed control. The studies also cover the technical validation of ETCS system and cross-border studies between France and Germany.

title: 2007-BG-90303-S
contents:
2007-BG-90303-S

---

Technical assistance for construction of intermodal terminal in Central-North Planning Development Region in Bulgaria-Ruse

------

This action is part of the construction of intermodal terminal in Central North Planning Development Region in Bulgaria - Ruse " global project that aims to improve intermodality in the south-eastern region of the EU. It plans to create the conditions for the optimal combination and integration of various transport modes and a higher quality of freight transport services. This can pave the way for low-cost
topics: high-volume  freight  transport  from  the  Black  Sea  area  to  Central  Europe  and  the  EUN   "poles "  of  trade.  It  will  also  allow  new  demands  to  be  met
image: as the latest forecasts show a significant increase in traffic in regards to Turkey-Ukraine/Russia.

id: These studies aim to provide technical assistance for the preparation of the global project
title: and thus contribute to its timely and efficient implementation.

id: The project includes the preparation of a feasibility study together with all the necessary technical
title: economic  and  environmental  evaluations;  preparation  of  the  conceptual  design;  development  of  procurement  strategy  and  preparation  of  tender  documentation  for  the  construction  works.  Special  attention  shall  be  given  to  the  development  of  logistic  transport  chain  for  multi-modal  transport  from  the  Black  Sea  to  the  Danube  river

---

Studies for the capacity improvements of the section between Copenhagen and Ringsted

---

Part of Priority Project 20 

---

The mainline rail between Copenhagen and Ringsted is a central part of the Danish rail network. Presently running at full capacity
topics: the  line  is  used  for  traffic  between  the  provinces
image: local  and  regional  passenger  transport
column8: as well as domestic and international freight. The capacity problems create a bottleneck that will worsen due to increasing commuting demand and a potential increase in goods traffic transit through Denmark once the Fehmarn fixed link is established (Priority Project 20).

id: These studies are part of the global project aiming to improve the capacity on the intersection Øresund-German border to comply with the increasing railway traffic and optimise passenger and freight rail connections between Scandinavia and central Europe.
The project consists of the studies of two future alternatives:
<li>a  new  line  from  Copenhagen  to  Ringsted
title: including a new station in Køge

id: • an expansion of the existing main line with a 5th track between Hvidovre and Høje Tåstrup

id: Studies for upgrading the railway access lines to the future Fehmarn Belt fixed link - from Ringsted to Rødby and the intersection in Kastrup

---

Part of Priority Project 20

---

This action is part of a global project aiming to improve the capacity of the railway between Øresund and the German border
title: by addressing the increase of railway traffic and optimising passenger and freight rail connections between Scandinavia and Central Europe. It is related to the Fehmarn Belt fixed link between Denmark and Germany (Priority Project 20).

id: The studies - mainly technical design and environmental and traffic analysis - look at the section from Ringsted to Rødby and at Kastrup and address in detail the following elements:
• the impact of higher speed on the section between Ringsted and Vordingborg (those elements not covered by an ongoing project)

<li>the  construction  of  a  new  double  track  from  Vordinborg  to  Rødby  (with  the  exception  of  the  Storstrømsbroen  bridge  between  Zealand  and  Falster  that  will  remain  equipped  with  a  single  track).  The  extra  track  will  require  two  new  bascule  (moveable)  bridges  in  Vordingborg  and  Nykøbing  Falster
title: and also includes electrification of the line from Ringsted to Rødby

id: • the implementation of ETCS (European Train Control System)
<li>the  upgrade  of  the  line  to  obtain  a  maximum  speed  of  160  km/h
title: and the resulting necessary bridges or viaducts
noise  reduction  measures
project_type: acreage reservation etc

id: • construction of junctions in Kastrup and Ringsted

High speed railway line between Nîmes and Perpignan
topics:
works and studies for bypassing Nîmes and Montpellier---

Part of Priority Project 3

---

The Nîmes and Montpellier bypass is located on the Mediterranean branch of Priority Project 3
image:
the high speed railway line Paris-Madrid. The construction of a new railway line of 70 km will remove a current bottleneck on the railway link between the Rhône Valley and the Pyrenees.

The line will be equipped with ETCS (European Train Control System) Level 2 - an essential part of the European Rail Traffic Management System - to guarantee interoperability with the European high speed network.

The line will also be mixed
column8: allowing  high  speed  and  conventional  passenger  traffic
column9:
as well as freight transport.

This action covers the finalisation on of the design studies
column10: land  acquisition
column11: and  the  construction  on  of  the  new  line
column12: plus links to the existing railway network.

id: The works will be carried out through a Public-Private Partnership (PPP).
Archeological and environmental studies are completed. PPP contract has entered into force and works on intersections have started.

2007-FR-03120-P

---

High speed railway line Paris-Madrid: Elimination of rail bottlenecks around Bordeaux

---

Part of Priority Project 3

---

This project forms part of the high speed railway line Paris-Madrid (Atlantic branch of Priority Project 3) focusing on the Bordeaux railway hub. The hub is located on a strategic axis that links northern Europe to the Iberian peninsula. The existing single track for each direction is insufficient to support the amount of traffic that passes through Bordeaux.

id: This project specifically aims to eliminate the rail bottlenecks around Bordeaux
title: mainly through the construction of two additional tracks (one for each direction). Activities covered by this project include:

id: • Works for the finalisation of four tracks between the Saint Jean station and the old station of Benauge (4x2 km)
• Studies and works on the four tracks between the old station of Benauge and Cenon (4x3 km)
• Studies related to the removal of three level crossings located between Cenon and the connection of Lagrave-Ambarès.

title: public  enquiry  declaration  (DUP)  obtained  and  land  acquisition  completed.  Works  on  Cenon-Benauge  section  have  started
created: civil works viaduct tender awarded some civil works lots completed and;

title: 2007-FR-03130-S
contents:
2007-FR-03130-S

---

High Speed Railway Line Paris-Madrid: Bordeaux-Spanish border

---

Part of Priority Project 3

---

This project falls under the High Speed Railway Line Paris-Madrid (Atlantic branch of Priority Project 3) focusing on the section between Bordeaux and the Spanish border. It consists of the preparation of studies for the construction of a two-track railway line to complete the existing Bordeaux-Irún line and ensure continuity in terms of both speed and capacity. This railway axis will eventually consist of four tracks in total - two tracks on existing lines plus two tracks on the new lines.

id: The studies will include the following two sections:
<li>Bordeaux-Dax  (+/-155  km):  new  high  speed  line  (320  km/h)
title: mainly for passenger transport to the east of Landes

title: 2007-FR-17210-P
contents:
2007-FR-17210-P:

---

New railway high speed line "LGV Est "
Second phase: section Baudrecourt-Vendenheim

---

Part of Priority Projects 4 & 17

---

The aim of the "LGV Est " high speed railway line is to improve links between Paris and the main cities in eastern France
topics: as well as improving connections with Luxembourg and Germany. The first phase of the global project (part of Priority Project 4 High-speed railway axis East) linked Ile-de France (Vaires-sur-Marne) to Baudrecourt (Moselle) and reduced the travel time between Paris and Strasbourg to 2h20.

id: The second phase of the "LGV Est " is covered by the current project (part of Priority Project 17 Railway Axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava)
title: which  includes  106  km  of  high  speed  rail  line  between  Baudrecourt  and  Vendenheim  (Bas  Rhin).  This  will  further  reduce  travel  times  (Paris-Strasbourg  to  1h50)
created: develop connections with Germany and Switzerland and confirm eastern France's place in the heart of the European high speed railway network.

id: Activities covered by the funding decision include: design studies
title: land  acquisition

id: This project is also linked to the EERP project 2009-FR-17044-E.

The eastern branch of the Rhine-Rhône high speed rail line between Dijon and Mulhouse will connect the Paris region to eastern France and to Switzerland as well as Germany. It will also eventually link eastern France to the high speed line between Paris
topics: southern  France
image: Italy
column8: and Spain (Priority Project 24).

id: This project is concerned with the construction of 140 km of new line between Villers-Les-Pots (near Dijon) and Petit-Croix (near Belfort)
title: as  phase  one  of  the  eastern  branch.  The  works  include  the  construction  of  13  viaducts
project_type: and  two  new  railway  stations.  The  stations  of  Besançon  and  Mulhouse  will  also  be  adapted  and  linked  to  the  new  high  speed  line.  The  line
contents: which  expects  12  million  passengers  per  year
topics: is planned to be put into service at the end of 2011.

Construction of the second lock basin in Fankel (Mosel)

------

The aim of the project is to build a second lock basin in Fankel on the Mosel river for the German waterway class Vb
topics: required in view of the forecast traffic development.

title: the  waterway  connection  of  the  Rhine  via  the  Moselle  to  Luxembourg  will  be  clearly  improved
created: as well as that to the Lorraine region of France and via the Saar river to Germany's Saar region. The waiting periods for goods shipping will disappear with the construction of the second lock basin. Thus the goods transport in future can be executed faster and more efficiently.

title: 2007-IT-91502-P

2007-IT-91502-P

---

Cargo City Development - Railway Tunnel

------

The main goal of the project is to provide Milan's Malpensa Airport with a multimodal logistics park that integrates cargo traffic and offer benefits for the entire region.

id: The project will allow a progressive increase of Malpensa's capacity to reach those of other main European airports. Current traffic growth will lead to a saturation of cargo warehouses in the short/medium term. Furthermore
title: Malpensa  Airport's  strategy  is  to  attract  goods  transport  by  road  via  the  main  north-south  communication  routes.  As  a  result
created: Malpensa Cargo City requires adequate structures to meet the demand for cargo traffic.

id: The global project for the development of the Cargo City at Malpensa Airport encompasses the following projects: a new railway tunnel
title: new  aprons  for  cargo  aircraft
project_type: new  second  line  forwarder  warehouses
contents: and urbanisation of cargo areas.

id: This project involves development of the railway tunnel
title: which  will  be  done  prior  to  the  implementation  of  other  works.  Covering  the  railway  tracks
created: the surface can be utilised for aircraft and vehicle movements.

---

New Lyon-Turin Rail Link - Franco-Italian Common Part of the International Section (Studies and Works)

---

Part of Priority Project 6

---

The new freight and passenger rail link between Lyon and Turin (Priority Project 6) will act as a key node between northern and southern Europe (London/Amsterdam/Paris-Milano) and west and east (Lisbon-Budapest). It will considerably shorten travel times for high speed passenger traffic and provide an environmentally friendly response to the steadily increasing demand for freight transport over the Alps.

id: This project concerns the common French-Italian part of the 80 km international section from Saint Jean de Maurienne to Sant'Antonino-Vaie in the Chiuse valley. The main lineside structures are the 57.1 km French-Italian "Base Tunnel " and 11.4 km Orsiera Tunnel on the Italian side.

---

Part of Priority Project 20

---

The Fehmarn Belt Fixed Link project is part of the global project Fehmarn Belt railway axis (Priority Project 20). As an extension of the Øresund crossing (Priority Project 11) and the Nordic triangle road and rail links (Priority Project 12)
topics: it is a key component in the main north-south route connecting the Nordic countries to the rest of Europe.

title: geotechnical  and  navigational  investigations
created: safety  assessments  as  well  as  design  activities  and  adaptations  for  use  in  the  plan  approval  process  of  the  authorities.  The  geotechnical  investigations  are  confined  to  the  planned  link  corridor
project_type: whereas the environmental investigation will cover wider areas of the entire Fehmarnbelt and most of Kieler Bucht and Mecklenburger Bucht. The studies also constitute the basis for identifying the best technical solution (bridge or tunnel).

id: The construction activities will primarily be the start of the establishment of the prefabrication areas for the production of tunnel elements or bridge caissons
title: piers and girders.

id: The treaty between Denmark and Germany has been signed. The geotechnical studies and the boring campaign have been completed. The environmental studies have been completed. The plan approval procedure in Denmark and Germany has started and is in progress. The recommendation report of the technical solution has been published. The EIS has been formally submitted to the relevant authorities. The prequalification of bidders and civil works enquiry documents on construction of the fixed link have been finalised.

to start following the definition of the project alignment and planning.

Feasibility Study for establishment of the Baltic FAB

------

The Action aims to carry out a feasibility study for the establishment of a Baltic Functional Airspace Block (FAB) in line with the Single European Sky II (SES II) regulations and the FAB's prospective regional development scenarios
topics: by making necessary analytical scenario studies supported where it is possible by the respective cost-benefit studies and safety cases.

id: The Baltic FAB will eventually contribute to the implementation of the performance targets of the SES II legislation in such areas as safety
title: security
project_type: flight  efficiency
contents: environment
topics: cost-effectiveness and associated Key Performance Indicators.

id: The feasibility study is to provide the national authorities of Poland and Lithuania with the in-depth analysis of the Baltic FAB Initiative and the Baltic FAB Implementation Plan along with the prospects concerning the Baltic FAB regional development and the solutions for the enhanced co-operation with other neighbouring FAB Initiatives and non-EU States.

The feasibility study phase shall finally result in governmental decisions concerning the scenario for prospective Baltic FAB regional development and implementation of arrangements enhancing the overall FAB.

---

Optimising Rail Connection Port of Amsterdam - European hinterland (ORCAEU) – Elimination of missing links for intermodal freight transport

------

This project aims at clearing bottlenecks of the rail network inside the port of Amsterdam
topics: and thus improving the connection to its hinterland. A considerable growth of traffic is expected for the port and the current infrastructure must be upgraded to cope with this growth.

id: These bottlenecks currently hamper the potential modal share of rail compared to road already at the beginning of the transport chain. By facilitating the move to a more environmental friendly mode
title: this project will thus help to reduce the environmental impact of transport. Electrification of one railway yard will directly contribute to the modal shift by rendering diesel locomotives unnecessary.

id: There are six interrelated activities comprised in this project which all aim at increasing the capacity of the rail network within the port and beyond:
• Improved connection of the port railway to the main railway network
• Extension of the Westhaven railway yard from 550 to 750 metres
• Improved crossing by port traffic of the Schipholline with frequent traffic
• Connection of the growth pole Africahaven to the rail network
• Upgrade of unprotected railway crossings at Aziehavenweg railway yard

title: 2009-SE-00011-E
contents:
2009-SE-00011-E

---

Port infrastructure facilities in the Malmö Northern Harbour

------

The Port of Malmö plays an important role in the regional
topics: national  and  international  transport  system
image: and  combined  transport  from  Malmö  has  achieved  a  very  large  growth  during  the  last  8-10  years.  While  transport  demand  increases
column8: the present terminal facilities are lacking space and there are no expansion possibilities. It is thus necessary to establish terminal facilities with a larger capacity for multimodal/intermodal transport. A global project for the development of the Northern Harbour has been prepared to overcome infrastructure bottlenecks and to increase capacity for combined and multimodal transport in the Port of Malmö.

id: The global project includes the establishment of a combined multimodal terminal which will consist of a ro-ro ferry terminal with terminal area
title: a  container  terminal  and  a  combined  (railway)  terminal.  The  terminals  will  be  established  in  connection  to  a  new  dry  bulk/multi  purpose  terminal  with  railway  connection  to  the  national  railway  system.  Adjacent  to  the  combined  terminals  a  large  new  logistic  centre  of  some  650

id: This action will support the following items of the global project:
• Construction of the new ro-ro terminal with three ferry berths
• Construction of roads to connect the new logistics centre to the combined terminals and to the overall infrastructure
• Installation of an autogate system with two portals/lanes and equipment

title: the combi-terminal (railway) has also received TEN-T support from the annual programme (2007-SE-92404-P).

id: The Action is progressing as planned. The new ro-ro terminal with three ferry berths is operational. The dredging is also completed and the autogate is installed. The Action has been modified and the roads in the logistic centre will not be part of the Action. An extension on the end date of the Action by 7 months has been granted to complete part of the connection roads.

---

Thames Estuary dredge and reclamation works to support the integrated multi modal London Gateway port and logistics development

------

The London Gateway (LG) global project is a Category A container port and integrated on-site multimodal distribution centre development in the Thames Gateway Regeneration Area. The port is needed due to increasing UK demand for container freight and the new Ultra Large Container Carriers (ULCCs).

id: The Action comprises the majority of the dredging that is required to provide deep-water access for the safe navigation of deep draft container ships to London Gateway Port and a deep-water manoeuvring and berthing area at London Gateway itself.
The main dredging will result in increasing the depth of parts of the existing Yantlet channel from 10.5 to 13.75 metres
title: thus allowing deeper draft vessels to transit the channel. Additionally the berth depth in front of the terminal (the berthing) will be dredged to 17 metres. The estimated amount of material to be dredged is 14 million cubic metres. The final amount will be verified upon completion of baseline hydrographical surveys. Dredge material will be used to reclaim the land for the port and the foundations of the rail interlink.

title: 2008-EU-21010-P
contents:
2008-EU-21010-P

---

High Quality Rail and Intermodal Nordic Corridor Königslinie

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The objective of this project is to upgrade the existing rail ferry link between the ports of Trelleborg (Sweden) and Sassnitz (Germany) in order to increase the share of rail and intermodal transport on the Swedish-German corridor in particular and the Sweden-Central Europe/Italy corridor.

id: Improving the existing rail ferry service by offering more capacity
title: more  efficiency
created: faster  handling  in  the  ports  and  more  flexibility  due  to  the  option  of  a  sixth  departure  (in  peak  demand  periods  only)
project_type: will help it compete with alternative and less sustainable routes on this transport corridor.

id: Improving the infrastructure in the ports will enable operation on a sufficient volume base combining rail and intermodal transport. In Trelleborg
title: the  port  will  be  able  to  efficiently  service  more  than  one  rail/road/intermodal  ferry  route.  In  Sassnitz
created: the  new  infrastructure  and  equipment  will  enable  the  port  to  load
project_type: unload and store intermodal transport units (e.g. unaccompanied trailers).

id: The Königslinie route is currently served by two vessels operated by Scandlines AB and Scandlines GmbH. The sailing schedule (in 2007/2008) is 5 departures per day and per direction. Together
title: the  two  vessels  have  a  total  capacity  of  2
project_type: 419  lane  meters  for  train  wagons  and  843  lane  metres  for  intermodal  units
contents: trucks  and  cars.  The  vessels
topics: which  are  19  and  26  years  old
image: make  the  crossing  in  3h45  min  -  4h
column8: and approximately 60 minutes is spent at the port to unload and reload before departing again.

id: From the current 1.7 million tons transported in rail wagons on the ferry route between Sassnitz and Trelleborg (81% of the total 2.1 million tons on the ferry line in 2008)
title: the  project  aims  to  increase  the  volumes  to  3  million  tons  of  rail  and  intermodal  transport  by  2018.  The  overall  corresponding  modal  shift  is  1.4  billion  ton  km  per  year  in  2018  and  2.1  billion  ton  km  per  year  in  2028.  On  a  cumulated  basis
created: the modal shift is estimated at 21.6 billion ton/km by 2028 (15 years) and 32.6 billion ton/km by 2033 (20 years).

id: The project was completed with a partial outcome and ended in December 2011 at the request of the beneficiaries. The main achievements are the following:
<li><span  style= "color:  #000000; ">Integration  of  the  IT  systems  of  the  Port  of  Trelleborg
title: CargoNet and Scandlines AB.

id: <li><span  style= "color:  #000000; ">Adaptation  of  berths  in  the  port  of  Trellborg  (additional  roadside  ramps
title: wider breakwater)

id: <li><span  style= "color:  #000000; ">Extension  and  improvement  of  the  Port  of  Trelleborg  (reconstruction  of  4  rail  tracks
title: double  rail  shunting  made  possible
created: new areas to handle and temporarily store intermodal units)

id: Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:

.pdf (291.9 KB)

---

Implementation integrated river engineering project Danube East of Vienna

---

Part of Priority Project 18

---

The segment of the Danube River east of Vienna is currently characterised by constant river bed erosion of +/- 2-3.5 cm per year; which has a negative impact on the water resource management and the ecological viability of the Donau-Auen (National Park) ecosystem. Inadequate conditions prevail for navigation (the fairway is too shallow at low water)
topics:

Part of Priority Project 18

This project
topics: part of Priority Project 18 (Waterway axis Rhine/Meuse-Main-Danube)
image: concerns  the  main  bottleneck  in  the  entire  Rhine-Main-Danube  waterway
column8: which  is  from  Straubing  to  Vilshofen.  While  the  rest  of  the  waterway  has  been  adapted  to  2.5  m  water  depth  in  recent  years
column9: the Straubing-Vilshofen section's water depth only reaches 1.6 m at low water levels. A water depth of 2.50 m can be reached only 165 days a year on average.

id: After many years of interdisciplinary studies on the possibilities for improving shipping conditions
title: including  flood  control  and  implementation  of  a  regional  planning  procedure
created: there is no agreement about the variant to be used.

title: the  main  objective  of  this  study  is  to  make  a  concrete  and  independent  assessment  on  the  influence  of  different  measures  on  navigation
created: as  well  as  on  the  environment.  Regional  environmental  impacts  and  the  benefits  of  an  effective  inland  waterway  network  (the  potential  of  shifting  goods  from  road  to  waterways
project_type: pollution reduction) will also be taken into account.

title: the  Federal  Ministry  of  Transport
created: Building  and  Urban  Affairs  (BMVBS)  has  set  up  a  monitoring  group  consisting  of  transport
project_type: economic and environmental experts in connection with the execution of the study.

title: 2007-DE-24040-P
contents:
2007-DE-24040-P

---

Studies and works for the upgrading of the high speed railway line Duisburg-Emmerich

---

Part of Priority Project 24

---

This project is part of the Global Priority Project 24 railway axis Lyon/Genova-Basel-Duisburg-Rotterdam/Antwerpen and aims at upgrading the capacity of the rail track between Emmerich at the Dutch-German border and Oberhausen. These works will address the additional freight traffic arising from the completion since 2007 of the Betuwe Line (Priority Project 5)
topics: which now links the port of Rotterdam with the Dutch-German border.

id: • Study for the construction of a double tracks line for the rail section between Oberhausen-Sterkrade railway station and Grafenbusch;
• Study and works for the installation of ETCS equipment/ electronic interlocking in rail section Emmerich;
• Study and works for increasing the capacity of Emmerich railway station by converting the electric systems;
• Study for the construction of a new triple track line for the rail section between Oberhausen railway station and the German-Dutch border.

The design planning for studies concerning the construction of the double track line between Oberhausen/Sterkrade station and Grafenbusch have progressed and public consultations are expected to take place in 2014. The increase in capacity of the Emmerich railway station and the triple track line for the section between Oberhausen railway station and the German-Dutch border is also progressing. Works are ongoing for the installation of ETCS equipment/ electronic interlocking in rail section Emmerich. Twelve planning approval procedures for the studies for the construction of a new triple track line for the rail section between Oberhausen railway station and the German-Dutch border have been launched.

created: the  electrical  feeding  of  the  rail  lines  will  reduce  or  even  eliminate  the  need  for  shunting  and  fuel  traction  -  reducing  pollution

---

Part of Priority Project 29

---

This Action is part of Priority Project 29 (Railway axis of the Ionian/Adriatic intermodal corridor). Spanning from Kozani to Kalamata it will lead to the increase of the capacity for intermodal links between sea and rail transport. The route aims to connect the major ports in Greece with each other and with the main rail routes to the rest of Europe.

The railway line Patras-Kalamata is part of PP29 and is  divided in two sections (Patras-Pyrgos-Alfios-Olympia and Alfios-Kiparissia-Kalamata) The scope of the studies for the Patras-Kalamata railway line involves improving and upgrading the existing railway line in the two aforementioned sections and the change of its gauge from 1 m to 1.435 m.

The activities include

column8: alignment  and  hydraulic  studies

------

The aim of the project is to prepare the necessary studies for the tender and construction of the section of the Ionian Highway (Western Axis) from Ioannina to Kakavia. It is planned as a four-lane road axis
topics:
with improvements also foreseen for the two-lane continuation from Kalpaki to the frontier station of Kakavia.

The Ionian Highway connects Rio-Antirrio with the port of Igoumenitsa and the Egnatia Highway. The present project in the northern section of the Ionian Highway will satisfy the increased demand for transportation to and from the developing areas of the north-western Balkan peninsula and Albania. Finally
image: in  combination  with  the  other  major  projects  of  Western  Greece
column8: like  the  Rio-Antirrio  Bridge
column9: the  Egnatia  Highway  and  the  Igoumenitsa  and  Patra  Ports

---

Trans-European Satellite Navigation System (Galileo): Development and validation phase

---

Part of Priority Project 15

---

The project aims to complete the Development and Validation phase of the Galileo system by validating space
topics: ground and end-user segments through extensive in-orbit and ground tests.

id: This IOV (In Orbit Validation) Phase is a prerequisite for a successful Deployment Phase for the full constellation of satellites. Moreover it is also necessary to launch the ground segment of the project: Trans-European Satellite Navigation System (Galileo).
The IOV Phase is being managed by the European Space Agency
title: pursuant to the GalileoSat declaration. The GalileoSat declaration provides for an equitable sharing of the funding of the IOV Phase between ESA and the Community. The Financial contribution granted for the Action has been channelled through (i) direct grant to ESA (ii) grants to the Galileo Joint Undertaking (with the GSA becoming the new beneficiary at the end of 2006) which have been used to transfer to ESA community financial contribution for the GalileoSat.

id: Progress of project in line with expectations (project monitored by the European Space Agency).

Lyon-Turin railway project: French accesses to the Base Tunnel

---

Part of Priority Project 6

---

The new freight and passenger rail link between Lyon and Turin
topics: part of Priority Project 6 (railway axis Lyon-Trieste-Divaca/Koper-Divaca-Ljubljana-Budapest-Ukranian border) will act as a key node between both northern and southern Europe (London/Amsterdam/Paris-Milano) and east and west (Lisbon-Budapest). It will considerably shorten travel times for high-speed passenger traffic and provide an environmentally friendly response to the steadily increasing demand for freight transport over the Alps.

id: This project concerns studies on the French access from Lyon to the "Base Tunnel " (section Lyon-Saint Jean de Maurienne). The passenger and freight itinerary will be mixed on the main part of the section
title: except  near  Chambéry
created: where the high speed passenger line will pass through a 15 km tunnel under the Dullin-L'Epine mountains. Freight traffic will avoid the city of Chambéry entirely and will be channelled through the 24 km Chartreuse tunnel.

id: The pre-design studies will look at the alignment of the new railway line (including topographic
title: geological
project_type: technical
contents: environmental
topics: economic
image: socio-economic studies) and preliminary studies for the connections to existing lines.

Studies and Works in the High-Speed Rail Interoperability in Iberian Peninsula (PP19) - Oporto-Vigo Axis: Cross-Border Section Ponte de Lima-Vigo

---

Part of Priority Project 19

---

This project is part of the north/northwest corridor of Priority Project 19 (High Speed Rail Interoperability in the Iberian Peninsula). It covers the design studies and works for the high-speed rail connection between Ponte de Lima (Portugal) and Vigo (Spain)
topics: and is part of the high-speed railway axis between Porto and the Vigo Peninsula.

id: This cross-border section is made up of a double track of around 60 km
title: of which approximately 35 km is located in Portugal and 25 km in Spain. It is designed for mixed traffic (passenger and freight services) and a maximum speed of 250 km/hour.

id: The main objectives of the project are to:
• ensure the interoperability of the Iberian railway system with the rest of Europe
• contribute to the sustainable development of the transport system in the region
• increase the attractiveness of the southwestern Europe and strengthen European cohesion and economic and social integration.

------

The Action "Feasibility Study on international rail real time traffic monitoring and electronic path request systems " constitutes the essential preparatory work for the implementation of Commission Regulation (EC) No 62/2006 of 23 December 2005 concerning the technical specification for interoperability
topics: relating to the telematic applications for freight subsystem of the trans-European conventional rail system (TAF TSI).

id: The main objectives and goals of the Action are:
<li>to  agree  on  common  processes  and  procedures  together  with  the  Railway  Undertakings  in  the  scope  of  short/long  term  path  requests
title: train running forecasts and train running information
on  the  basis  of  the  processes
on  the  basis  of  the  processes  and  of  the  functional  requirements
created: the TAF TSI data flow and format

title: on  the  basis  of  the  specifications
created: the  results:  this  will  be  done  by  several  pilots  in  the  field  of  short/long  term  path  request
project_type: train running forecast and train running information

id: • to analyse the feasibility of the different processes and evaluation of data quality used to fulfil the data exchange required for this process

title: the  TAF  TSI  is  an  open  data  exchange  platform
created: which should support prescribed process rules and messages to be passed amongst the stakeholders.

id: Assessment of the feasibility of the short/long term path requests
title: train running forecasts and train running information is an important step in the realisation of the TSI's requirements.

---

Part of Priority Project 1

---

This project concerns the construction of a new double track high speed rail line for freight and passenger traffic between Kundl/Radfeld and Baumkirchen in the Lower Inn Valley
topics: which is an identified bottleneck of Priority Project 1 (Railway axis Berlin-Verona/Milano-Bologna-Napoli-Messina-Palermo).

id: The project will contribute to the completion of the Brenner Corridor between Munich and Verona
title: in  particular  to  the  northern  access  to  the  Brenner  Base  Tunnel  between  Austria  and  Italy.  Positive  effects  of  removing  this  bottleneck  include  substantial  reductions  in  journey  times
created: a  modal  shift  of  the  freight  traffic  from  road  to  rail
project_type: and consequent reduction of road congestion in the Alpine region.

id: The project supports the construction of 40 km of new double track construction
title: suitable  for  high  speed  rail
project_type: walls
contents: galleries
topics: underground  sections
image: and  other  associated  works
column8: and takes into account all necessary environmental and noise protection requirements.

id: The works proceeded according to the estimated plans and the section became fully operational on 9 December 2012. An official ceremony took place on 26 November 2012 to mark the completion of the works. Both the European Coordinator for Priority Project 1
title: Mr  Pat  Cox
created: and  the  Federal  Minister  of  Transport
project_type: Innovation  and  Technology
contents: Ms  Doris  Bures  attended  the  ceremony.  Only  some  technical  fittings  remain  to  be  completed
topics: mainly  the  sub-station  at  Fritzens

topics: railway axis Berlin-Verona/Milano-Bologna-Napoli-Messina-Palermo.

id: This project foresees the construction of two low-gradient parallel tunnels envisaged mainly for the transport of heavy goods across the Alps. It will run for 55 km from Innsbruck (in Austria) to Franzensfeste/Fortezza (in Italy). Adding the existing Innsbruck railway bypass the entire tunnel through the Alps will be 64 km long
title: the longest underground rail link in the world.

id: The cross-border tunnel across the Alps will remove a major bottleneck in an environmentally sensitive area
title: shifting heavy traffic from road to a high-quality rail service.

the excavation of the main tubes is ongoing in the area of Mauls/Mules and it has exceeded 1 km of length within 2013.

In Austria
created: the excavation of the 1.35 km access tunnel in Ampass was completed in June 2013. A tender to award the works between Tulfes and Pfons was published in October 2013. This contract includes an emergency tunnel parallel to the existing rail bypass in Innsbruck and two tunnels to interconnect the bypass with the main tubes.

Six-lane widening of the A8 federal highway Karlsruhe-Munich
topics:
in the section Pforzheim-Süd/Wurmberg to Heimsheim------

This action regards the upgrade of a bottleneck on the A8 highway Karlsruhe-Munich. The section from Pforzheim-Süd (Wurmberg) to Heimsheim will be widened from four to six lanes. The A8 is an important east-west artery connecting the Rhine valley with Stuttgart region which continues further to Munich and Vienna. It runs parallel to Priority Project 17 (railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava) and serves comparable traffic flows.

id: The significant traffic density in this section requires careful planning of the different stages of construction
title: especially in order not to disturb the traffic flow during realisation of the works.

---

North European ATM Service Concepts - Feasibility study for a North European Functional Airspace Block

------

The North European Functional Airspace Block (NEFAB) contributes to the implementation of the performance targets of the Single European Sky II legislation. It covers the development of necessary actions including airspace re-configuration and integration of airspace provision
topics: to  realise  a  common  ATM  service  concept  in  Northern  Europe.  The  actions  will  mainly  address  feasibility  studies  (e.g.  pre-implementation  activities  such  as  transformation  of  support  functions
image: systems harmonisation etc.).

id: The TEN-T funded action is part of a larger global project. This global project includes also two non EU Member States (Norway
title: Iceland)  which  are  not  beneficiaries  of  TEN-T  financial  aid  but  partners  in  the  NEFAB  project.  The  overall  objective  is  to  contribute  to  increased  flight  efficiency
project_type: a greener environment and cost reductions through an optimised use of infrastructure and harmonised services in the participating States.

id: In a first phase the NEFAB will be defined and formulated. The resulting document shall be the foundation for necessary intra-state agreements by the six countries and authorities concerned. The document will be based on the initial findings from this pre-feasibility study.

title: the project's second phase will produce the feasibility study for developing the NEFAB. The aim of the feasibility study is to define a platform for decision-making regarding the implementation and operation of the FAB as well as to develop a plan for the implementation of deliverables from the SESAR (Single European Sky ATM Research) Master Plan.

id: The feasibility study covers an operational service concept (airspace configuration
title: common  system  and  service  provisions
project_type: risk  and  safety  assessment
contents: legal/regulatory/institutional/social issues and business model and financial arrangements.

2008-PT-92100-P

---

Joao Paulo II Airport Expansion

------

The João Paulo II airport on the Azores island of São Miguel is a regional hub connecting the other islands of the archipelago to mainland Portugal and Europe. The project sets out to eliminate a bottleneck which has limited the flow of passengers in the region and it helps to mitigate the high costs of insularity
topics: fostering  the  strengthening  of  social  cohesion.  By  allowing  airport  capacity  to  be  increased  and  consequently  eliminate  the  growing  degradation  in  service  quality  in  peak  demand  period
image: the project shall benefit the whole ultra peripheral area of the Azores.

id: The project's activities consist of expanding the air terminal's boarding area as well as the airport's apron and build new taxiways (including upgrading the airfield's ground lighting system
title: command  and  control  system
created: air-side  electrical  vaults).  The  increase  in  aircraft  parking  capacity  may  also  make  the  construction  of  a  logistical  platform  in  the  future  feasible
project_type: thus allowing the airport to profit from the air cargo business and the interconnection with the port of Ponta Delgada.

id: Therefore the main objectives of the action are:
• eliminating the existing bottleneck of departures during peak hours and meet demand targets in order to foster tourism
• contributing to a sustainable socio-economic growth of the archipelago by increasing air traffic from adjacent islands as well as from mainland Europe and the rest of the world
• increasing safety conditions and shortening time delays by building a new taxiway

Part of Priority Project 1

The Brenner Base Tunnel is the centrepiece of Priority Project 1
topics:
railway axis Berlin-Verona/Milano-Bologna-Napoli-Messina-Palermo.

The 55 km cross-border tunnel through the Alps will remove a major bottleneck for both freight and passenger transit between Austria and Italy.

This project covers the design of the BBT and the excavation of the exploratory tunnel and the necessary access galleries from several fronts. The exploratory tunnel serves to assess the costs and duration of the construction
image:
as well as to assess more accurately the costs of the overall project by minimising the geological risks.

In addition
column8: the construction of the exploratory tunnels will also serve as an access and drainage system during the works and operation of the main tunnels.

title:
the intermediate access tunnel in Mauls/Mules and the Aica-Mauls/Mules exploratory tunnel were completed in 2009 and 2010 respectively. The excavation of the exploratory tunnel is currently continuing towards the north through the Periadriatic fault.

In Austria
created: the  excavation  of  the  exploratory  tunnel  from  Innsbruck  reached  the  lateral  access  in  Ahrental  in  2012
project_type: and  further  excavation  continued  to  reach  almost  7  km  in  August  2013.  Progress  is  also  taking  place  at  the  lateral  access  in  Wolf:  the  tunnel  to  access  the  disposal  site  at  Padastertal  was  completed  in  2011
contents: and the tunnel to access the site directly from the motorway was finalised in 2012. Further excavations to complete the lateral access in Wolf are ongoing.

The maritime link between Esbjerg
topics: Denmark  and  Zeebrugge
image: Belgium
column8: in  service  since  2005
column9: has provided an intermodal alternative to truck transport between Denmark and the Benelux countries.

id: This project will be further developed into a Benelux-Scandinavia shortsea bridge. The upgrade of the service will consist of the coordinated increase of the frequency on the Zeebrugge-Esbjerg route
title: investment in infrastructure and facilities and the adoption of accompanying measures to foster integration of various parts of the intermodal chain.

id: This includes an increase in service by doubling of the capacity of the ro-ro (roll on
title: roll  off)  connection  between  Esbjerg  and  Zeebrugge.  A  Motorways  of  the  Sea  approach  merits  in  cost  savings  (up  to  some  40%)  and  less  CO<sub>²</sub>  emissions  (58%)  than  the  alternative  road  connection.  In  addition
created: it reduces congestion on very busy parts of the EU road network.

id: The investment in infrastructure and facilities associated with the upgrade of the maritime link consists of a floating ro-ro ramp
title: the  extension  of  an  access  way  in  Esbjerg
project_type: gantry cranes and ICT development in Zeebrugge. The project will give way to major improvements in the handling of goods and attract more goods on the ro-ro based intermodal concept.

2008-EU-21015-P 

---

Motorways of the Sea projects in the Baltic Sea Area Klaipéda-Karlshamn link

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The objective of the action is to increase the share of intermodal transports in the South-East/South-West Baltic Motorways of the Seas link through Klaipéda and Karlshamn.

title: the  operator  of  the  service
project_type: has  already  increased
contents: as  from  May  2009
topics: the  capacity  of  the  link  by  21%.  At  the  same  time
image: the  implementation  of  the  Action  will  considerably  improve  and  enhance  the  capacity  of  unitised  rail  goods  handling  on  the  Swedish  side
column8: as well as providing infrastructure investment in Karlshamn.. The current (2009) intermodal share of the corridor is 18% with the aim to reach the 56% in 2015 and ultimately in 2025 to reach 71%.

id: The activities of the Action will focus on the:
<li>Elaboration  and  implementation  of  a  strategy  to  achieve  modal  shift
title: by conducting market studies

id: <li>Increase  the  loading/unloading  speed  of  containers  to  vessels
title: through the purchase and operation of a new crane in Karlshamn

id: • Reduction of waiting/transit time with the upgrade and modernisation of the Karlshamn RO-RO terminal
• Increase of the efficiency and capacity for trains in Karlshamn through the development of the new shunting yard and the electrification and improvement of the port rail track
• Doubling the container handling capacity by building a new combined terminal
• Preparation for the improvement of hinterland rail connections through the development of design and EIA for the "missing link " Karlshamn-Olofström
• Increase of the efficiency in Klaipéda by improving the quay operability for vessels through the installation of a hydraulic device for RO-RO ferries

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project is progressing as planned:
- The new crane is in operation
- The quay has been strengthened
- The capacity at the ferry terminal has increased
- The new shunting yard is constructed and in operation
- The new combined terminal is constructed and in operation
- The rail track to the port is renovated and electrified
- The Design and Environmental Impact Assessment for the “missing link” Karlshamn–Olofström is ready

serviced by a single Nordic Air Traffic Management Area Control Centre - NUAC------

This project’s overall aim was to reduce costs for the provision of Air Navigation Services (ANS) in Denmark and Sweden. The idea was to align the region’s Air Traffic Management (ATM) with both the European Commission’s Single European Sky (SES) legislation and the respective national strategic guidelines
column8: as well as to integrate the two companies providing ATM services: LFV of Sweden and Naviair of Denmark.

id: The SES legislation provided the foundation for organising European airspace into Functional Airspace Blocks (FABs) according to traffic flows instead of national borders. FABs are important in making European airspace safer and more efficient and will prepare it for the predicted doubling of air traffic levels by 2020.

title: ANS  providers  within  each  FAB  should  coordinate  together  to  ensure  their  airspace  is  correctly  and  efficiently  managed.  For  the  establishment  of  the  Danish  and  Swedish  FAB  and  the  integration  of  the  en-route  areas
created: LFV  and  Naviair  used  the  TEN-T  co-funded  study  to  look  at  the  various  possible  business  cases  for  closer  mutual  cooperation.  When  the  study  was  completed
project_type: they  set  up  an  interim  operational  alliance  which  paved  the  way  for  the  creation  of  NUAC  HB  in  2009
contents: a subsidiary jointly owned by Naviair and LFV.

id: See our TEN-T project implementation successes section for more information.

and upgrading of the installations.

title: 2009-EU-40068-E
contents:
2009-EU-40068-E

---

Airborne Datalink Equipment

------

The Global Project concerns Air Traffic Management (ATM) and aims at the provision of air-ground datalink services throughout Europe. With datalink
topics: aircraft and ground air traffic control systems will communicate more efficiently in order to increase safety and efficiency in the ATM Network. Air-ground datalink services are key enablers identified in the Single European Sky Airspace Research (SESAR) Master Plan for European ATM improvements.

id: The Global Project comprises the implementation of both ground-based and airborne equipment. The objective of the Action is to stimulate the accelerated implementation of the required airborne datalink equipment on aircraft owned by EU-based airspace users in order to provide early benefits to the ATM network.

title: as  beneficiary
created: will  facilitate  EU  based  airspace  users  (airlines)  to  equip  their  aircraft  as  soon  as  possible  with  the  required  airborne  datalink  equipment  in  order  to  accelerate  the  implementation  of  Commission  Regulation  (EC)  No  29/2009.  Airspace  users  that  undertake  to  do  so  vis-à-vis  the  beneficiary  and  produce  the  necessary  evidence
project_type: will  receive  a  financial  contribution  from  the  beneficiary  of  up  to  20%  of  the  total  cost  of  purchasing  and  installing  the  equipment.  These  airspace  users  will  be  the  final
contents: indirect beneficiaries of the financial contribution. Only retrofitting of aircraft that comply with Commission Regulation (EC) No 29/2009 will be eligible.

id: The target number of aircraft to be equipped in the framework of this Action is a minimum of 535
title: based  on  average  cost  estimates  for  the  necessary  airborne  datalink  equipment  of  €180

id: The project has been extended and is progressing in accordance with its new schedule.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (162.5 KB)

title: 2009-EU-40005-E
contents:
2009-EU-40005-E

---

Green and predictable flights – North European Air Navigation Service Providers

------

The project is implemented by the North European ANS Providers (NEAP). It consists of several activities related to the improvement of Air Traffic Management (ATM) systems in the region. The action is aiming at the reduction of environmental impact from aviation as well as to increase the predictability during various phases of flight by modernising ATM infrastructure
topics: including  ground-ground  networks  (TCP-IP  connectivity)
image: Performance  Based  Navigation  (PBN)  procedures  and  airborne  systems  and  stepwise  upgrade  of  current  ATM  systems  to  integrate  various  enablers  such  as  Datalink
column8: Arrival  Management  (AMAN)
column9: ADS-B etc.

id: • increase the cost-efficiency of Air Navigation Service (ANS) operations by 30% by 2020 compared to current situation
• align the unit rate for customers to be 25% lower in comparison with European average by 2020
title: whilst increasing the quality of service to the airspace users

id: • decrease or at least maintain the current number of safety-critical ATM-induced incidents per year
• increase capacity in the region to support predicted traffic growth
• reduce amount of emissions attributable to ATM inefficiencies to 1% by 2020
Therefore the main objectives of the project are:
• reduce the long term costs for surveillance infrastructure
• increase the number of "green approaches and departures " as well as free-routes by introducing modified procedures and ATC (Air Traffic Control) tools
• introduce Datalink to support increased automation
• connect regional ANSPs via a TCP-IP based intranet
• provide a foundation for validating and introducing a SESAR compliant concept
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (207.5 KB)

Expansion of Berlin Brandenburg International Airport

------

The expansion of the existing airport Berlin Schönefeld to the Berlin Brandenburg International (BBI) airport is an important development for the German capital and the State of Brandenburg. The initial capacity in 2011 will be between 22 - 25 million passengers per year
topics: with future forescasts of to up to 40 million. This requires inter alia the establishment of an appropriate passenger terminal
image: which is the subject of this Action.

id: The Action comprises structural works for the core and shell of steel and glass of the passenger terminal building as well as the piers.
The central axis of the terminal will be in the east-west direction
title: which  corresponds  to  the  central  axis  of  the  airport  system.  Beneath  this  a  railway  station  will  be  located.  In  future  stages  of  expansion
created: the terminal concept can be supplemented by up to two satellite terminals. The structural design of the facility ensures high flexibility regarding functional requirements and future expansion of the airport. The terminal building forms the focal point of the facility as a whole.

contents:

---

Main Road 5 between Lusi and Mikkeli (lacking road improvements)

------

The Action concerns the improvement of 24 km of the main road 5 between Lusi and Mikkeli. Some sections are constituted by a narrow two-lane road (8 m wide) with poor geometry and visibility and where safe overtaking is impossible. Currently the majority of the road junctions are road level junctions and only a few of them are grade-separated.

title: such  as  the  construction  of  grade-separated  interchanges
project_type: underpasses and parking areas.

title: the following improvement activities are foreseen:

id: • Construction of six new passing lanes and improving the four existing ones
• Building three road sections with a new alignment
• Building 24 km of parallel roads for pedestrians
title: cyclists and slow agricultural traffic

id: • Road-lighting - between Koirakivi and Vihantasalmi and at the grade-separated junctions of Uutela and Toivola
• Building a 40 km elk-proof fence near the new passing lanes (an almost continuous fence on both sides of the road)
The main objectives of the Action are to:
• ensure fast and undisturbed connections for public transport
• improve the connections and safety of pedestrians and cyclists
• eventually be able to increase the speed limit to 100 km/h

000 tons)---

---

Priority Project 30 (Seine-Scheldt) aims at improving the link between the Seine and Scheldt rivers to allow class Va vessels to complete the route between Paris and Ghent.

id: The main objectives of the Action is the completion of an exploratory study
title: which will provide a better understanding of the possibility and of the effects of upgrading the Upper-Seascheldt and the Southern Ghent Ring Canal to a class Va waterway.

id: The study will investigate which bottlenecks prevent this waterway from allowing class Va vessels to navigate it and how these bottlenecks can be resolved.
The Action will be divided into different phases:
• Inventory of the current nautical situation and analysis of the bottlenecks
• Feasibility study and proposal of possible alternatives
• Selection of optimum alternative by means of socio-economic cost-benefit analysis

title: pilot projects);

id: • Study of the navigability and the effects on the Upper-Seascheldt between Melle and Gentbrugge
Specific attention will be given to the environmental impacts. Future River Information Services will also be taken in to account in order to anticipate future evolutions.

topics: Oudenaarde  and  Kerkhove  were  built  the  1920s  and  are  thus  old.  Furthermore  in  case  of  malfunction
image: there  is  no  alternative  route  for  barges.  These  locks  have  also  reached  their  maximum  capacity
column8: with  a  passage  of  approximately  11  million  tons/year.  Because  of  the  limited  draught  at  the  lock  sills
column9: these locks obstruct the growth of the ship dimensions.

title: larger  vessels  will  be  able  to  pass  these  locks
created: making  inland  shipping  economically  more  attractive.  Moreover
project_type: by  keeping  the  existing  locks  in  operation

topics: inland shipping on this important axis from France to Ghent will become more economically attractive.

id: To be able to start the construction of the new locks in 2012

title: 2009-EU-90002-S
contents:
2009-EU-90002-S

---

Baltic Transport Outlook 2030

------

The Baltic Sea Region is facing an increasing trade
topics: both  within
image: into  and  from  the  Baltic  Sea.  This  development  means  that  an  appropriate  infrastructure  needs  to  be  in  place.  By  addressing  improved  accessibility  and  disparities  between  the  Member  States  in  the  region
column8: Norway  and  the  northwestern  regions  of  the  Russian  Federation
column9: the competitiveness of the Baltic Sea Region could be enhanced.

id: Solid data on current and future transport and traffic flows is vital to the quality of investment decisions in transport infrastructure. However
title: information  on  these  flows  is  currently  scattered  between  countries  and  different  modes  of  transport.  Different  forecast  figures  are  used  in  the  different  countries.  A  comprehensive  high-quality  multimodal  study  of  all  intra  and  extra  transport  flows  and  traffic  flows  in  the  whole  Baltic  Sea  Region
created: and  of  infrastructure  status  and  bottlenecks
project_type: would provide a basis for a much needed macro regional perspective in transport planning.

title: this  project  initiated  by  the  Swedish  Ministry  of  Enterprise
created: Energy and Communication will study the flow of freight and analyse the infrastructure for all modes of transport with an outlook to the year 2030. The development of a Baltic Transport Outlook is a way to jointly prepare for more common actions based on joint knowledge which is in line with the aim of the EU Strategy for the Baltic Region.

id: The Port currently has long queues during rush hours between the short sea terminal
title: “Terminal  Roulier”
created: and  the  E40  highway.  Truck  traffic  generated  by  the  Ro-Ro  line  between  Dunkerque  and  Dover  enters  a  road  with  intense  urban  traffic.  The  bottlenecks
project_type: a  railway  crossing  and  two  roundabouts

topics: insufficient safety and air pollution.

id: The objectives of this Action are to optimise the port accessibility
title: to  increase  safety
project_type: and to develop sustainable and efficient traffic management by separating local traffic from truck traffic.

id: These objectives can be achieved by the construction of bridges over crossways
title: the  construction  of  a  road  junction
created: and the installation of a numeric direction traffic sign systems.

The Action consists of a series of studies to support the preparation of infrastructural improvement of the Northern Italy Waterway System. It is part of a global project which is also being supported through another TEN-T grant for works (2009-IT-00033-E). The global project generally aims at the development of the Po River and connected canals towards class Va and at its multimodal interconnection with existing road
topics: rail and sea network of European relevance. The activities are:

id: • Elaboration of a Master Plan to provide a framework for the implementation of the global project for the development of the Northern Italy inland waterways (from the Porto Nogaro Port in Friuli Venezia Giulia region to Cremona Inland Port in Lombardy) with a mid-term perspective.
<li>Executive  design  of  works  for  adaptation  to  class  V  of  the  Fissero-Tartaro-CanalBianco  canal
title: in particular works to increase the head room under the bridges.

id: <li>Definitive  design  of  the  free  stream  of  the  Po  River  from  Cremona  to  the  intersection  with  the  Mincio  river.  In  order  to  reduce  the  impact  of  the  natural  variations  in  water  levels  and  increase  navigability  in  the  Po  River  from  200/240  to  300/320  days/year
title: free stream adaptation works are necessary.

id: <li>Definitive  Design  of  Restructuring  of  Porto  Levante.  Porto  Levante  represents  a  relevant  interchange  point  between  the  Canal  and  the  Adriatic  sea
title: where transhipment operations are implemented. The restructuring and enlargement of the facilities will make possible to tranship the freight from/to big deep-sea vessels to smaller barges and river vessels.

2009-LT-91600-S

---

Feasibility study and environmental impact assessment of Klaipeda port expansion constructing the outer port

------

Klaipeda State Seaport (KSS) is a rapidly growing TEN-T A Category port. In terms of cargo handled per year
topics: the  port  is  a  leader  among  the  EU  ports  on  the  Eastern  coast  of  Baltic  Sea  and  strongly  competing  with  non-EU  ports.  With  an  8%  average  growth  during  the  last  10  years
image: throughput already reached 30 million tonnes in 2008. A study in 2004 estimated that the capacity limit of the port is 34 million tonnes.

title: following  the  suggestions  made  in  the  pre-feasibility  study
created: the  construction  of  an  open  sea  outer  port  next  to  the  existing  port  entrance  was  decided
project_type: in order to:

id: • Build a Liquefied Natural Gas import terminal
• Improve quality of life of Klaipeda citizens since the new outer port will be beyond the city boundaries
• Increase competitiveness of KSS since it will be able to accommodate vessels requiring more than 15 metres depth (current max depth)
In this context the main objectives of the Action are:
• To assess the feasibility of the outer port and to draft design proposals for the preparation of the technical drawings of the outer port infrastructure and interfaces with land transport system
• To carry out an environmental impact assessment (EIS) of the Klaipeda port expansion
On the basis of the results of the Action
title: if  the  outer  port  is  feasible  and  the  EIA  is  positive
created: the  detailed  plan  of  the  outer  port  will  be  prepared.  Later
project_type: the  technical  design  for  the  construction  of  the  outer  port  will  be  prepared.  Finally
contents: the construction of the outer port will take place. These subsequent activities are not covered by the current decision.

Nordic Triangle-Malmö C - Completetion works

---

Part of Priority Project 12

---

The Action is part of Priority Project 12 (Nordic Triangle railway/road axis). The Global Project is the construction of Malmö central station ( "Malmö C ")
topics: and it is strongly connected to the Malmö Citytunnel project which has received support under the 2001-2006 and 2007-2013 TEN-T programmes.

id: The reconstructed Malmö C and the Malmö Citytunnel are connected to the South Main Line (connecting Stockholm and Göteborg/Oslo) as well as to the Öresund Fixed link to Copenhagen and Ystad/Trelleborg (ports to Germany and Poland).
Currently Malmö Station is a terminus station
title: meaning that trains arriving to the station must change direction before departure. After the reconstruction works Malmö Central will allow through services connected to Malmö Citytunnel.

id: Since the completion of the Öresund fixed link the rail system in Southern Sweden lacks capacity because of the increased demand for passenger and freight rail service: thousands of Danish and Swedish citizens commute daily in the region
title: with freight trains from the north of Sweden heading for Denmark and Germany also demanding more capacity. There is a critical bottleneck at Malmö.

id: The reconstruction of Malmö C together with the completion of Malmö Citytunnel will eliminate the abovementioned bottleneck and considerably improve the situation for the regional commuter trains in southern Sweden.

title: 2005-SE-91401-S
contents:
2005-SE-91401-S 

---

ERTMS Test section for Botniabanan 2005-2007

------

European Rail Traffic Management System (ERTMS)
topics: composed  of  a  unique  European  Train  Control  System  (ETCS)  and  radio  system  GSM-R
image: is designed to gradually replace the existing incompatible national systems throughout Europe.

id: Sweden's Botniabanan is an important link ensuring reliable freight transport between the peripheral regions of the northern part of Scandinavia and the central part of Europe.

The objective of the project was to prepare a test section in order to have a railway line equipped with ERTMS and an engine with the appropriate equipment to perform onsite testing. Lack of traffic on the line during the project's duration was to give a unique opportunity for performing the tests. The test section was to cover the 18 km long part of the railway line between Arnäsvall and Husum.

The performance of tests will contribute to the successful deployment of the ERTMS on the entire Botniabanan line. Installation of the ERTMS will significantly improve the capacity of the line. Moreover
title: the development of the line will greatly improve the flexibility and access to passenger services for the cities along Sweden's east coast.

id: Total project cost covered by this Decision:

The BLUE MED project is pursuing the implementation of a Functional Airspace Block (FAB) in the southeast Mediterranean Area
topics: in  accordance  with  the  requirements  of  the  Single  European  Sky
image: to  be  put  in  operation  within  2012  and  with  2015  as  target  date  for  full  FAB  operations. During  this  project
column8: the Republic of Albania joined as Associated Partner and the Kingdom of Jordan and Lebanon as Observers.

id: The outcome of this study led to a political engagement of the Partner States in pooling their airspace with the aim to build one FAB over the study area. This Action will identify all necessary activities
title: implementation  and  validation  processes  to  be  performed
created: in  order  to  prepare  the  following   "Implementation  Phase "  of  the  Project.  As  a  final  step
project_type: a  Go/No-Go  decision  based  on  the  results  of  the   "Definition  Phase "  will  be  taken  by  all  concerned  National  Authorities
contents: in order to acknowledge the existence of all the prerequisites for the beginning of the implementation.

created: Egypt  and  Tunisia  are  involved  as  full  partners  and  are  under  the  obligation  to  follow  all  project  phases  and  perform  all  project  activities  in  strict  coordination  with  the  Beneficiaries.  Regarding  the  Kingdom  of  Jordan  and  Lebanon
project_type: they  are  being  involved  as  observers

Implementation of RIS in Flanders III

------

Flanders has over 1
topics: 000  km  of  navigable  inland  waterways  and  in  2010
image: more than 69 million tonnes were transported over water in Flanders.

id: River Information Services (RIS) are customised information services for inland waterway transport and make it possible to co-ordinate logistical processes with actual transport situations on a constant basis. RIS play a key role in making cargo transport and passenger services on waterways more efficient and ecologically sound while
title: at  the  same  time
Waterwegen  en  Zeekanaal  NV  and  NV  De  Scheepvaart
created: came  to  a  co-operation  agreement  that  foresaw  a  number  of  initiatives  concerning  shipping  control  and  automated  water  management  in  Flanders.  These  initiatives  were  the  start  of  a  continuous  process  to  comply  with  the  needs  of  the  waterway  users  and  to  take  into  account  the  latest  technological  developments.  Since  2008
project_type: both former projects (RIS in Flanders I and RIS in Flanders II) received European co-financing.

id: This action is the third phase of the implementation of RIS in Flanders.  It focuses on the optimisation of existing RIS-related processes and in particular a site survey of inland waterways
title: including  some  bathymetry
created: a  new  tool  for  querying  and  visualising  RIS  information
project_type: the  optimisation  of  the  global  architecture  of  the  system
contents: the equipment of additional vessels with inland IAS and  electronic payments.

title: it  completes  RIS  in  Flanders  I  and  II  and  aims  at  extending  the  range  of  RIS  services  in  Flanders  as  well  as  extending  RIS  to  other  parties  than  the  skipper
created: making  inland  navigation  a  more  attractive
project_type: safe and efficient mode of freight transport.

id: The project is on-going. Service vessels have been equipped. 55% of inland waterways have been surveyed and work on the electronic payment and electronic reporting is ongoing.
