---

Adriatic Motorways of the Sea (ADRIAMOS)

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The Action aims at enhancing a viable
topics: regular  and  reliable  sea-based  transport  service  integrated  in  the  logistic  chain  along  the  Adriatic-Ionian  transport  corridor  between  the  port  of  Venice  and  the  Ionian  Sea/West  Greece  port  cluster  (Igoumenitsa  and  Patras)  and  so  contributing  to  reduce  economic
image: social and environmental costs related to port and logistics activities.

id: • Facilitating coherent traffic quality and logistic chain integration

The Action consists in infrastructure and facilities investments (works and studies) necessary to remove bottlenecks and to improve efficiency of the logistic chain on the Adriatic-Ionian corridor. The Action intends to support the transport of trucks
title: unaccompanied trailers and cars by Roll on-Roll off (RoRo) and Ro-Pax ships between the north Adriatic area and the cluster of Greek ports of Igoumenitsa and Patras. This will strengthen the efficiency of transport services between the two areas and further foster modal shift from road to maritime transport.

id: In the Port of Venice the intervention will regard the realisation of a new RoRo terminal in the Fusina area in order to move traffic away from the city centre. The new terminal will host all the RoRo vessels calling the port of Venice and will play a central role as logistic park directly linked to rail network to collect and distribute goods loaded and unloaded from the vessels.

title: the  action  foresees  the  completion  of  preliminary  studies  for  the  establishment  of  a  freight  village  in  the  Thesprotia  region
created: serving freight transport to and from the Adriatic.

title: with  certain  delays  which
project_type: are not expected to affect the completion of the Action within the foreseen time schedule. The North basin of the new Ro-Ro terminal will be operational as from 1 June 2014.

title: 2011-EU-21002-P
contents:
2011-EU-21002-M

---

On Shore Power Supply - an integrated North Sea network

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The project objective is to establish onshore power supply (OPS) at three DFDS freight ferry terminals for three freight ferries (ro-ro vessels) that frequently call the terminals. The terminals and ships form part of DFDS' freight shipping network in the North Sea.

id: The project includes installations and infrastructure needed onshore and on board for a standard 50 Hz solution. It would allow the ships to be connected to onshore power for around 100 hours per week and thus significantly contribute to reducing the polluting emissions from auxiliary engines whilst berthed.
The project falls under PP21 and addresses the environmental challenges of Motorways of the Sea
title: in  particular  in  view  of  the  implementation  requirements  of  Annex  VI  of  the  IMO's  MARPOL  Convention.  In  addition
created: it  connects  to  the  'sustainable  growth'  objective  of  the  Europe  2020  strategy  and  contributes  to  achieving  the  climate/energy  targets
project_type: which in turn lead to the decarbonisation of transport.

id: The open capacity at the berths equipped with OPS will be made available to other short-sea/deep-sea operators in order to maximise the environmental benefit of the installation. Monitoring equipment
title: including  watt  meters
created: will be installed at each terminal to monitor and charge for the OPS electricity consumed.

title: the high frequency short sea-routes (Motorways of the Sea) across the North Sea will be more attractive to companies that have an ambition to reduce their carbon footprint and emissions from transport. It will furthermore contribute to a greener image of the short-sea sector.
the project will aim to give guidance to policymakers to help create a standard 50 Hz solution for OPS so that new facilities could be widely installed and extended to a 60Hz solution.

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

TrainMoS aims at supporting and training the human element of Motorways of the Sea by defining the basis for a future EU virtual open MoS University and by pulling together local competences and knowledge of different EU universities along with stakeholders' needs.

id: TrainMoS will develop an MoS knowledge base at EU university level by testing an e-learning MoS knowledge platform (within an ICT learning infrastructure) through the preparation of seven EU wide pilot actions by seven Member States (Spain
title: Portugal
project_type: Germany
contents: United  Kingdom
topics: Italy
image: and Greece). The participation of the seven universities and their students will create a critical mass which will allow for the development and testing of a European academic module in 7 MoS related subjects that should meet the needs of the freight transport industry actors.

id: Each pilot action will be developed under the following titles: Port terminals and hinterland links; Smart cities and intelligent ports; Green ports and efficient ICZM; Multimodality and sustainable logistics; Multimodal transport economics; Safety and security; and Logistic Chains and Modal Integration.

title: coordinated  by  the  TrainMoS  structure  and  taking  into  consideration  stakeholders'  needs
created: will feed the MoS Knowledge ICT Platform and produce university level courses which could be followed by students in the seven Universities with lecturing professors coming both from the University and stakeholders.

---

LNG in Baltic Sea Ports

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The aim of the proposed action is to develop a harmonised approach towards LNG bunker filling infrastructure in the Baltic Sea region. By sharing knowledge between 7 Baltic partner ports (Aarhus
topics: Helsingborg
image: Helsinki
column8: Malmö-Copenhagen
column9: Tallinn
column10: Turku
column11: Stockholm)  from  4  countries  and  their  stakeholders
column12: a more standardised process for planning and constructing LNG infrastructure shall be achieved.

id: The proposed action builds on previous activities and foresees pre-investment studies directly preparing for investments in LNG bunkering infrastructure in the ports. The actual infrastructure investments will be made at a later stage.

title: a stakeholder platform will be initiated to gather the key actors from the Baltic Sea but also from the North Sea around the same table and secure dissemination of the project process and results. The participating ports will build on existing knowledge in the field and will share their experience and findings. The practical outcome of this cooperation will be a guidebook that will function as a benchmark for other ports and stakeholders and for other regions in Europe.

id: The project is expected to contribute significantly to the implementation of the Baltic Sea Strategy (COM(2009)248) which underlines that the Baltic Sea region should turn into a model region for 'clean shipping' and a range of measures should be aimed at reducing the environmental impact of maritime transport.
The project is ongoing and will be finalised in December 2014. The activity taking place is Helsinki
title: Stockholm and Copenhagen-Malmo have been completed. The activities in Turku and Tallinn will most probably be completed with a limited scope due to delays in procurement and other administrative reasons.

COSTA

---

The COSTA Action aims at developing framework conditions for the use of LNG for ships in the Mediterranean
topics: Atlantic  Ocean  and  Black  Sea  areas.  It  will  result  in  preparing  an  LNG  Masterplan  for  short  sea  shipping  between  the  Mediterranean  Sea  and  North  Atlantic  Ocean  as  well  as  the  Deep  Sea  cruising  in  the  North  Atlantic  Ocean  towards  the  Azores  and  the  Madeira  Island.  The  feasibility  study  results  will  promote  Motorways  of  the  Sea  sustainability
image: contributing  to  the  common  effort  addressing  climate  change
column8: in particular in view of the forthcoming requirements with respect to the implementation of the requirements of Annex VI of the MARPOL Convention.

id: The project will complement the results of the on-going LNG North Sea and Baltic project 2010-EU-21112-S. This will all increase the potential of Motorways of the Sea by lowering transport costs and reducing CO2
title: NOx  and  SOx  emissions
created: in  conjunction  with  greening  the  transport  corridors  and  using  of  LNG  as  an  alternative  to  marine  bunker.  If  COSTA's  policy  recommendations  are  implemented
project_type: it is expected that CO2 emissions from shipping could drop by 25% in 2020 and by 50% in 2050. For the air pollutants the use of LNG would eliminate SOx and reduce NOx by 90%.

2011-EU-21010-M

---

Green Bridge on Nordic Corridor

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The Action is built around the piloting equipment of two large
topics: multi-engine  RoPax  ships  with  exhaust  gas  cleaning  technologies
image: in  form  of  wet-scrubbers  and  the  preparation  of  the  corridor  for  operating  next  Baltic  RoRo/RoPax  ship  generation.  To  allow  efficient  future  handling  of  the  modified  ferries  and  to  ensure  most  flexible  and  smooth  port  operations
column8: ferry  berths  in  all  three  ports  have  to  be  re-constructed.  In  Trelleborg  also  port  navigation  conditions  (breakwaters
column9: water depths) will be adjusted to the dimensions of the converted ships.

id: The Action further includes installation of shore side electricity in the ports of Travemünde and Trelleborg. Together with the environmental performance upgrades and operational improvement respectively extension of the intermodal terminal capacity in Rostock and Trelleborg
title: the Action will contribute to a better integration of the upgraded maritime services within multimodal transport chains.
the  Action's  port  and  intermodal  terminal  works  will  contribute  to  the  elimination  of  future  transport  bottlenecks
created: the enhancement of modal shift towards combined rail-sea transport solutions and the reduction of road congestion along the Nordic corridor. By the introduction of greenhouse gas and air pollution technologies on the vessels and in the ports a considerable reduction of the external burden to the society is expected: the ports and shipping line will be enabled to meet future environmental requirements.

id: The Action will deliver technical and environmental benchmarks for other ports and RoRo shipping lines not only in the Baltic
title: but also elsewhere. Disseminations of the experiences with the green technology will be shared with the industry and society.

id: Although the overall actual progress of the Action is higher than expected
title: only  half  of  the  activities  of  the  Action  are  expected  to  be  fully  completed  by  Dec  2014.  Due  to  higher  than  expected  costs
created: and  to  significantly  longer  planning  and  negotiation  processs
project_type: only  one  vessel  will  be  fitted  with  scrubber  and  OPS  before  the  end  of  the  Action.  In  addition
contents: port  works  in  Lübeck-Travemünde  and  in  Rostock  are  planned  to  be  completed  only  with  20%  and  5%  respectively
topics: mainly due to low vessel time at berth and economic (feasibility) reasons.

---

Implementation of RIS on the Westerscheldt River II

------

The Westerscheldt is a very busy navigation area used by both sea-going and inland barges. The monitoring of the traffic has to be gradually increased and made more accurate through improved communication with the different players. At the same time
topics: cross-border data exchange has become more important due to the increased traffic and routes.

title: the proposed action which follows up on the previous TEN-T funded Action RIS in the Westerscheldt (2008-EU-30001-P) aims to strengthen safety in an increasingly dense mixed traffic area (where both sea-going vessels and inland barges navigate) by improving the monitoring of vessel traffic in the River Scheldt region. This will be achieved by implementing a better performing Vessel Traffic Management and Information Services (VTMIS) software
created: integrating  maritime  and  inland  vessel  traffic  services.  The  action  will  also  extend  the  range  of  available  RIS  technologies  such  as  an  enhanced  Fairway  Information  Service  Portal
project_type: and a "state of the art " tracking and tracing software application based on Radar and Automatic Identification System (AIS) according to the RIS guidelines.

id: Some of the main activities will be based on the outcome of other EU funded projects such as Platina (FP7)
title: implementing tools for a better cross-border exchange of data between the different authorities in the River Scheldt and the neighbouring regions.

title: define  and  validate  a  baseline  independent
project_type: including the roles and obligations of the different stakeholders;

<li>improve  the  performance  and  the  interoperability  (IOP)  features  of  the  telecommunication  link
title: including the development of packet switching/GPRS and GSM-R compatibility testing;

id: • set up clear electromagnetic compatibility (EMC) limits to allow a rapid check of compatibility of locomotives with different types of axle counters;
• develop technical specifications to overlay Automatic Train Operation (ATO) with ETCS.
All activities are on-going. A number of TSI CCS related tasks
title: incl. support for ERA Change Control Management process completed.

title: 2011-EU-60009-S
contents:
2011-EU-60009-S

---

Simulation Environment for Fast ERTMS Validation

------

The action aims to develop a Simulation Environment for Fast ERTMS Validation (SEFEV)
topics: being a supplier-independent and community-owned ERTMS validation platform for various ERTMS-related tests. The tool shall provide a transparent test environment for the development of a single test procedure to validate ERTMS equipped on-board units on ERTMS equipped lines.

id: The community-based ERTMS test environment shall be achieved by using public data representation and software/hardware interfaces. The SEFEV platform will implement Baselines 2 and 3 and will be suitable for both off-site (laboratory) as well as on the line testing including real-time validation of ERTMS implementations.
Laboratory Architecture and Database as well as Hardware Design of EVC interfaces and Robot completed. Other tasks ongoing. Dedicated project web-site operational.

title: 2009-EU-21010-P
contents:
2009-EU-21010-P

---

Baltic Link Gdynia-Karlskrona

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The objective of the Action is to implement the Motorways of the Sea project in the Baltic Sea Region through the ports of Karlskrona and Gdynia. The project will reduce the amount of freight using the northern European motorways and will diminish the related road congestion.

id: The Action will deliver high-quality Motorways of the Sea infrastructure and services by combining the rail and sea modes of transport in order to eliminate the existing bottlenecks and to create a seamless intermodal transport chain. The project's result is expected to be an increase in the intermodal share of the corridor from the current 3% to 10% in 2015 and 36% in 2025.
The activities of the Action will focus on the following particular objectives
title: namely to:

id: • Increase the train capacity for goods on the Scandinavian and Polish side
• Eliminate inadequate intermodal capacity on the Karlskrona-Gdynia link taking an important step towards an intermodal transport chain connecting Scandinavia with central Europe and the Adriatic Sea

title: Karlskrona and Gdynia that will concentrate transport flows and achieve rail bound volumes that are economically profitable

id: <li>Promote  intermodal  solutions  on  their  respective  markets  that  can  mitigate  road  congestion
title: particularly in Germany

id: • Eliminate conflict of interest between freight and passenger trains between Gothenburg and Karlskrona/Kalmar on the coast-to-coast line in Sweden
• Offer a missing link to TEN-T corridors by further connecting the Baltic Sea in a north-south dimension
• Harmonise the IT systems between the ports and other operators by further developing the Stena Line e-freight platform and move towards Single window
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:

.pdf (256.3 KB)

The intermodal terminal Wörgl is part of the TEN-T Priority Project 1 (rail axis Berlin–Verona/Milan–Bologna–Naples–Messina–Palermo) in the section Kufstein–Innsbruck. The project comprises the construction of modal interchange station between road and rail via the construction of a new rail main line (including loading siding) in the area of the municipality of Kundl.

id: The project reduces environmental impacts of traffic by relieving road transport particularly traffic from heavy goods vehicles and improving the balance between the transport modes in favour of the more environmental friendly ones.
Apart from the reduction of CO2 emissions from freight transport
title: the  project  will  considerably  contribute  to  the  elimination  of  the  existing  freight  capacity  bottleneck  on  the  Brenner  axis
created: thereby increasing the overall capacity on the TEN-T Priority Project 1. This will also ensure a more efficient handling of the current freight traffic flows and those to be expected in the future on the railway line.

title: the following activities are included in the project:

id: • construction of truck parking areas including infrastructure access facilities
• construction of a new railway main line including loading side line
• trackside development of the terminal Wörgl to create additional loading capacities

River Information Services (RIS) are customised information services for inland waterway transport that make it possible to co-ordinate logistical processes with actual transport situations on a constant basis. RIS play a key role in making cargo transport and passenger services on waterways more efficient and ecologically sound while
topics: at  the  same  time
image: increasing traffic safety.

title: Waterwegen  en  Zeekanaal  NV  and  NV  De  Scheepvaart
created: came to a co-operation agreement that foresaw a number of initiatives concerning shipping control and automated water management in Flanders. These initiatives were the beginning of a continuous process to comply with the needs of the waterway users and to take into account the latest technological developments.

id: The current project focuses on additional investments on WLAN
title: Fairway  Information  Services  and  extended  applications.  Some  extra  work  are  done  on  the  internal  systems  of  the  waterway  managers  and  port  authorities
created: in order to offer a wider range of RIS services to skippers. Hence the basic building blocks for RIS in Flanders will be further complemented with specific applications.

id: Studies/works are presently carried out by the two Flemish inland waterway managers (Waterwegen en Zeekanaal NV
title: NV  De  Scheepvaart)
project_type: and the Flemish sea ports of Antwerp and Gent in order to enhance the level of RIS services in Flanders. Some actions concerning communication are also performed by the Flemish promotion centre for inland navigation "Promotie Binnenvaart Vlaanderen ".

The Albert Canal: Rebuilding the Briegden and Oelegem I bridges

------

The Albert Canal is the most important waterway in Flanders
topics: having  a  transport  capacity  of  ±40  million  tonnes  and  belonging  to  the  trans-European  inland  waterways  network.  It  connects  Antwerp  with  Liège
image: or rather the Scheldt with the Meuse. An important portion of the traffic consists of container transport.

id: The Albert Canal also provides opportunities for short sea shipping. It is therefore important to adapt the Albert Canal’s infrastructure to the anticipated growth of container transport as well as facilitate the accessibility for short sea shipping.
The aim of this Action was to rebuild the Briegden and Oelegem I bridges to a height of 9.1 meters and widen the canal to a width of 86 meters.

Liège CAREX: studies with a view to the construction of a railport on the Liège Airport site

------

Currently
topics: long  distance  express  and  conventional  air  freight  arriving  in  European  airports  must  be  redistributed  throughout  Europe  according  to  each  customer's  distribution  networks.  Short  distance  air  transport  and  road  transport  are  the  only  possibilities  for  distribution
image: at  a  European  scale
column8: in  line  with  both  the  freight  volumes  handled  and  the  specific  requirements  of  freight.  The  CAREX  project  represents  a  concrete  high  speed  railway  alternative
column9: capable  of  fulfilling  the  strictest  requirements  of  air  freight
column10: while considerably reducing the impact of the pre- and post-air transport concerned.

title: including  Lyon
project_type: London
contents: Amsterdam  and  Liège
topics: aims at improving intermodal transport and in particular to shift freight from air and road to rail mode.

id: Within the coordinated scope of Euro CAREX
title: Liège  CAREX  aims  to  carry  out  the  construction  of  a  trimodal  railport  (air
project_type: road).  This  will  constitute  a  link  in  the  future  European  express  rail  freight  network
contents: travelling on the high speed lines and offering a viable alternative to the short-distance intra-European flights and to express road freight.

id: The proposed Action is composed of 3 activities
title: covering  all  the  studies  that  will  lead  to  the  completion  of  the  Liège  railport.  These  studies  will  cover  all  the  technical  and  financial  aspects
created: which  will  create  the  basis  for  the  future  construction  works  of  the  Liège  Railport.  Through  this  Action
project_type: Liège  takes  a  lead  role  in  the  Euro  CAREX  Network
contents: by being the first site to propose the finalisation of the studies and the concrete implementation of the terminal.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The technical studies for the construction of the Liège Railport have all started in 2013. Public procurement procedures for the socio-economic study have been concluded at the end of 2013 and the study is expected to be completed by the end of 2014. Project management activities are ongoing.

title: 2011-BE-93067-P
contents:
2011-BE-93067-P 

---

The Albert Canal: lifting of bridges and upgrading to class VIb

------

The global project has two aims the first is the lifting of all the bridges over the Albert Canal to a clearance height of 9.10 m. (after this bridge elevation
topics: four-layer  container  transport  on  the  Albert  Canal  will  be  possible
image: and  the  Albert  Canal  will  become  more  easily  accessible  for  Short  Sea  Shipping).  The  second  is  the  expansion  of  the  wet  section  (width  x  water  depth)  of  the  Albert  Canal  between  Wijnegem  and  Antwerp  up  to  a  minimum  of  380  m²  (after  this  expansion
column8: the  Albert  Canal  will  be  accessible  for  Class  VI  ships  over  its  entire  length
column9: from Antwerp to Liège).

id: The Action has 4 main objectives. The first is the reconstruction of the bridges at Viersel (including widening the navigable width under the bridge)
title: Olen  Hoogbuul  and  Meerhout  Veedijk  (widening  the  navigable  width  will  be  done  in  the  next  phase  and  is  not  included  in  this  action.  Secondly  the  lifting  the  E-34  bridges  at  Ranst  (no  widening  applies).  Thirdly  lifting  the  push-tow  lock  bridges  at  Olen
project_type: Hasselt and Diepenbeek (no widening applies). Finally the reconstruction of the 300 m banks at Schoten and Merksem with the construction of new dam wall and intention of deepening the Albert Canal at those locations in the future in order to realise a wet section of at least 380 m².

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project is encountering several delays on different activities but most of the activities are expected to be completed by end of 2014 except the construction of the Olen-Hoogbuul bridge which is expected to be completed in May 2015.

title: 2011-BE-93072-P
contents:
2011-BE-93072-P

---

Increase of under bridge-clearance on the Walloon section of Seine-Scheldt (PP-30) waterway network in order to allow continuous passage of containerships with up to three layers

---

Part of Priority Project 30

---

The main objectives of the Global Project is to raise the navigability of the "Walloon waterways corridor " from the French border to the Meuse river basin to the navigability class Va.

id: Demand on the Seine-Scheldt waterway network is projected in the long term to grow. One of the objectives of the global project is to upgrade the gauge of the Walloon waterway network up to class Va. The current clearance under bridges allows the passage of two layers containers ships only and the aim is to allow at least three layer convoys. The main objective of this Action is to rebuild the bridges of Harchies and Luttre and to raise an existing footbridge to a minimal bridge under clearance of 7m for the passage of three layer containers.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The building of the new bridge in Harties will be completed by end of 2014 as planned but the building of the new bridge in Luttre and the uplifting of the footbridge are being delayed by one year due to problems with the permit procedure and will now be completed in 2015.

2011-BE-93073-S

---

Additional studies in the Seine-Scheldt network in Flanders

---

Part of Priority Project 30

---

The Global Project is the development of the Seine Scheldt network. A large project in this development is Priority Project 30
topics: inland  waterway  Seine–Scheldt
image: as  listed  in  the  Decision  no  661/2010/EU  of  the  European  Parliament  and  of  the  Council.  The  main  objectives  of  the  Global  Project  is  to  optimise  the  connection  between  the  French  inland  waterway  network  and  ports  and  the  Belgian
column8: Dutch  and  German  networks  and  ports.  The  main  works  of  the  Seine–Scheldt  project  are  the  construction  of  a  new  canal  Seine–Nord  Europe  in  France  and  the  improvement  of  the  waterway  network  between  Paris  and  Ghent.  In  Flanders  (Belgium)  several  construction  works  are  being  carried  out  since  2007
column9: mostly  in  the  northern  part  of  the  project
column10: i.e. on the Ghent Circular Canal.

id: To optimize the Seine-Scheldt network in Flanders
title: some  additional  works  need  to  be  carried  out.  The  Action  concerns  the  necessary  studies  in  order  for  works  to  proceed.  The  main  objectives  of  these  additional  studies  are  to  define
created: design  and  prepare  the  future  infrastructural  works  in  the  Seine-Scheldt  network  in  Flanders.  The  studies  are  necessary  to  realise  maximum  benefits  for  the  infrastructure  works.  The  studies  will  provide  solutions  for  the  remaining  bottlenecks  which  restrict  the  dimensions  of  vessels
project_type: find solutions for the expected increased traffic on the Seine-Scheldt network and draw up alternatives in order to increase the reliability of the network.

id: The Action is ongoing. The technical and economic studies for improving navigation on the Roeselare-Lys and Bossuit-Kortrijk canals have been completed. Work on the tender documents for the study on the remaining works of the north-south Seine-Scheldt axis Ghent-Wervik was carried out. Other activities experienced some delays.

---

Second sea lock Waaslandhaven (Port of Antwerp)

------

The Global Project concerns the construction of a second sea lock in Waaslandhaven at the port of Antwerp. The new lock will create a connection between the tidal Deurganckdock and the non-tidal docks of Waaslandhaven.

id: This lock will be 68 m wide and 500 m long
title: with a depth of 17.8m TAW. The lock will be equipped with four rolling gates. Four moveable bridges will be constructed to deviate road and rail traffic over the lock. An operating centre for all parts of the lock complex and several technical buildings will also be constructed.

id: This Action covers Phase 2 and 3 of the global project
title: except  for  the  a  few  elements  of  phase  3
created: which will not be realised within the framework of this Action.

id:

The project is encountering some delays but most of the activities are expected to be completed by end of 2014 except the end of back-filling and embankments
title: the end of reinforced concrete works and the concrete constructions equipped that are now expected to be achieved in 2015.

title: 2011-BE-93105-P

---

Project Upgrade of the 10
topics: 000  tonnes-section  of  the  sea  canal  Brussels-Scheldt  near  Willebroek
image:
to improve its accessibility for sea-going vessels------

The action is part of a larger global project
column8: namely the modernisation programme of the Canal Brussels-Scheldt. This canal forms part of the TEN-T network and is located at the crossroads of various important connections with road and rail infrastructure.

id: The modernisation programme of this canal started in 1967. The aim of these investments is to make the section of the inland waterway from Willebroek to the river Scheldt accessible for coasters and inland navigation up to 10
title: 000  tonnes  and  to  stimulate  the  water  bound  activities  in  this  region.  Therefore  a  water  depth  of  9.5  metres  and  a  minimum  free  passage  of  55  metres  needs  to  be  attained.  By  upgrading  the  waterway  and  by  improving  the  accessibility  of  the  industrial  zones  alongside  the  canal
created: the Project can have a significant effect on the promotion of co-modality and modal shift to more sustainable transport modes.

id: The Action concerns the last works necessary to attain this goal: it involves the works necessary to complete the modernisation of the section between Wintam and Willebroek of the Canal Brussels-Scheldt in order to adjust the canal to the modern needs of inland shipping
title: and is thus a part of the Global project.

id:

Preparation for the works on the renovation of the right canal bank was carried out. Dredging of the canal in order to deepen it has started. Part of the works on the Nijverheidstraat
title: giving  access  to  the  industrial  zone  at  Puurs

Part of Priority Project 1

The Action is part of PP1 and the German VDE (Verkehrsprojekt Deutsche Einheit) 8.1 which consists of the 83-km-long Nuremberg – Ebensfeld upgraded section and the 107-km-long Ebensfeld – Erfurt new-built section. image: and  Nuremberg  -  Ingolstadt  -  Munich  in  the  South
column8: it  will  make  a  significant  contribution  to  improving  fast  wide-ranging  railway  passenger  transport.  At  the  same  time

train paths for railway freight transport will become available on the existing conventional lines.

The Action is part of the Nuremberg–Fürth–Erlangen section
column10: with  the  second  implementation  phase  is  one  section  of  this  planned  link  for  speeds  of  up  to  160km/h. It  has  been  designed  as  a  four-track  electrified  standard  gauge  railway  line  for  high-quality  passenger  and  freight  traffic
column11: and will be equipped with state-of-the-art control and command technology. This will also make a contribution to adapting the Deutsche Bahn train control systems to European standards.

---

Gas as an Alternative for Road Transport - GARneT

------

In this Action
topics: Gas  Natural  Fenosa  and  Ham  Criogénica  will  undertake  a  study  to  determine  the  required  steps  to  integrate  state  of  the  art  Liquid  Natural  Gas  (LNG)  refuelling  technologies  to  demonstrate
image: promote and accelerate the wide scale use of LNG as an alternative environmentally friendly and cost effective transport fuel for heavy goods vehicle (HGV) transport within a Clean Transport System. This Action will then contribute to achieving a future 'low carbon' transport solution desired in the EU.

title: seven  different  LNG  refuelling  stations  trials  testing  four  different  technologies  are  proposed  in  Spain.  The  sites  proposed  have  been  selected
created: as  they  are  aligned  both  with  some  of  the  trans-European  transport  network  priority  routes  and  with  the  principal  Iberian  LNG  terminals.  Smart  communication  technologies  will  be  integrated  within  the  LNG  refuelling  stations  and  vehicles  that  could  incorporate  technologies  such  as  intelligent  routing
project_type: station  monitoring
contents: pricing policy and payment methods.

title: including  three  mobile  units
created: on some of the prioritised trans-European transport network routes to validate four different state of the art LNG refuelling plant designs;

id: • Investigate the logistics to supply LNG to the stations. This will also include evaluating the use of existing infrastructure of natural gas pipelines to supply the LNG;
• Define business models based on the experience of this project to supply LNG across Europe at an economically attractive price;
• Identify requirements in regulatory standards across the Member States and propose recommendations to achieve cohesion and consistency across the European Union.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is on track and should reach the set objectives and the expected results as planned.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:

title: three viaducts and five tunnels.

id: The works on both sections have started and are ongoing.

topics: which  is  mainly  in  Iberian  gauge

title: besides  container  terminals  in  Moll  Sud  and  Moll  Prínicep  d'Espanya

title: 2011-EU-92079-S
contents:
2011-EU-92079-S 

---

Make a Difference

------

The Action aims to identify and minimise the barriers when building and operating a Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) fuelled vessel. This will be achieved by analysing the technical requirements and issues regarding regulations and environmental operation permits that need to be resolved in the shift from traditionally fuelled engines to LNG.

id: This Action will find solutions to the operational issues from the ship-owner perspective. Concretely
title: the Action will:

id: • prepare for the LNG certification process for vessels and operators
• harmonise land-based and sea-based regulations and bunkering requirements
• select and demonstrate vessel environmentally efficient solutions
• develop safe and efficient technologies for LNG bunkering and fuelled vessels
• coordinate with other initiatives and disseminate results
The results of parallel studies will be used. It will coordinate with the relevant ongoing LNG projects and the European Maritime Safety Agency.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project is on-going with slight delay
title: project  completion  expected  on  schedule.  LNG  certification  process  resulted  in  conducted  HAZID’s  on  tank  vessel  and  passenger  ferry  and  related  bunkering  with  identifying  gaps  in  existing  regulations.  Risks  and  safety  issues  were  analysed
created: as  well  as  commercial  solutions  for  sea  transport
project_type: and surveys on solutions for LNG fuel vessels are on-going. Workshop 2 presented preliminary results from statistical analysis of commercial solutions for sea transport.

title: 2011-EU-92130-S
contents:
2011-EU-92130-S 

---

HIT

------

An increasing number of hydrogen hotspots are emerging in densely populated areas
topics: where the zero emission target contributes to improving the local air quality.

id: The Action aims at defining optimum strategies to migrate from these hydrogen hotspots to actual local markets for Hydrogen Refuelling Stations (HRS) and from there to long distance transport and mobility along the TEN-T corridors.
<li>Complete  four  National  Implementation  Plans  (NIP)  for  France
title: Sweden
created: Denmark and the Netherlands. The NIP will address two important questions: how can local hydrogen hotspots be turned into local markets with a sufficient critical mass of users and vehicles; and how can the HRS be integrated in a context of international corridors? The NIP will result from national and regional studies and preparatory actions aiming at providing input for detailed and comprehensive deployment plans for a hydrogen refuelling infrastructure per country.

id: <li>Complete  three  Pilots  that  will  allow  long  distance  trips  between  urban  hydrogen  hubs  of  European  importance  throughout  the  TEN-T  network:  Rotterdam
title: Aalborg  and  Frederica.  Pilots  will  generate  useful  data  and  concrete  lessons  learned  about  their  respective  performance
created: which will feed the NIP and the Synchronising Implementation Plan (SIP).

id: • Develop a proposal for the deployment of hydrogen as a long distance alternative fuel along the TEN-T corridors across Europe: the SIP. The SIP will integrate all results from the NIP and the three Pilots. It will propose recommendations to allow policymakers and infrastructure managers to develop and use effective support schemes for a viable hydrogen infrastructure roll-out in the European Union.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Despite permitting issues
title: the Action should reach the set objectives and the expected results as planned.

The Action will significantly contribute to demonstrate that the electrification of road transport is a viable proposition and will develop an understanding of all charging infrastructure and technology requirements.

To this aim the Action will provide a roadmap to follow when making decisions on the nationwide roll outs of EV infrastructure in EU Member States.
• provide an understanding of customer attitude to fast charging through surveys of both the general public and drivers of EV during the timeframe of the Action;

<li>develop  an  understanding  of  the  requirements  for  a  national  fast  charging  infrastructure  and  validate  fast  charging  technology.  These  two  specific  objectives  will  be  met  by  procuring  fast  chargers

id: <li>validate  the  supporting  IT  requirements  with  the  development
title: testing  and  pilot  launch  of  an  IT  system  to  remotely  monitor  and  manage  the  fast  charge  points
created: and to facilitate payment and energy settlement.

id: • trial cross-border roaming capability by deploying fast charge points on both side of the border in Ireland and Northern Ireland and by operating an IT system which facilitates cross-border payment and settlement.

id: These deployment activities are short-term projects undertaken in the framework of the Interim Deployment Programme (IDP)
title: which defines the first priority projects to be undertaken until 2014. As of 2014 a definitive Deployment Manager will take over the work of the IDSG and the steering of the SESAR deployment activities.

title: partners  of  the  IDSG

title: however

title: 2011-EU-93129-P
contents:
2011-EU-93129-P 

---

Air traffic management network integration and performance enhancement acceleration

------

The Activities in the Proposed Action have been identified as priority activities in the context of the draft Interim SESAR Deployment Programme which recommends commitment to and acceleration of the deployment of several baseline Master Plan deployment elements
topics: among which Airport Collaborative Decision Making (A-CDM) and Airspace Management improvements and data sharing.

id: • The first activity's main objective is to support and accelerate the implementation of A-CDM processes at European airports. There are 13 airports participating directly to the action. EUROCONTROL  role is through the Action to support all the European airports (i.e. not only these 13 airports) looking at the deployment of A-CDM with the target of 20 airports having implemented A-CDM by 2014 and a number of other ones starting deployment.

• The second activity's main objective is to accelerate the implementation of network level collaborative Airspace Management (ASM) solutions to progress towards an efficient flexible use of airspace. This concern on one hand the deployment by EUROCONTROL in European States of the LARA civil-military ASM coordination tool. EUROCONTROL plans for the deployment of LARA at the rate of four States per year. This deployment supports the States' compliance with the obligations put upon them by Articles 5 and 6 of the EC Regulation of the Flexible Use of Airspace. A specific objective concerns the procurement of the related software and hardware in the Netherlands and in Romania. The activity also concerns then the provision of the required interoperable ASM services at Network Management systems level.

title: the deployment of A-CDM processes and of the LARA tool at the participating European airports is progressing.

Part of Priority Project 12

---

The road E18 Turku-Helsinki-Vaalimaa (Russian border) is part of PP12 (Nordic Triangle railway/road axis) in Finland. The goal of the global project is to upgrade the entire E18 to motorway standards by 2017. There are still four missing motorway sections between Helsinki and Vaalimaa. One of these missing sections is the Hamina bypass (15 km long).

id: The Hamina bypass construction includes four sections. The present Action concerns two sections with the following works:
<li>Section  B:  construction  of  a  motorway  between  Kolsila  and  Lelu  (6  km  long)  in  a  new  alignment
title: with  five  bridges  and  private  road  arrangements

id: <li>Section  D:  implementation  of  traffic  telematics  (variable  speed  limits
title: traffic information system and tunnel safety and security systems) between Rantahaka and Lelu.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is on-going. Most of the road construction on section Kolsila-Lelu has been completed. The contract for the traffic telematics on Rantahaka–Lelu section has been signed and the installation works has been started.

---

Technical & design studies concerning the implementation of a LNG bunkering station at the port of Dunkirk

------

The Global Project is the construction of a Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) bunkering station at the Port of Dunkirk. The station will fuel vessels coming from and to the North Europe SECA and passing through the Dover Strait and inland transportation. LNG will be provided to the bunkering facilities through a pipe from an adjacent LNG import terminal being constructed in Dunkirk. The Global Project will enable the completion of a missing bunkering gap for ships on the southern border of North European SECA.

id: The Action consists in the preparation of feasibility and design studies for the construction of a LNG bunkering station infrastructure in the Port of Dunkirk (GPMD)
title: located in the south of the North European SECA (Sulphur Emission Control Areas) area.

id: The Action implementation will involve consultation with a group of technical partners including Voies Navigables de France
title: relevant ports and the Dunkirk LNG terminal operator (DK LNG) and some shipowners. The final general results will be disseminated among the maritime community to raise awareness of LNG bunkering opportunities.

whilst the project being supported lies outside the PP.

Realisation of the most sustainable container terminal in Europe which will increase intermodal transport between the Port of Rotterdam and the European Hinterland

------

The Action is part of a Global Project aiming at the construction of a state-of-the-art multi-modal container terminal on Maasvlakte II (Port of Rotterdam)
topics: the Rotterdam World Gateway (RWG). The RWG Terminal aims to have the highest modal shift ratio for a container terminal in Europe with optimal terminal layout for processing high volumes at high efficiency between all transport modes. The overall modal shift objective of RWG is to reduce the road share of hinterland transport to and from the future terminal from the port's current 50% to 35% by 2016.

id: <li>creating  a  barge  stacking  terminal  with  total  stacking  capacity  of  9
title: 616  TEU.  The  terminal  will  be  equipped  with  10  cantilevered  automated  stacking  cranes  to  load  and  discharge  containers  at  waterside
created: landside transfer zones and alongside the module for higher efficiency of transhipments.

id: <li>creating  a  dedicated  barge  terminal  equipped  with  three  barge  quay  cranes  to  service  the  water  side
title: enabling a higher water-to-water transhipment capacity.

id: <li>realising  a  dedicated  rail  terminal  enabling  direct  long  distance  rail  transport  through  the  TEN-T  network  to  and  from  the  hinterland.  The  rail  terminal  is  expected  to  handle  246
title: 750 TEU per year by the end of 2014. The high capacity of the rail terminal will enable setting full train loads at the terminal resulting in less handling and delay for long distance freight transport.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
All cantilevered automated stacking cranes and barge cranes are on-site and ready for testing. Design and civil works related to the rail handling system are almost completed. Activities in 2014 focus on testing of cantilevered automated stacking cranes and barge cranes and of delivery and testing of gantry cranes. Testing will include also operational testing of the integrated technical systems.

2011-NL-93042-P 

---

Elimination bottleneck north-south artery A2(E25): Providing safety measures in the urban highway tunnel in Maastricht

------

The present project will contribute with safety provisions to the on-going implementation of the E25/A2 urban highway tunnel in Maastricht. The tunnel will remove an important bottleneck in the heavy north-south freight transit between Aachen and Liège in the Meuse-Rhine Euro region
topics: through  which  goods  from/to  the  biggest  ports  of  Europe
image: Rotterdam  and  Antwerp
column8: transit.  In  addition  to  that
column9: the two-level double tube tunnel will increase capacity and will facilitate lower carbon inter-modal connection of the biggest inland ports in The Netherlands (Maasbracht and Born) and in Belgium (Liège). The global project is a project of common interest which interacts with Priority Project 2
column10: the high speed railway axis Paris-Brussels-Cologne-Amsterdam-London; and Priority Project 18

id: In order to ensure highest standards of tunnel safety and security
title: better  connections  to  motorway  A79  to  Germany
created: and  to  guarantee  the  traffic  flows  around  the  E25/A2  tunnel
project_type: the following measures have been included in the current project:

id: • Construction of a firehouse near the South entrance of the tunnel
• Construction of two escape tubes in the tunnel
• Connection with the railway station and the inland water ports
• Construction of foot and bicycle paths and bridges

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The firehouse is fully operational since July 2013. Works related to activity 2 'building two escape tubes in the tunnel' are on-going as planned.  Activity 3 'connecting with railway station and inland water ports' has progressed according to schedule in 2012 and 2013
title: with  works  related  to  road  overpass  A2  Beatrixhaven
created: road overpass Marienwaard and tunnel Beukenlaan. Acitivity 4 'Facilitating urban slow traffic' is also ongoing as scheduled.

Implementation study eliminating the major bottlenecks in the Amsterdam-Rotterdam-Antwerp corridor

------

The Princess Beatrix locks lay on the Lek Canal which connects Amsterdam-Rhine Canal to the Lek River (part of the Rhine River). This busy waterway is one of the most important links in the North-South waterway corridor with a yearly traffic of about 50
topics: 000  vessels  going  through  the  locks.  With  the  significant  increase  in  traffic  and  vessel  size  that  is  forecast  for  the  coming  years
image: the  Princess  Beatrix  locks  will  no  longer  have  sufficient  capacity  and  will  represent  a  bottleneck  on  this  vital  link.  To  prevent  this  from  happening
column8: the Dutch Authorities have set up a global project aiming to find and implement a solution.

id: The option that was retained consists of expanding the Princess Beatrix locks by adding a third chamber
title: widening the Lek Canal and increasing the number of berths.
the main objective of the Action is to carry out the implementation studies and planning procedures which are necessary to launch the works of the Beatrix locks expansion project.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Solid progress has been made on all activities. The Ontwerp Trace besluit (draft alignment for the new lock and enlarged canal) has been signed by the Dutch Minister of Infrastructure and Environment in January 2014.

A secondary objective of the Action is to ensure that the results will be directly applicable to subsequent Inland Waterway and Lock projects that will follow this Global Project. After the development of a successful PPP concept for 'wet' infrastructure and the use of DBFM tendering procedures
title: it will be rolled out to facilitate new Inland Waterway and Lock PPP projects.

By creating the intermodal terminal the beneficiary intends to establish a connection between the terminal which ensures the air transportation of passenger and freight and the railway line
topics: brought from approximately 4 km. The optimal solution for the route and the length of the railway line shall be determined through the performance of the proposed studies.

title: 2011-SE-92148-P
contents:

---

Fjalir

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The project involves a construction of a low cost Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) bunkering vessel
topics: based  on  rebuilding  the  existing  vessel   "Fjalir ".  This  upgraded  vessel  will  be  a  flexible  alternative  to  other  state  of  the  art  technologies  as  well  as  larger  scale
image: land based fuelling infrastructure. The vessel will operate in the Port of Stockholm.

id: The project aims to present a viable alternative by Q3 2013 which will allow stakeholders from the shipping industry as well as port operators to evaluate and test the LNG bunkering vessel in advance of the Sulphur Emission Control Area (SECA) requirements coming into force in the Northern Europe on 1 January 2015.
The bunkering vessel will be tested in 15 test runs and 1
title: 000 tonnes of LNG will be fuelled through the use of the bunkering vessel. This corresponds to a reduction of 300 tons of CO2 and 10 tons of SO2. The test results will be measured in close collaboration with the Swedish Transport Agency and the County Administrative Board who is the main authority in charge of environmental permits.

id: The results will enable to evaluate the potential of such a bunkering vessel and to define the need for future permits in regards to an increasing use of LNG as a fuel in the shipping industry.

2011-SE-93090-S 

---

Upgrading of maritime infrastructure in Lake Malaren

---

Part of Priority Project 12

---

The geographical zone
topics: covered  by  this  Action
image: presents  a  number  of  bottlenecks  related  to  the  railway  system  of  the  Lake  Mälaren  area  with  its  constraints  in  capacity  and  the  main  road  system  leading  into  and  passing  through  Stockholm  with  its  congestions  during  peak  hours.  At  this  time
column8: there is an unused potential in the Lake Mälaren to increase the role of sea transport in the intermodal transport chain. The potential to attract on-land transport modes can be achieved by relatively limited infrastructure investments.

id: The current Action is part of a Global project
title: which  aims  at  improving  the  maritime  infrastructure  in  the  Lake  Mälaren  in  order  to  improve  efficiency
created: safety  of  navigation  and  environmental  performance.  The  physical  works  of  the  Global  project  include  increased  depth  and  width  of  fairways  and  canal
project_type: increased clearance and lengthening and widening of the lock. To start the investments a building permit from the Swedish Land and Environmental Court is a pre-requisite and it will be prepared and requested under the current Action. The upgrading of this infrastructure will support a modal shift from the overburden TEN-T Priority Poject 12 Nordic triangle to sea transport
contents: making sea transport more sustainable and cost efficient.

id: The implementation will give access to the Lake Mälaren for larger vessels and give possibility to direct calls to other European ports. This will increase cost- and time efficiency in sea transportation and is in direct relation to the TEN-T Priority Project 21 Motorways of the Sea. The Global project is also in line with EU´s Strategy for the Baltic Sea Region. The current Action aims at preparing all necessary technical and environmental studies of the proposed investments in order to obtain a formal request for building consent from the Swedish Land and Environment Court. The Action consists of activities related to the technical design of the fairways
title: canal  and  lock  and  preparation  of  a  complete  EIA  (Environmental  Impact  Assessment).  The  EIA  will  represent  a  fundamental  element  and  a  pre-requisite  of  the  application
project_type: in order to get the implementation consent for the Global project.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project has been finalised. The final design of fairways and the technical pre-studies for the locks and the canal have been completed. The application
title: in view of obtaining the environmental and building permit was finalised and submitted to Swedish Environmental Court.

---

Muelle Prat rail terminal

------

The project involves the construction of a rail terminal within the new Muelle Prat container terminal which is being built in the Port of Barcelona.

The strategic objective of building a new container terminal is to develop the hinterland of the Port of Barcelona so that it can become one of the main gateways for container traffic bound for the southern Europe.

Since rail transport is an essential element of the aforementioned strategy
topics:
a rail terminal will be built within the Muelle Prat container terminal. The concession agreement establishes that BPA will be the rail terminal owner and Terminal Catalunya will build it under its supervision.  

The new rail terminal will be the largest of its kind in Spain and one of the largest in the Mediterranean region and Europe. It will accommodate both Iberian and UIC (European) gauge trains. Under the concession agreement the rail terminal is an open terminal owned by BPA
image: so that all users have access to it on a non-discriminatory basis.

Preparation of detailed design for Valencia-Fuente de San Luis and Madrid-Vicálvaro railway freight terminals

------

The Action will contribute to the global project of developing rail terminals in Spain. This project will aim at establishing a basic network of rail logistic facilities which will be open round the clock
topics: 365  days  a  year
image: for  receiving  and  dispatching  freight  trains.  The  concentration  of  logistics  facilities  and  their  operational  adaptation  to  European  standards  will  improve  the  competitiveness  of  rail  on  the  high  potential  lines  of  traffic
column8: such  as  those  joining  Madrid  dry  ports  with  other  cities  of  the  Iberian  Peninsula  and  Valencia  with  Madrid  and  the  Mediterranean  corridor.  This  improvement  will  improve  the  modal  shift  in  land  transport
column9: improving  access  to  the  port  system
column10: generate new poles of economic development and improve the overall economic competitiveness.

id: The project consists of preparing development studies for two Spanish freight terminals: Valencia Fuente de San Luis and Madrid Vicálvaro
title: which will allow them to adapt to European standards.

id: The studies are envisaged in order to prepare both terminals for receiving trains of 750 metres in length and so that they become strategic logistic nodes within the European rail transport freight system by 2020. At present
title: the freight terminals in Madrid and Valencia have a specific design that does not allow handling trains longer than 450 meters and are located within the city.

---

The Action is a study
topics: which  takes  the  form  of  a  Pilot  Action.  Its  main  objective  is  to  enhance  the  strategic  role  of  the  Priority  Project  24  (Railway  axis  Lyon/Genova-Basel-Duisburg-Rotterdam/Antwerpen)  of  the  TEN-T  network
image: as main gate to Europe for the traffic of goods transported via the Mediterranean Motorways of the Sea (MedMos).

id: The goal is to create a “unique ICT multimodal Corridor between northern and southern Europe” by connecting virtually the PP 24 with MedMoS. The Action will analyse the bi-directional transfer of goods from central Europe to Med Countries and to Med ports through the combination of PP24 and the network of MoS
title: which interconnect to each-other through the Ligurian-French Port system.

id: The Pilot Action will develop the demonstrator of an interoperability platform (MoS24) for interconnecting existing ICT modules and making them interoperable
title: and will deliver a service to users through the virtual MoS24 Co-modality Promotion Centre (CPC).

id: MOS24 CPC aims at giving a significant example of multimodal ICT services offered to the transport community. The action will be carried out in three main phases
title: namely:

id: • analysis of the demand along the corridor
<li>review  of  existing  subsystems  and  missing  links
title: followed by the development and testing of an early version
consisting of the virtual CPC for the Southern Gateway

id: The MoS24 Project will closely work with the MIELE project
title: fostering  synergies  between  the  Med  ICT  projects
created: to avoid duplications and optimise the results. The project will moreover remain open to cooperate with other ICT and e-freight actions.

---

Monitoring and Operation Services for Motorways of the Sea (MoS4MoS)

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The MoS4MoS project is a pilot action primarily aimed at preparing the different key stakeholder systems (ports and terminals
topics: railways
image: rail  freight  stations
column8: maritime  carriers
column9: short  sea  consolidation  centres
column10: etc) to provide integrated and interoperable services for door-to-door MoS supply chains.

id: The main objective of the MoS4MoS Action is to design and demonstrate a set of prototypes that will improve the operational coordination of transport flows and facilitate tight co-ordination between the various administrative services and operators at port level.
The test prototypes will be applied to existing door-to-door MoS supply chains in the Mediterranean region
title: namely  in:  Spain-Italy
project_type: Spain-Greece
contents: Slovenia-Greece and Italy-Greece. They will address two different types of traffic: ro-ro and containerised freight.

id: MoS4MoS will identify current constraints and bottlenecks in MoS corridors for both types of traffic and will propose actions to improve the current situation through the use of information and communication technologies. It will be in particular interested in defining ICT solutions that can become standards that are flexible enough to be applied widely.

title: the goals of the Action are:

id: • Facilitating and simplifying the compliance with regulations of companies in a door-to-door MoS supply chain
• Improving the exchange of information of public and private organisations to increase the efficiency of ports as MoS gateways
• Improving the operational cooperation of the actors of the different transport modes in a door-to-door MoS supply chain
• Providing a set of monitoring services for the door-to-door MOS supply chainsPromoting and supporting sustainable intermodal transport solutions that reinforce the door-to-door MOS supply chains

EasyWay
topics:
Phase 2------

EasyWay is a complex project for Europe-wide ITS (Intelligent Transport Systems/Services) deployment on the main Trans-European Road Network corridors. A first phase of the project has been funded in 2007 up until 2009.

id: The overall EasyWay vision is to implement a sustainable road transport system allowing passengers and freight to travel safely
title: efficiently  and  cleanly.  The  users  are  supported  where  relevant  by  harmonised  and  seamless  ITS  services  in  all  aspects  of  their  travel  (pre-trip

id: The Action is led by national road authorities and operators in co-operation with other stakeholders which include the automotive industry
title: telecom  operators  and  public  transport  stakeholders.  It  identifies  a  set  of  necessary  ITS  European  services  to  deploy  (Traveller  Information
created: Traffic Management and Freight and Logistic Services) and is an efficient platform that allows the European stakeholders in the domain of road transport to achieve a coordinated deployment of these pan-European services.

id: This Action is intended to underpin the accelerated deployment of ITS across Europe in the coming years. EasyWay has the potential to contribute to the objectives of the European Commission's ITS Action Plan and the ITS Directive.
The necessary exchange of approaches and solutions with partners other than road authorities will also be organised through the relevant organisations at EasyWay level.

title: 2010-EU-21107-P
contents:
2010-EU-21107-P

---

Motorway of the Sea Rostock-Gedser

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The Action is part of a global project
topics: covering  infrastructure  initiatives  on  the  transport  axis  Copenhagen-Berlin:  extension  of  railway  Rostock-Berlin
image: upgrading  of  European  road  E55  into  the  port  of  Rostock
column8: introduction of new ferries. The wider project links to TEN-T Priority Project 1(rail axis Berlin-Verona/Milano-Bologna-Napoli-Messina-Palermo).

id: This transport axis has seen a growing demand. The current ferries are operating at capacity limits and have reached the end of their technical lifetime. They will be replaced by new ferries (2012)
title: which  will  double  capacity  and  improve  operational  reliability

id: Additionally the link must cope with changing framework conditions. The Fehmarnbelt axis (Priority Project 20) will induce additional competition and modal back-shift. The limitation of sulphur content in ship fuels in the Baltic Sea (2015) is expected to result in significantly rising sea freight rates. Both developments will have a negative impact on the competitiveness of the link unless investments are made in port infrastructure and vessels.
The ‘traffic machine’ concept of high frequency (9 departures per port per day) and short turnaround times of approx. 15 minutes must be ensured. To warrant this top performance
title: purpose  built  port  infrastructure  and  vessels  are  required.  Additionally
created: the  investments  will  allow  the  development  of  intermodal  traffic
project_type: which is expected to reach 6% of the link’s annual traffic (2017).

title: the  E55  crosses  the  city  of  Nykøbing  Falster.  This  is  a  main  bottleneck  and  an  obstacle  to  the  efficiency  of  the  transport  corridor.  A  new  bypass  road  will  remove  this  bottleneck
project_type: ensure mobility of freight and passengers and reduce the environmental impact.

id: This Action consists of infrastructure investments in the ports of Rostock and Gedser and the Nykøbing Falster bypass road.

title: 2010-EU-21108-P
contents:
2010-EU-21108-P

---

The Baltic Sea Hub and Spokes Project

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The EU strategy for the Baltic Sea Region (BSR) is an important tool for bringing about closer
topics: more  coordinated  and  more  focused  cooperation
image: which  will  enable  regions  in  eight  Member  States  to  plan
column8: prioritize  and  implement  activities
column9: towards  the  same  goals
column10: in a more coordinated way.

id: This is why the Ports of Aarhus
title: Gothenburg  and  Tallinn  have  proposed  a  common  Hub  and  Spokes  concept  under  Motorways  of  the  Sea.  This  concept  is  the  backbone  of  the  Action.  The  project  is  an  ambitious
created: contemporary  and  far-sighted  action  to  create  the  necessary  framework  for  an  integrated  maritime  transport  system
project_type: which  will  promote  and  support  a  cost-effective  and  efficient  door-to-door  transport  solution
contents: link trade to transport and facilitate growth in the entire BSR.

id: Building stronger hubs in the BSR with strong feeder relations will attract direct calls by global carriers
title: safeguard  the  development  of  the  BSR  and  relieve  the  pressure  on  the  continental  hubs  and  thereby  allocate  more  capacity  to  handle  their  natural  hinterland.  Moreover
created: the  Action  will  deal  with  current  transport  challenges
project_type: such as the massive flow in container and trailer traffic on over-burdened European road systems.

id: The action consists of 4 main activities: The Marine Integration Project (MIP)
title: Port  Access  Aarhus
created: Port Access Gothenburg and Port Security Tallinn.

title: the  main  objectives  of  the  action  are  to  facilitate  an  efficient
created: environmentally  friendly  and  attractive  intermodal  transport  solution  for  the  BSR  and  to  improve  access  to  markets  in  BSR.  This  will  increase  possibilities  for  trade  and  growth  in  the  region  and
project_type: in  direct  continuation  hereof
contents: an  increase  in  the  flow  of  goods  by  sea  will  help  the  BSR  feeder  ports  grow  and  develop  and  make  the  BSR  countries  more  competitive.  i.e.
topics: the initiative will not only boost the economy by facilitating trade but also help make the BSR more resilient to shocks generated externally.

id: The Baltic Sea Hub and Spokes system is a joint project of the ports of Gothenburg
title: Aarhus  and  Tallinn.  In  a  wider  perspective  and  in  a  later  phase
created: the action will also aim to include other ports in the Baltic Sea geographical area and neighbouring countries.

2010-EU-21109-S

---

MonaLisa

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

This Action is fully in line with the Strategy for the Baltic Sea region and will address and implement its concrete needs and flagship projects. This project builds on the experiences and results of previous Motorway of the Sea (MoS) actions in the Baltic Sea and contains studies taking form of pilot actions that are of wider benefit.

id: The Action aims at improving quality of maritime transport
title: safety  at  sea
created: exchange of maritime data and facilitation of environmental performance of shipping and implementation of e-Maritime relevant applications.

id: <li>A  new  methodology  in  maritime  route  planning
title: similar  to  air  navigation.  The  related  activity  aims  to  define
created: develop and test a model in route planning based on existing Electronic Nautical Charts and Automatic Identification System.

id: • A new pilot system of automated verification of ship crew certificates. A concept model for an automatic verification system monitoring officer’s certificates and time on watch will be designed.

• Re-surveys of HELCOM fairways in the Baltic Sea leading to harmonised distribution of survey data and water level information. Re-survey of HELCOM fairways and Baltic Sea port areas will be carried out with modern quality methods to ensure correct depth presented in existing sea charts and improve safe navigation for large vessels.

• A pilot system for sharing maritime data at a global scale. The related activity aims to develop and test a functional demonstrator system with the final objective to extend the sharing of maritime information to a global scale as well as expanding the scope of maritime information shared between maritime authorities in accordance with their needs.
The Action will be implemented by Sweden
title: Finland  and  Denmark
created: but it remains open to other potential participants in the Baltic Sea region or participating in already established MoS projects.

title: 2010-EU-21112-S
contents:
2010-EU-21112-S

---

LNG infrastructure of filling stations and deployment in ships

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The project is a strategic study taking the form of a pilot action in relation to the implementation of the Motorways of the Sea. It emerged as a project under the European Union Strategy for the Baltic Sea Region but its geographical scope has been expanded with the North Sea and the English Channel because of the trading between these areas and because of the Emission Control Area provisions setting more restrictive limits on sulphur and nitrogen oxides emissions from 2010

id: The project consists of feasibility studies on LNG (Liquefied Natural Gas) filling station infrastructure as well as a full scale pilot action. The study part of project will create a strategic decision paper relevant for central stakeholders
title: aiming at developing framework conditions for the use of LNG for ships and will validate a full scale pilot action aiming at demonstrating the LNG option as competitive fuel from shipping and an LNG supply chain points of view. The project further aims at harvesting positive environmental and climate effects.

id: The aim of the full scale pilot project is to modify the design of two new build vessels to a LNG propulsion system
title: a  more  environmentally  friendly  system
created: which is in line with the requirements of the revised Annex VI of MARPOL 73/78 adopted by The International Maritime Organization (IMO) in 2008.

id: This will be the first time that a Ro/Pax vessel of this size (1350 lane metre for trucks) will be built with LNG propulsion. The pilot action will be followed by an extensive measurement programme for validating its environmental and climate benefits as LNG contains no sulphur and emits 90% less NOx than traditional fuels and CO2 can be reduced by up to 25%.
The lessons learnt from the project are foreseen to have a wider benefit also for other geographical areas within the EU
title: demonstrating  that  LNG  propulsion  is  achievable  for  a  larger  ro-pax  vessel  and  could  play  an  important  role  in  further  implementation  of  LNG  in  similar  vessels  throughout  Europe  on  short  international  routes
created: as well as for domestic traffic.

title: 2010-EU-40106-S
contents: 2010-EU-40106-S

id:
FAB CE Implementation of Static Area of Responsibility Scenario

------

The Functional Airspace Block – Central Europe (FAB CE) aims at implementing the performance targets of the Single European Sky II (SES II) legislation
title: in  particular  the  areas  of  safety
project_type: flight  efficiency
contents: environment
topics: mission and cost effectiveness based on the FAB CE Feasibility Study Master Plan.

id: The present decision deals specifically with the pre-implementation phase
title: which will prepare the improvement of some FAB CE performances. The Implementation Plan for the Static Area of Responsibility Scenario will be the first document addressing compliance with the new requirements stemming from the applicable SES regulations as amended by the SES II package.

id: This will prepare the establishment of common airspace design and airspace planning processes by the relevant civil military cooperation body
title: work  towards  a  fluent  and  flexible  transfer  of  responsibility
created: lay  the  foundations  for  an  advanced  level  of  interoperability  to  enable  cross-border  operations  in  the  FAB
project_type: prepare  the  integration  of  Airspace  management  and  Air  Traffic  Flow  and  Capacity  management  processes
contents: develop  a  coordinated  approach  to  the  Contingency  Planning
topics: an  harmonised  implementation  of  the  Technical  Infrastructure  and  systems
image: work on a basis for the harmonisation of Safety Management Systems and commonly applied safety methodology to the changes introduced by FAB CE and the application of a common competence scheme and best use of existing training facilities.

id: The main objectives of this decision are:
• Connecting the currently fragmented ANSPs’ (Air navigation service provider) activities with the FAB Network
• Improving the civil-military co-ordination by connecting the FAB activity with military airspace users’ needs and by the application of the flexible use of airspace management
• Harmonising and coordinating the capacity planning process
• Coordinating the FAB-FAB interface prior to the appointment of a network manager
• Working towards achieving full operational interoperability of the ATM (Air Traffic Management) systems by using existing functionality in an optimal way

• Implementing the relevant parts of the IP 1 (Implementation package 1 (SESAR)) concept defined in the SESAR (Single European Sky ATM Research) Master Plan to contribute to the Global Project objective to improve performance.

---

Deployment of Inland AIS transponders in Flanders and the Netherlands

------

This Action intends to complete a similar 2008 project by launching and undertaking a new Automatic Identification System (AIS) equipment subsidy programme in Flanders (Belgium)
topics: as well as reinforcing the existing related activities in the Netherlands.

id: This Action consists of an equipment subsidy programme aiming at stimulating skippers to install on-board AIS transponders. In the Netherlands
title: this  Action  is  expected  to  equip  1
created: 100  additional  vessels  in  order  to  encompass  the  rest  of  the  shipping  fleet  on  the  Dutch  waterways
project_type: while the Flemish part of the Action aims at equipping 750 additional vessels.

id: The subsidy is available to ships from any flag state
title: provided that they make demonstrable use of the Dutch and Flemish waterways.

id: This Action will enable real-time tracking and tracing according to the River Information Services guidelines. Full deployment of Inland AIS transponders is indeed a key step in implementing RIS
title: since  the  quality  and  success  of  many  of  its  services  depends  critically  on  the  availability  of  accurate
created: timely and complete position information of commercial vessels.

id: Support from the TEN-T programme for this action will substantially speed-up the full-deployment of Inland AIS transponders by commercial vessels
title: and it will stimulate national governments to complete their planned programmes.

2010-EU-91117-P

---

Greening European Transportation Infrastructure for Electric Vehicles

------

This Action will be an essential first step towards the mass deployment and availability of charging infrastructure for Electric Vehicles (EV) across the EU over the next ten years. It is a highly innovative project which combines “traditional” road transportation infrastructure
topics: electric  network  infrastructure  and  Intelligent  Transport  Systems  (ITS)
image: contributing  significantly  toward  a  sustainable
column8: economical and environmentally friendly transportation alternative within Europe that relies exclusively on electric mobility (e-mobility).

id: The Action aims at analysing and testing the deployment of an integrated battery charging and switching infrastructure that allows for long distance travels
title: modal  shift  with  railways
project_type: and  sourcing  of  renewable  energies.  An  extensive  feasibility  study
contents: addressing  conditions  for  service  concepts
topics: infrastructure  requirements  and  network  planning
image: along  with  three  pilot  projects  in  Denmark  and  in  the  Netherlands
column8: will constitute the framework for this approach.

id: <li>Demonstrate  what  a  pan-European  e-mobility  infrastructure  and  service  provision  could  look  like  by  identifying  the  conditions  for  a  viable  deployment  of  the  EV  service  network  into  the  TEN-T  network  from  a  consumer
title: governmental
created: Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and service provider perspective

id: • Identify conditions for further integration and upscaling of this e-mobility infrastructure and service provision into the TEN-T network by developing a proposal for ‘open access’ infrastructure
<li>Contribute  to  important  aspects  of  the  TEN-T  priorities  by  optimising  existing  and  new  infrastructure
title: promoting intermodality and deploying intelligent transportation systems

id: <li>Assist  policy  makers  by  providing  them  with  insights  and  recommendations  for  future  action
title: notably in the deployment of charging and switching facilities and related services into TEN-T infrastructures.

River Information Services II (RIS II)

------

River Information Services (RIS) are customised information services for inland waterway transport and make it possible to co-ordinate logistical processes with actual transport situations on a constant basis. RIS play a key role in making cargo transport and passenger services on waterways more efficient and ecologically sound while
topics: at  the  same  time
image: increasing traffic safety.

id: The main objectives of the RIS II action are the full scale implementation of transponders on vessels
title: the full scale deployment of AIS antennae on the French high capacity network and the development of new information services.

id: The first part of the action is the financing of transponders on the pushers
title: the  units  for  the  transport  of  passengers  and  the  self-propelled  barges  on  the  French  high  gauge  waterway  network.  To  equip  the  entire  fleet
project_type: 360 transponders for the next three years.

title: the deployment of the Automatic Identification System (AIS) infrastructure is planned on all transnational waterways of class IV and above. The extension of the AIS coverage on the Moselle river and on the French part of the Rhine river will improve the reliability of the RIS Centre.

the  data  gathered  at  the  RIS  Centre  will  be  used  in  order  to  create  new  services.  These  services  results  from  the  exchange  of  several  types  of  information  (voyage  notification
created: water level data...). All of these activities would increase service quality of inland navigation and facilitate modal shift towards multimodal transport with inland navigation.

River Information Services (RIS) are customised information services for inland waterway transport that make it possible to co-ordinate logistical processes with actual transport situations on a constant basis. A  RIS  centre

topics: Trieste
image: Venezia
column8: Koper
column9: Ancona  and  Monfalcone)  into  a  multi-port  Gateway  capable  of  providing  -  as  a  whole  -  an  efficient  system
