title: connecting  the  Adriatic  Corridor  to  EU  mainland  logistic  platforms  as  well  as  supporting  the  development  of  strategic  links  by  sea  in  Mediterranean  and  Black  Sea  areas

title: 2010-NL-93302-S
contents:
2010-NL-93302-S

---

Implementation Study to prepare a Public Private Partnership to improve maritime access to the TEN-T network at Amsterdam

------

The lock complex at Ijmuiden is the physical access point which connects the North Sea with Amsterdam Seaports and is used intensively by shipping traffic. Due to the increasing size of shipping a greater proportion of ships can only be processed via the largest of the four locks in this complex. The complex is approaching maximum capacity due to the increased volume in cargo and constant increase in ship size. If not addressed
topics: the  access  point  of  the  North  Sea  Canal  through  the  lock  complex  of  Ijmuiden  will  result  in  delays
image: congestion and traffic bottleneck.

id: The Action consists of an implementation study for a new sea lock in the existing sea lock complex at Ijmuiden in the Netherlands. The studies
title: which  will  be  executed  by  the  Directorate-General  (DG)  and  Public  Works  Noord  Holland
created: are  necessary  to  analyse  the  technical
project_type: financial and environmental aspects and possible risks of the construction of the sea lock using a PPP procurement.

id: To arrive at a clear decision in order to begin the tender procedure and move the project closer to implementation as a PPP
title: further research needs to be carried out into the technical and financial aspects as well as the possible risks of the operation.

id: Therefore conducting the Proof of Concept Study and analysing these scenarios through the Environmental Effects Analysis (EEA)
title: the Societal Cost Benefit Analysis (SCBA) as well as conducting a study into the Design-Build-Finance-Maintain (DBFM) approach and optimal DBFM contract are the crucial next steps in defining the PPP project and the tender procedure.

id: Three alternatives for the dimensions of the new lock will be assessed for technical and financial feasibility in the Proof of Concept study as well as in through the SCBA and EEA and will depend on:
• Variations in the size of the new sea lock
• Options for future use of the Northern Lock
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (403.6 KB)

This project was also the subject of a press release issued by the Agency.

title: 2010-PL-70206-P
contents:
2010-PL-70206-P

---

Pilot implementation on the Lower Oder RIS

------

Poland is in the process of implementing the River Information Services (RIS) Directive on its waterways of international importance and addressing sections where the existence of a RIS system would be justified to improve the navigation’s safety and efficiency.

id: The RIS implementation also takes into account economic and environmental considerations
title: and aims at facilitating interfaces with other transport modes.

id: This Action is the very first stage of the Polish RIS deployment and consists in the preparation of a RIS feasibility study on the Lower Oder and the launch of its related pilot scheme. In line with the guidelines set up in the abovementioned Directive
title: the  Action  plans  to  test  on  the  Lower  Oder  an  interoperable
created: reliable and safe RIS information system managed from a new Lower Oder RIS centre to be constructed and based in the Inland Navigation Office of Szczecin.

id: The pilot includes the testing of different technical specifications that will be harmonised in order to reach European interoperability and to include Polish inland waterways into the pan-European RIS network.
The support to this Action from the TEN-T programme will substantially speed-up the full-deployment of RIS on the Polish inland waterways.
The Action is globally on track and should reach the set objectives and the expected results with fewer resources.

The Action is part of Priority Project 8 (Multimodal axis Portugal/Spain-rest of Europe) and consists in the development of studies for the implementation of a new rail grade separation in Alcântara (Lisbon). The Action aims to complete a rail line of the TEN-T network in northern Sweden. title: the line will provide better connection between the rail network of Sweden and Finland completing at the same time the Northern rail axis Narvik-Haparanda-Tornio-St. Petersburg.

---

Felixstowe Rail Terminal - Improving intermodal transfer and removing bottleneck on PP26

------

This Action is part of a Global Project aiming to create a new marine container handling terminal
topics: with  a  capacity  of  2  million  TEU
image: located  at  the  port  of  Felixstowe
column8: UK.

title: construction  and  equipping  of  a  rail  terminal  at  the  Port  (New  North  Rail  Terminal)
created: to improve the intermodal transfer and removal of bottlenecks on two of the TEN-T Priority Projects: PP 26 (railway/road axis Ireland/United Kingdom/continental Europe) and
project_type: PP 13 (road axis United Kingdom/Ireland/Benelux) by increasing the rail modal share of inland container movements from road to rail.

id: The works for the rail terminal are scheduled to start in 2012 at a budgeted cost of €37 million with a potential capacity to handle 1.1 million TEUs per year
title: thus  removing  the  equivalent  of  780

id: This Action has the following main objectives:
• Increase train service capacity of the port of Felixstowe
• Increase intermodal transfer mode capacity by enabling increased movement of containerised traffic between the low carbon modes of ship and rail
• Support mode shift from road to rail and reduce lorry moves on the A14 trunk road bottleneck
• Reduce sensitive lorry miles through increased movement by rail (TEN-T Priority Project 26)
• Support EU and UK objectives for the reduction of harmful emissions associated with freight transport

Port Salford

------

The Port Salford Global Project will be the UK’s first distribution park served by inland waterway
topics: road  and  rail.  The  development  will  create  a  multimodal  distribution  park  adjacent  to  the  Manchester  Ship  Canal
image: the  main  Trans-Pennine  railway  line  and  the  M60  motorway
column8: thus improving interoperability on TEN-T Priority Project 26 (Railway/Road axis–Ireland/United Kingdom/Continental Europe). It will benefit the competitiveness of local businesses by significantly reducing the costs of transporting containers to the Manchester City region.

title: Port  Salford  will  employ  over  2
project_type: in  doing  so
contents: will bring a significant increase in maritime employment into the city region. The Action is to undertake a series of studies aimed at delivering the enabling infrastructure to bring forward the Port Salford development. The allocation of European Union funding for the package of studies will enable the applicant to fast track the various construction phases of the overall development.

title: four individual studies would be conducted:

id: • A rail infrastructure study to estimate the costs and impact of constructing a new 1.27 km rail link up to the Manchester-Newton le Willows-Liverpool railway line and seven 775 m reception sidings
• A wharf infrastructure study to estimate the costs and impact of constructing a new quay on the Manchester Ship Canal offering two new berths
• A financial validation study to verify the costs of the overall Port Salford project to include review of demand and competition
<li>A  study  to  carry  out  initial  preparation  (including  ground  and  surface  investigations)  to  assess  the  costs  associated  with  the  design
title: building and operation of the terminal and its associated warehousing as well as for the rail and waterway improvement schemes

---

Part of Priority Project 26

The two activities of the Action will develop the capability for growth along TEN-T Priority Project 26 (railway/road axis Ireland/United Kingdom/continental Europe) and maximise the benefits delivered by other investments along the route.

id: Activity one aims at reducing the length of the signal sections between Kennett and Bury St Edmunds. Installing new signals will significantly reduce the time required for a freight train to travel between Bury St Edmunds and Kennett.

title: the  Nuneaton  North  Chord
created: will construct 1.4 km of new railway to provide a grade separated connection between PP26 to Priority Project 14 (West Coast Main Line)
project_type: which will avoid the risk of Nuneaton becoming a bottleneck location for either PP.

id: Combination of the two activities will improve the capacity and regulation of intermodal services along PP26. These works will enable forecasted levels of rail freight growth from the port of Felixstowe to be accommodated without the need for additional traffic to be routed on the heavily congested routes via London.
Enhancing the capacity and resilience of Priority Project 26 by providing a diversity of routing options for rail freight will deliver greater network flexibility
title: enabling the rail network to meet the requirements of the intermodal freight industry.

title: 2012-EU-21010-S
contents:
2012-EU-21010-S

---

PILOT SCRUBBER – New Generation Lightweight Pilot Scrubber Solution installed on a Ro-Ro Ship operating on the Motorway of the Baltic Sea

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The current Action is part of a Global Project
topics: which  addresses  the  LNG
image: the  methanol  and  scrubber  options  with  the  aim  to  find  efficient  and  economically  viable  solutions  to  meet  the  SECA  regulations  2015  and  to  support  the  development  of  a  competitive
column8: and  environmentally  sustainable
column9: shipping sector in the Baltic Sea.

id: This Pilot Action specifically addresses the use of scrubber technology for abatement of sulphur oxides from ships' exhaust emissions and aims at reduced environmental impact of shipping and to achieve IMO MARPOL Annex IV SECA requirements by:

title: evaluation  and  demonstration  of  a  new  generation
created: innovative  lightweight  scrubber  technology  in  full  scale  on  existing  Ro-Ro  vessels  TransAtlantic  Transpaper  type  and  Wagenborg  Schieborg
project_type: operating in the Baltic Sea and in the North Sea.

id: Verification and evaluation of the specific port infrastructure and preparatory investments needed for a full scale implementation of the new generation scrubber technology.

Expected results are to find viable solutions to meet the SECA requirements by the use of new light scrubber technology. The results would greatly improve the competitiveness of the shipping sector versus other modes of transport and thus reduce the environmental impact from transports.

The Action will also investigate how a financial mechanism can be set up in order to support ship-owners/operators adopting the new technology and give recommendations to decision-makers on how to implement this mechanism. Dissemination of results and gained experience from the Action will provide guidance to the shipping community and will assist followers how to choose optimum SECA compliance strategies.
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action has started as planned
title: although  all  the  activities  indicate  a  lower  progress  than  foreseen  during  the  reporting  period.  These  delays  are
project_type: not expected to have any negative impact on the final date of the Action and the good achievement of its objectives.

id: Total project cost covered by this Decision:

.pdf (263.3 KB)

This project was also the subject of a press release issued by the Agency.

title: 2012-EU-21023-S
contents:
2012-EU-21023-S

---

Sustainable Traffic Machines - On the way to greener shipping

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

This Pilot Action covers the installation of hybrid propulsion and exhaust gas cleaning solutions on 2 RoPax vessels deployed on the maritime link Rødby-Puttgarden. The 'Traffic Machine'
topics: a  combined  freight  and  passenger  maritime  service
image: represents a perfect fit for the market-oriented test and real-life demonstration of the planned innovative and prototype solution.

id: The Action's innovative character is marked by a unique combination of propulsion and exhaust gas cleaning technologies to specific requirements both of environmental regulations and standardized ferry operations. The innovative concept
title: to  be  tested  within  the  Action
created: is  based  on  a  two-stage  approach:  reducing  the  vessels'  total  energy  demand  and  allowing  for  the  installation  of  the  smallest  possible  scrubber  configuration  (minimising  negative  characteristics  like  weight
project_type: stability and space/payload issues).

id: Energy savings will be mainly achieved by installing new sets of propellers and a hybrid drive
title: representing  the  world's  largest  ever  marine  hybrid  solution  (battery  capacity:  2
created: 6 MWh). The Action provides a new standard of hybrid technology leading to pure battery operation and long-term zero emission targets.

id: By further reducing the greenhouse-gas emissions of the ferry operation
title: the overall  project  significantly  contributes  to  the  Union's  CO2  emissions  targets.  Furthermore
created: it  prepares  the  whole  service  for  the  upcoming  sulphur  regulation
project_type: presenting other maritime operators in the SECA areas a possible method of compliance without losing their competitiveness.

id: The project results will be made public and disseminated
title: through  defined  channels

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The progress of the Action to date is according to the planned schedule and budget. All equipment including the hybrid propulsion
title: Energy Storage System and scrubber are installed on ship 1. First installations are done on ship 2 and retrofitting is partly prepared. Installation of the exhaust gas cleaning system is being prepared in ship 1 and has already been carried out on ship 2.

.pdf (212.7 KB)

CIM WEST terminal expansion

---

Part of Priority Project 24

---

The complex of terminals and the Freight Village (Interporto) in Novara is faced with the opportunities connected to the opening of the new Gotthard Base Tunnel with a potential for more than 800
topics: 000  ITU/year  to  be  transhipped  in  Novara.  The  Action  is  the  first  phase  of  the  Global  project  aiming  at  the  upgrading  of  Novara  Intermodal  Terminal
image: in  Northern  Italy.  The  Action  concerns  the  expansion  of  the  capacity  and  the  rail  accessibility  of  CIM  West  terminal
column8: in  order  to  remove  the  current  technical  bottlenecks  hindering  the  development  of  intermodal  traffic  and  the  consequent  opportunity  of  modal  shift  on  TEN-T  n.6  and  n.24  corridors.  The  Action  will  be  implemented  through  the  Installation  of  a  600  mt  long  track
column9: the  Revamping  and  increase  of  the  intermodal  yard
column10: and the Installation of fixed equipment for ITU transhipment.

id: Several results are expected from the Action in terms of enhanced capacity and rail accessibility
title: terminal  performance  and  intermodal  traffic  in  the  terminal:  increased  hourly  handling  capacity
created: halved  waiting  time  for  trucks  at  transhipment
project_type: a decrease by 40% of the turnaround time for inbound/outbound trains The additional capacity will furthermore enhance the potential rail traffic on the corridors.

The Global project concerns the DANUBE FAB requirements to improve air traffic management performance and the deployment of SESAR. The DANUBE FAB
topics: involving  the  air  space  of  Romania  and  Bulgaria

The outcome of the Action will be a detailed analysis on the transition to Free routes 24H. The outcome of the project
title: including  FRA  and  AGDL  activities
created: will ensure the timely implementation of the IDP within the DANUBE FAB as well as key integration activities with the wider network.

id: The Action is in line with the implementation activities of essential ATM operational changes as identified by the European Air Traffic Management Master Plan and details short term implementation activities
title: aligned with the SESAR baseline.

Facilitating and speeding up ERTMS - Second phase

---

 

---

The Action is an extension in time and scope of certain activities covered by the Action 2011-EU-60013-S "Facilitating and speeding up ERTMS deployment ".

id: The main objectives of the Action are:
• to coordinate the support of Railways and Manufacturers to ERA in the development and improvement of Technical Specifications for Interoperability (TSI) in the field of ERTMS;
<li>to  define  and  validate  a  baseline  independent
title: cost-effective  interoperability  (IOP)  testing  strategy
created: including the roles and obligations of different stakeholders;

id: • to support the validation of the maintenance releases of Baseline 3 (B3);
• to develop a specification (FFFIS) for the interface between an on board (OB) European Vital Computer (EVC) and the control panel for the driver (DMI);
• to improve the performance and IOP features of the telecommunication link;
• to analyse and define the railways' requirements for on-line key management.
The completion of the action will contribute to increasing the interoperability of the EU railway network.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Works related with tests
title: KMS
created: FFFIS and GSM-R specification are ongoing.

title: 2012-EU-50005-S
contents:
2012-EU-50005-S

---

European ITS Platform (EIP)

---

 

---

Within the framework of a Global Project fostering the development of ITS integrated services along transport corridors
topics: the European ITS Platform (EIP) of road authorities and operators aim at enhancing the deployment of harmonised ITS services and the coordinated management of road transport in Europe.

id: The European ITS Platform will be a key player in supporting the future European ITS deployment plans. The Platform will combine resources from different EU actors (EIP Member States/Beneficiaries
title: public  and  private  road  operators)  in  a  joint  effort  to  ensure  the  creation  of  a  proper  environment  for  harmonising  existing  and  future  ITS  services  according  to  EU  policies  and  objectives
created: as well as building upon the achievements of the Easy Way programme.

id: Concretely the following objective will be met:
<li> Providing  strategic  guidance  and  facilitate  consensus  building  amongst  the  countries  beneficiaries
title: road operators and other public and private stakeholders interacting with the European ITS Committee and the European Commission ensuring coherence between national and European policies by safeguarding the EU added value of the project.

id: • Releasing the EasyWay Deployment Guidelines 2012 by developing updated part B (change of national examples of deployment to best practice regarding part a requirements) and drafting factsheets on the national applications of the DG2012.
• Fostering a harmonised concept for "single access point " for data/information in the following way.
• Supporting the maintenance and improvement of the DATEX specifications and the deployment of ITS services.
• Developing a framework which will enhance future ITS harmonised and deployment in Europe. This framework will be based on a clear definition of the state of art for ITS core services across Europe.

Sate of project on 31 December 2013:
All activities have started and are ongoing. This included the elaboration and the agreement of a workplan and the workload allocation among the co-beneficiaries. The tools for technical
title: budget and milestone monitoring have been set and agreed.

id: Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (213.4 KB)

Regional European Electronic Toll Service (REETS TEN)

---

 

---

In compliance with and in support of the existing EC legislation regarding the interoperability of electronic road tolls the proposed action (REETS TEN) aims to deploy EETS compliant services in a cross-border regional project. The Action shall cover the electronically tolled network of 7 Member States (Austria
topics: Denmark
image: France
column8: Germany
column9: Italy
column10: Poland and Spain) and Switzerland. The major Toll Chargers or Toll Charger Associations of these Member States are co-applicants within the proposal. The proposed Action also includes 12 prospective EETS providers represented by the applicant "Association of European Toll and Interoperable Services " (AETIS).

id: The project aims to kick-start the actual deployment of EETS
title: taking into account the perspective of full European coverage as final objective.

title: 2012-EU-21003-P
contents:
2012-EU-21003-P

---

LNG Rotterdam Gothenburg

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

At present
topics: the  European  market  for  LNG  fuel  for  maritime  transport  is  limited  and  infrastructure  is  almost  inexistent  for  small-scale  supply  of  LNG.  The  market  requires  the  ports  to  have  LNG  bunkering  infrastructure
image: while the ports expect sufficient LNG demand to build infrastructure.

id: To solve this situation and develop the maritime LNG sector
title: the present Action will create break bulk infrastructure for small-scale LNG supply in the Ports of Rotterdam and Gothenburg. These large ports combined have a critical mass to assist in the market transition to maritime LNG in northern Europe.

id: The facilities in Rotterdam will distribute stored LNG in the Gas Access To Europe terminal in smaller quantities. From this new break bulk facility other LNG infrastructure facilities can be supplied with LNG
title: like  smaller  terminals  in  other  ports  or  fuelling  infrastructure  for  ships.  The  LNG  break  bulk  facility  in  Rotterdam  will  additionally  provide  a  truck  loading  bay
created: which enables ships to bunker LNG in the port using trucks.

id: The facility in Gothenburg will be the first satellite terminal to be supplied from the Rotterdam break bulk facility. It serves as a proof of concept as well as a means to serve the Scandinavian LNG bunkering market.
The combined facilities for fuelling ships and trucks in both ports will create a synergy effect to address the importance of providing alternative fuel solutions for transport.

SEAGAS

------

The Action aims at determining the feasibility of implementing LNG bunkering facilities in the Port of Roscoff (north-west of France) and the Port of Santander (north of Spain). The studies will take into account the conformity of the infrastructures and the equipment with the standards for risk prevention (SEVESO Directive)
topics: and  the  eventual  constraints
image: to  be  revealed  by  the  environmental  impact  assessments  studies  and  the  public  inquiries.  The  findings  of  these  studies  will  be  an  essential  decision  making  tool  a)  for  the  ferry  operator
column8: to  start  the  construction  and  the  retrofit  of  LNG  vessels;  b)  for  port  authorities  in  Roscoff  and  Santander  that  will  be  able  to  plan  the  design  and  the  implementation  of  LNG  bunkering  stations;  and  c)  for  the  authorities  in  charge  of  the  public  passenger  transport  in  Cantabria.  The  project  will  contribute  to  the  development  of  the  Atlantic  Motorway  of  the  Sea  as  a  wider  benefit  action
column9: serving all the shipowners operating in the region and looking into synergies of different transport modes.

id:

MONALISA 2.0

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

MONALISA 2.0 takes its point of departure in the results and experiences from the ongoing MONALISA project (2010-EU-21109-S)
topics: co-financed  by  TEN-T  under  the  Motorways  of  the  Sea  Programme.  MONALISA  2.0  will  re-use  the  results  and  experiences  from  the  development  within  the  aviation  sector  and  its  SESAR  (Air  Traffic  Management)  programme
image: which has been strongly supported by the European Union through the Framework Programmes and TEN-T during the past decade.

id: The overall objective of MONALISA 2.0 is to strengthen efficiency
title: safety  and  environmental  performance  of  maritime  transport
created: at the same time as the administrative burden of the maritime sector will be reduced.

id: Nine Member States are involved in the studies
title: which include:

id: Testing concrete applications and services which would allow short-term commercial deployment for the navigational part of Sea Traffic Management
Taking joint private-public action to elaborate better standards for maritime route exchange through a common interface and data format
Demonstrating concrete services using new technology to enhance maritime safety
title: making search and rescue and mass evacuations more efficient than today and by addressing port safety

id: Transferring the results of previous EU investments in air traffic management and other sectors into the maritime sector
MONALISA 2.0 will be beneficial to maritime transport world-wide and the ongoing work within IALA
title: IMO and EU.

id:

title: 2012-EU-21008-M
contents:
2012-EU-21008-M

---

Winter Navigation Motorways of the Sea
topics:
WINMOS---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

WINMOS is an action aiming to further develop efficient maritime transport during winter when sea ice covers large parts of the EU's northernmost waters. The Action will develop and adapt the winter navigation system for the benefit of all stakeholders involved in trade and maritime transport in the Baltic Sea area. It includes further cooperation between ice breaking authorities
image: resource  planning
column8: as well as upgrading and renewal of the necessary icebreaking resources.

id: The Action will contribute in particular to formulation of an icebreaking long term strategy in the Baltic Sea
title: improvements  of  the  environmental  performance  and  fuel  saving  on  old  engines  aboard  an  existing  Swedish  icebreaker
created: piloting  new  fuel  injection  technique  (common  rail)  on  other  icebreakers  as  well  as  upgrading  the  existing  Icebreaking  Management  System
project_type: IBNet
contents: to the contemporary needs. Software for training simulators for winter navigation will be upgraded to become more realistic.

id: Sufficient icebreaking resources for the next coming years will be ensured by life extension measures executed on four Swedish icebreakers built in the '70s and a new building of a Finnish state-owned icebreaker. These vessels are together a prerequisite for winter navigation in the Northernmost Baltic Sea area. Sufficient icebreaking resources will ensure efficient winter navigation for the next coming years
title: which is of high importance for the trade between the Northern and the more Central part of the European Union.

id:
State of project on 31 December 2013:
The project is slightly delayed in terms of Development of the Icebreaking Management Network
title: Human element and training (both due to later start) and Acquisition of a new icebreaker (due to procurement issues) but the whole Action should be completed timely and in its entirety.

LNG Bunkering Infrastructure Solution and Pilot actions for ships operating on the Motorway of the Baltic Sea

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The aim of the Global Project is implementing three pilot actions for LNG
topics: methanol and the use of scrubbers. These pilots look at meeting the sulphur legislation in 2015 in the Sulphur Emission Control Area and support the development of a competitive and environmentally sustainable shipping sector in the Baltic Sea.

id: The Action is composed of works and studies. The works aim at the implementation of an LNG bunker supply infrastructure for the use of LNG at the Port of Brofjorden in Sweden. The technical studies aim at the deployment of new LNG technologies in full scale Pilot Actions in vessels in the Baltic Sea and in the North Sea.
The Action will establish LNG bunkering infrastructure including the components required from the terminal to bunker vessel
title: and from the bunker vessel to the LNG fuelled vessels.

id: The deployment of new LNG technologies will result in demonstration of full scale solutions of vessels in commercial operation in the Baltic Sea and in the North Sea
title: as  well  as  design  recommendations
project_type: and suggestions for development of rules and regulations. The Action will additionally investigate financial mechanisms to support ship-owners/operators in converting their fleets to new technology.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project is ongoing. The design for LNG terminal including the LNG tank
title: foundations
project_type: control  system
contents: electricity and bunker terminal arrangement is finalized. The Permits for operations are in place for Building a Connection from the LNG Terminal to Jetty in the Port of Brofjorden. The approval in principle from Classification Society for the Feeder Vessel with innovative cargo tank design is completed.

TWIN-PORT

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The closer integration of Estonia and Finland and their main ports is one of the objectives of the  TWIN-PORT  MoS project. TWIN-PORT is an upgrade of an existing but inefficient maritime transport link between the Ports of Helsinki and Tallinn. It is an important link with direct connections the Nordic Triangle Rail/Road Axis (Priority Project 12) and Rail Baltic " axis: Warsaw-Kaunas-Riga-Tallinn-Helsinki (Priority Project 27).

id: The proposed upgrading of the transport system of the Ports of Helsinki and Tallinn links the existing European corridors and axes together
title: thus  further  reducing  the  bottlenecks
created: and  facilitating  development  and  growth  for  industry  in  the  region  and  beyond.  The  Global  Project  will  increase  cohesion
project_type: cooperation  and  integration  between  the  two  EU  Member  States  and  the  regions.  Along  with  enhancement  of  cooperation  and  industrial  growth
contents: combating climate change by using new innovative technical solutions is another objective of the Global Project.

id: The need for the proposed Action is due increased cargo volumes and will lead to capacity and efficiency gains on the link.
Port infrastructure and access developmentsTraffic system and access improvementsUse of automation and new technology
2) Development of traffic solutions of terminals A
title: B and D in Tallinn Old City Harbour

title: 2012-EU-21017-S
contents:
2012-EU-21017-S

---

Methanol: The marine fuel of the future

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

This pilot action will test the performance of methanol on the existing passenger ferry Stena Germanica operating between the ports of Gothenburg and Kiel. The Stena Germanica is the world's second largest Ro-Pax ferry. The running of the Stena Germanica on methanol will allow the vessel to comply with the new Sulphur Emission Control Area rules ahead of the 2015 deadline.

id: The proposed Action will provide the real "live test " to prove the feasibility of methanol as a future fuel for shipping
title: deliver  the  engine  conversion  kit  which  can  be  further  implemented  on  other  ships
created: and provide the important and ultimate piloting culmination of many years of research.

id: In addition to retrofitting the vessel
title: the  pilot  action  will  also  create  the  appropriate  port  infrastructure  for  the  supply  of  methanol  for  bunkering:  a  bunker  vessel  and  a  storage  tank  will  be  built  to  carry  methanol
created: as well as the corresponding facilities in both ports.

id: The project will bring benefits to the Motorways of the Sea (TEN-T Priority Project 21) on the Baltic Sea as well as have positive impacts on the cohesion of the entire Baltic Sea region.
Please note that the present document is for information purposes only. Only the content of the individual Commission Decision (under preparation) can be considered legally binding.
The results of the Action will be shared publicly with the maritime industry.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project has started with completed technical designs of the methanol installations on the ferry. The selection of a shipyard is on-going. The laboratory tests of the engine conversion are on-going. The works related to installation of the methanol tank
title: conversion of bunkering barge and risks assessments in ports are delayed but are planned to be completed by the end of the project.

2012-EU-21019-S

---

ANNA - Advanced National Networks for Administrations

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The overall objective is the adoption of the national Maritime Single Window and electronic data transmission for the fulfilment of reporting requirements for vessels entering and departing European ports in accordance with EC Directive 2010/65/EU.

id: The objective of the Action is to gain consensus between participating countries and develop cooperation measures to be implemented leading to the simplification and harmonisation of reporting and thereby a reduction of the administrative burden through:
• The development of a common implementation framework for EU Directive 2010/65/EU to ensure appropriate (European) interconnectivity
• The development of national scenarios and a mechanism for gauging degree of national implementation
• Interaction and involvement of administrations and business where necessary in accordance with this Directive

title: possibly  connecting  the  various  national  Maritime  Single  Windows  to  national  logistics  platforms
created: to be included under the Master Plan "Extended Collaboration "

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is ongoing. The requirements to be fulfilled to ensure the implementation of the minimum Maritime Single Window (MSW) features are defined and functional and technical specifications for such requirements developed and agreed amongst the partners. ANNA’s beneficiaries and Institutional Stakeholders reached a consensus on the minimum necessary MSW features necessary in order for all participating countries to have the basic capability to receive and exchange data in a harmonised manner where necessary and achievable within the available timeframe until implementation of Directive 2010/65/EU. The 2015 Interim Master Plan has been delivered.

title: 2012-EU-21020-S
contents:
2012-EU-21020-S

---

Business to Motorways of the Sea

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The B2MoS Action is an innovative study which takes the form of pilot actions principally aimed at preparing and adapting business communities and port authorities' systems to the requirements of Directive 2010/65/EU
topics: providing  interoperable  electronic  documents  and  messages  (ie.  electronic  sea  waybill)  intending  to  boost  the  efficiency  of  door-to-door  MoS  supply  chains
image: facilitating intra-Community trade and increasing European territorial cohesion.

id: The main objectives of the Action are:

title: Port Community Systems (PCS) and business stakeholders' systems to efficiently comply with the requirements of Directive 2010/65/EU and with new National Single Windows.

id: - Improving interoperability of electronic messages and systems for the exchange of crucial transport documents such as the electronic manifest
title: sea  waybill
created: rail consignment note and commercial invoice.

id: - Extending the electronic T2L initiative (electronic proof of Community status of traded goods
title: already  elaborated  in  MOS4MOS)
created: piloting its interoperability among Member States and promoting mutual recognition among Member States of the proof of EU Community Status by electronic means.

id: - Improving the exchange of information of public and private organisations and promoting their operational cooperation to increase the efficiency of MoS.

- Boosting the development of a TEN-T MoS network connecting North and South Europe and East and West regions in the Mediterranean area and improving European cohesion by simplifying specific administrative procedures affecting ultra-peripheral and peripheral regions and reducing barriers to intra-Community trade.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is ongoing. Technical meetings have been organised and the project partners are working on the Report on interoperability of new electronic systems for the exchange of relevant MoS transport documents (activity 1). At the same time
title: the analysis of the trade and transport facilitation initiatives is undergoing (activity 2). Analysis has also started with the study of the work and results of the Commission expert group coordinating the implementation of Directive 2010/65/EU on ship reporting formalities (activity 3).

---

Implementation of RIS in Flanders IV

---

 

---

This Action is part of a Global Project aiming to implement RIS in Flanders
topics: in  line  with  the  RIS  Framework  Directive  (2005/44/EC)  and  follows  from  three  previous  RIS  TEN-T  funded  projects  (2008-BE-30000-P
column8: 2011-BE-70001-P). The objective of the Global Project is to contribute to making inland navigation a safer and more efficient mode of freight transport.

id: The work carried out so far has focused on setting the basic building blocks for developing an extensive set of RIS services and applications in Flanders and then adding specific applications and optimised RIS-related processes. This Action aims to connect existing RIS applications to the 'backbone structure' of RIS Flanders (FlaRIS) but also to extend the range of available RIS services and applications and make them available to a wider public. Through the activities of this project:
<li>A  more  robust  and  better  performing  RIS  environment  will  be  in  place
title: also accessible from on the field with mobile devices

id: <li>More  RIS  information  will  be  made  available  in  a  more  structured  and  user-friendly  way  via  the  new  web  portal  VisuRIS  to  skippers  and  other  interested  people  including  logistics
title: security and safety partners

id: • Foundations will be laid to drive lock planning in Flanders to a higher and more interactive level
• Targeted users will be more aware of the range of River Information Services at their disposal

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project is ongoing. Several activities have started and have made progress
title: such  as  the  adaptations  to  the  RIS  applications  and  installation  of  LED  panels.  Other  activities
created: such as VisuRIS and the redesign of the lock application will start in 2014.

---

Implementation of RIS on the Westerscheldt River III

---

 

---

This Action is the third phase of an existing RIS TEN-T funded projects (2008-EU-30001-P and 2011-EU-70003-P)
topics:
aiming at enhancing efficiency and safety of inland waterway transport on the Westerscheldt river.

The first EU-funded RIS Action on the Westerscheldt (2008-EU-30001-P) focussed mainly on the implementation of the basic RIS services: the realisation of Notice to Skippers (NtS)
image: a  more  in-depth  implementation  of  the  ERI  messages  (electronic  reporting)
column8: the  extension  of  an  existing  maritime  AIS  network  (Automatic  Identification  System)  to  an  Inland  AIS  network
column9: a  first  implementation  of  a  Fairway  Information  Services  (FIS)  portal
column10:
the creation and distribution of Inland electronic navigation charts (Inland ENCs or IENCs).

The second EU-funded RIS Action on the Westerscheldt (2011-EU-70003-P) aimed at extending the range of available RIS functionalities in the Westerscheldt river area: implementing results of EU-projects (e.g. connecting with European RIS databases)
column11: replacing  the  current  Radar  System  (RW)  by  a  better  performing  VTMIS  system
column12: extending the Inland AIS applications and Fairway Information Services (FIS) portal.

id: This Action will provide tools to make transport in the Westerscheldt area even more efficient: improving the exchange of information by replacing the backbone of the Information Processing System of the Scheldt Radar Network
title: enabling  the  use  of  modern  communication  tools  (RIS  applications  for  smartphones  and  tablets)
project_type: improving operational planning on the Canal Gent-Terneuzen and introduction of a WiFi network.

id:

The project has started.

RIS Enabled European IWT Corridor Management

---

 

---

Transport over water has to be planned further in advance than transport by road. If information about delivery time is given at a late stage
topics: the possibilities of transport over water are limited. The ability to plan timely and efficiently based on the right information is the success factor for being able to handle the expected growth in container transport in a sustainable manner.

title: the Action aims to develop the definition and implementation of a RIS corridor approach to strengthen the position of inland navigation within the transport chain. The Action will facilitate the establishment of a structured dialogue between public and private stakeholders across national borders. In addition to that the study will investigate how to foster interoperability and compatibility between the different deployed technologies. The project's activities in the context of the global project shall focus on the deployment of intelligent infrastructure so as to enable the efficient RIS implementation at corridor level.

title: 2012-DK-20010-S

2012-DK-20010-S

---

New railway line Copenhagen-Ringsted (detailed planning phase): access lines to the future Fehmarn Belt fixed link

---

Part of Priority Project 20

---

The existing main line that runs from Copenhagen to Ringsted via Roskilde is one of Denmark's most heavily used and strategically important routes. It is used by commuters between Copenhagen and the rest of Zealand as well as for nationwide and international passenger and freight traffic. The Danish Parliament passed the Construction Act for the New Line Copenhagen-Ringsted on the 26th of May 2010 and the opening is expected by 2018. The new line will result in a significantly improved timetable with more departures
topics: shorter  travel  times  and  fewer  delays
image: in  short  delivering  a  far  better  rail  capacity.  The  new  rail  line  will  consist  of  approx.  60  km's  of  electrified  double  track
column8: including changes of the existing track structures at Køge and Ringsted.

id: The Action consists of detailed planning phase studies of a new high speed railway between Copenhagen and Ringsted
title: a  vital  part  of  the  PP20  (Railway  axis  Fehmarn  Belt)  in  Denmark.  These  studies  consist  of  three  main  activities:  i)  Project  management
created: ii) Detailed design for construction work and iii) Tender packages.

title: 2012-EU-18067-S
contents:
2012-EU-18067-S

---

LNG Masterplan for Rhine-Main - Danube

---

Part of Priority Project 18

---

The Action's overall objective is to prepare and to launch the full-scale deployment of LNG as environmental friendly and efficient fuel in the inland navigation sector within the Priority Project 18 Rhine/Meuse-Main-Danube axis. It is a combined effort from sea and inland ports
topics: authorities  and  barge  and  terminal  operators
image: as  well  as  logistic  service  providers
column8: which will remove market barriers and take the first steps in realising a new LNG supply chain.

id: The Action is a multi-partner involvement of 33 companies and organisations from 12 EU Member States. It will specifically elaborate a comprehensive strategy –a Masterplan- with a detailed roadmap and appropriate guidelines and recommendations for the implementation of LNG as a fuel and cargo on the Rhine-Main-Danube axis. The Masterplan will follow an integrated approach and encompass the full LNG logistic chain from the supplier through the carriers and distribution network to the end user.

The Masterplan will also build on the results and lessons learned from pilot deployments of LNG vessels and terminals in a set of 13 pilots. The pilot deployments will be performed by barge and terminal operators
title: logistics service providers as well as shipyards together with their commercial partners and suppliers. All pilots will cover parts of an entire LNG supply chain from the LNG import terminal to the end-client.

id: The Masterplan will be published and widely disseminated at local
title: national and European levels of decision and policy makers.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Despite unexpected adverse challenges
title: the Action should reach the set objectives and the expected results as planned.

.pdf (242.2 KB)

title: 2012-EU-18089-S
contents:
2012-EU-18089-S

---

High-performance Green Port Giurgiu

---

Part of Priority Project 18

---

This Action addresses Priority Project 18 “Waterway axis Rhine/Meuse-Main-Danube” of the TEN T network. The Action aims at the development  of an eco-efficient Danube engineering and operation port system
topics: in  line  with  the  principles  of  the  “Joint  Statement  on  Guiding  Principles  for  Development  of  Inland  Navigation  in  the  Danube  River  Basin”  (ICPDR
image: Danube  Commission
column8: Sava  Commission
column9:
2008).

The overall objective of the Action is therefore to turn the port of Giurgiu into the first “Green Danube Port” based on integrated energy-efficiency concepts and comprehensive environmental measures for intermodal ports.

id: It will first take stock of the current situation by undertaking a technical and operational analysis
title: a market analysis and an environmental assessment. Then the Action will develop concepts that will support the introduction of innovative technology in the port through a series of studies. The Action will eventually design the new port and define its business model.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
All Activities have started as planned. Analysis on the legal framework of the port and its operational concept has commenced. Preliminary consultations with the relevant stakeholders have been completed. Preparatory works for finalising the terms of reference for the innovation and technology concept
title: port design and business model and the different parts of the feasibility and technical design studies have also started. The drafting of the report on the selected eco-measure to improve the port performance has commenced.

At the intersection between 3 priority corridors on the TEN-T and the two European freight corridors C/2 and D/6
topics: the  Lyon  railway  junction  (NFL)  is  today  close  to  its  capacity  limits
image: with  the  result  that  operating  conditions  leave  to  be  desired  (delays

The  central  section  and  the  corridors  leading  into  and  out  of  this  junction  form  a  national  and  European  bottleneck  that  is  coming  under  increasingly  heavy  pressure  as  the  various  European  priority  projects  go  ahead
column10: as traffic flows between Europe's main regions develop and as the number of commuters travelling per day increases. The NFL junction is therefore targeted by a two-pronged overall operating and infrastructure modernisation programme.

title: 2012-IE-26043-S

2012-IE-26043-S

---

City Centre Re-signalling Project - Connolly Station to Sandymount Station - Design Stage

---

Part of Priority Project 26

---

The Action is part of the Global Project DART (underground programme) which aims to deliver a new underground railway link through Dublin City
topics: along Priority Project 9 and Priority Project 26. It concerns the design studies and planning permission approval for the renewal of the rail signalling system within the Greater Dublin Area: the City Centre Re-signalling Project (CCRP).

id: The existing signalling system in Dublin is outdated and is not capable of meeting the requirements for increased train frequencies to be delivered as part of the DART Underground Programme. The CCRP addresses the need to replace the existing system and provide for increased train frequencies by replacing outdated equipment with more modern technologies.

This Action relates to the completion of the design for the subsequent works and planning permission approval for Phases 3 and 4 (Phases 1 and 2 of the CCRP are almost complete). The full benefits of the installed signalling system will be realised once Phases 3 and 4 completed.

title: 2012-UK-13018-P
contents:
2012-UK-13018-P

---

A8 Dualling Between Ballyrickard Roundabout and Coleman's Corner

---

Part of Priority Project 13

---

This Action will remove a significant bottleneck from the TEN-T network by upgrading to dual-carriageway standard the last remaining single-carriageway section of the A8 between Coleman's Corner and Ballyrickard Road. The A8 is a strategically important road within Northern Ireland
topics: part  of  TEN-T  Priority  Project  13.  This  stretch  of  the  A8  currently  carrying  over  17
image: 000  vehicles  per  day
column8: has  limited  overtaking  opportunities  and  experiences  operational  problems  especially  during  peak  periods.  With  traffic  levels  continuing  to  grow
column9: traffic congestion will increase and road safety will deteriorate.

id: This Action concerns the construction of a 14-km new dual-carriageway with access primarily from grade separated junctions. The works include two new junctions
title: a roundabout and 4 intermediate all-movement junctions along the section. There will be no at-grade cross-over facilities and there will be a constant central reserve with safety barriers along the full length of the section. The alignment has been designed with measures to mitigate adverse environmental impacts and routed to limit impact upon land and properties.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Archaeological trenching works have been completed and all other activities have started.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (292.8 KB)
Department for Transport

---

Part of Priority Project 26

---

This Action is being delivered as part of a Global Project to create a new marine container handling terminal at the Port of Felixstowe. The marine terminal when complete will have a capacity of 2 million twenty foot equivalent units (TEUs) per year.

id: This Action aims to maximise the benefits that can be achieved through intermodal transfer of freight traffic by delivering additional TEU handling capacity on the Felixstowe rail terminal by 2015.

title: tender
project_type: installation  and  commissioning  of  2  additional  rail  mounted  gantry  cranes  with  41  tonne  lift  capacity
contents: 31 metre rail gauge for the Felixstowe rail terminal. Upon completion of the Action the total number of cranes on the rail terminal will be 5.

id: Investment in the Action will ensure that the Port as a significant gateway node on PP26 and PP14 does not become a bottleneck when synergistic investments on these priority routes become operational.

Status of project on 31 December 2013:
The tendering process for the installation of the 2 RMG cranes has been completed and the order has been issued.

image: will  deliver  a  programme  of  25kV  overhead  electrification  from  the  city  of  Manchester  towards  Liverpool
column8: on  the  west  coast  of  England
column9: and Stalybridge to the east of Manchester. The Action is a fundamental project in completing Priority Project 26 (Railway/road axis Ireland/United Kingdom/continental Europe) and ensuring the most effective possible use of current and previous investment in the route.

title: it will provide a fully electrified interchange with Priority Project 14 West Coast Main Line (WCML) at Manchester linking with traffic from across the UK including the nearby TEN-T Port of Liverpool and the associated rail freight flow.

id: <li>The  works  for  the  electrification  of  the  route  between  Earlestown  and  Edge  Hill

title: 2012-UK-26061-S

---

Study to test the potential of Bio-LNG to contribute to European renewable energy targets based on a pilot refuelling and storage network trialled with HGV fleet operators in the UK.

---

Part of Priority Project 26

---

Bio-LNG is an innovative road transport fuel that is particularly suited to Heavy Goods Vehicles (HGV): this action aims to support the decarbonisation of road goods transport in Europe via the rapid deployment of Bio-LNG into the HGV fleet
topics: where emissions per vehicle are greatest.

id: The Action will test the use of Bio-LNG in a full live trial with HGV fleet operators in UK
title: with  detailed  monitoring  of  fuel  and  traffic  throughput
project_type: testing
contents: operating  and  monitoring  a  pilot  of  five  open  access  Bio-LNG  refuelling  stations  planned  to  be  located  in  DIRFT  (Daventry  International  Rail  Freight  Terminal)
topics: Thurrock
image: Avonmouth
column8: Livingston  and  Wakefield.  The  Action  will  extend  the  pilot  to  continental  Europe  by  utilising  two  mobile  refuelling  stations
column9: building local demand for open access refuelling on top of initial demand from UK based operators.

id: The Action will undertake a Bio-LNG study
title: comprising  the  pilot's  results  and  lessons  learned  to  be  disseminated
created: and  thus  also  presenting  three  expected  outcomes  of  the  study:  the  progress  on  standards
project_type: a business model and a roadmap for deployment of Bio-LNG across the TEN-T network.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2014:
The Action is impacted by changes in LNG market and faces delays. One LNG refuelling station is fully operational at Daventry
title: the other four ones are subject to potential location changes. One mobile unit is ready to be deployed on continental Europe.

title: 2012-BE-91088-P
contents:
2012-BE-91088-P

---

Upgrading of inland navigation infrastructure in the port of Ghent

---

 

---

The Action concerns the optimisation of the existing inland navigation infrastructure in the port of Ghent and forms part of the 2010-2020 strategic plan of the port of Ghent. The specific objectives of the Action are to improve accessibility of inland vessels to maritime quays and docks and to adjust older inland navigation infrastructure to the recent economies of scale in inland navigation.

id: This will be achieved through the six activities aiming to provide better mooring facilities thereby:
Making traffic management in the port area smoother
Increasing the number of waiting places for push barges from currently 30 to 50
Adjusting the jetties at the Rodenhuizedok from 60 to 90m for ships of 115 to 135m
Reducing waiting time for ships as a result of separation of waiting places for inland vessels and mooring places
Increasing inland navigation traffic as a result of the optimisation of existing capacity of the port

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project will start in 2014
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:

.pdf (260 KB)

---

Port of Ghent

title: 2012-BE-91091-P
contents:
2012-BE-91091-P

---

The Albert Canal: lifting of bridges and upgrading to class VIb (part 3)

---

 

---

The project aims to improve inland navigation along the Albert Canal
topics: the  most  important  Belgian  waterway  linking  the  port  of  Antwerp  and  the  Scheldt  River  with  the  Meuse  and  the  area  around  Liege.  An  important  part  of  the  traffic  on  the  canal  consists  of  container  transport
image: and the Albert Canal also provides opportunities for Short Sea Shipping. The infrastructure in and around the Albert Canal must be adjusted to meet the needs of the growth of goods shipment in general and of container transport in particular that is expected in the future. The accessibility of the Albert Canal for Short Sea Shipping must also be improved.

id: The implementation of the Global project also aims to improve significantly the safety of shipping traffic on the Albert Canal.
In line with the overall priorities of the Global Project
title: the Action focuses on two main achievements:

id: 1) Lifting the Houtlaanbridge at Wijnegem which currently has an under bridge-clearance of 7 metres. After the works
title: the  clearance  will  be  of  9.1  metres.  The  works  include  adaptation  of  land  abutments
project_type: roads and the bridge construction itself will be heightened. Temporary disruption reduction measures for road traffic are foreseen in the Action.

id: 2) Widening of the canal at Merksem in order to create a wet section of 380 m2 and upgrade this section to class VIb. The project contains the construction of a new road
title: the  realisation  of  a  new  bank
created: the demolition and removal of the existing bank constructions.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project will start in 2014
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (249.9 KB)

title: 2012-BE-91109-S
contents:
2012-BE-91109-S

---

Renovation of the Royers Lock in Antwerp

---

 

---

The Royers Lock is one of the oldest locks in the Port of Antwerp. It links the tidal Scheldt river with the docks on the right bank of the Port of Antwerp and further on to the Albert Canal. Built in 1907 and put into operation in 1908
topics: the  lock  is  182
image: 5  m  long
column8: 22  m  wide  and  6
column9: 41  m  deep.  Originally  intended  for  maritime  shipping
column10: the  lock  is  currently  only  used  for  inland  navigation.  However
column11: due  to  the  economies  of  scale  in  inland  navigation
column12: the  lock  has  become  relatively  small  (a  convoy  of  four  push-barges  can't  pass  through  the  lock  anymore).  In  addition
column13: the lock is outdated and requires a lot of maintenance in order to be kept in operation causing disruption and longer waiting times for inland navigation willing to enter the Port of Antwerp or move on to the hinterland through the Albert Canal.

id: The Action is part of a Global Project aiming to renovate the Royers lock and improve accessibility for inland vessels to the Port of Antwerp and to the Albert Canal. The Action consists in the preparatory studies (Cost-Benefit Analysis
title: concept  design  study
project_type: safety  plan  and  risk  management  system)  leading  to  the  delivery  of  a  verified  final  design  and  tendering  documents  for  the  renovation  works
contents: which are expected to start at the beginning of 2016 (second stage of the Global Project).

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The concept design and CBA have been completed. The studies are expected to be completed in 2015.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (262.4 KB)

This project was also the subject of a press release issued by the Agency.

title: 2012-BE-91125-S
contents:
2012-BE-91125-S

---

Studies for the improvement of the Charleroi-Brussels canal (E04)
topics:
section Lembeek-Brussels---

 

---

The Action is part of a Global Project which aims to upgrade the section Brussels-Lembeek of the Canal Charleroi-Brussels to allow the safe and smooth navigation of 1350 ton ships as a minimum
image: and  possibly  Class  Va  ships  if  feasible.  The  upgrade  will  require  substantial  works  on  the  section  to  adapt  the  waterway
column8: adjust  existing  locks  or  build  new  locks
column9: raise bridges and move a culvert for the river Zenne. The objective of the Action is to carry out:

id: 1) Preparatory studies for the full upgrade of the section for the passage of 1350 ton ships (Class IV) and explore at the same time the feasibility of adapting it to class Va. The studies will focus on traffic simulation as well as hydraulic
title: water  management
created: environmental  impact  and  socio-economic  aspects.  These  studies  will  provide  a  basis  for  a  decision  on  whether  to  adapt  the  section  to  fully-fledged  Class  IV  only
project_type: or upgrade to class Va.

id: 2) Design studies for the raising of bridges and rebuilding of the culvert of the river Zenne under the canal in Halle. These studies will
title: once  completed
created: allow for the publication of tenders and start of implementation.

id: By eliminating the bottlenecks and by adapting the section Lembeek- Brussels of the Canal Charleroi-Brussels
title: class  IV  vessels  will  be  able  to  navigate  at  a  higher  speed  and  will  be  able  to  cross  each  other  over  the  full  length  of  the  waterway  connection  between  Brussels  and  Lembeek.  Bigger  locks  will  accommodate  longer  vessels  and  higher  bridges  will  allow  the  transport  of  containers  on  this  section
project_type: more efficient and economically attractive on this important axis from Antwerp to Charleroi and France.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The project has started.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:

.pdf (245.5 KB)

The Action concerns the removal of 14 level crossings and the creation of replacement infrastructure on the Belgian TEN-T network.

id: It contributes to the following objectives of the Global Project:
• Capacity increase as a result of the removal of bottlenecks
• Reduction in the number of registered minutes incurring traffic disturbance for railways
• Reduction of the costs of the maintenance and renewal of level crossings
As a result of the conflict-free crossings
title: the removal of the above-mentioned level crossings will also allow an overall increase in rail and road traffic.

id:

title: 2012-BE-92063-S
contents:
2012-BE-92063-S

---

Shore power in Flanders

---

 

---

During the last years
topics: the interest in the use of shore power facility has strongly increased in the Flemish ports and inland waterways. The Action will contribute to establishing a shore power network on a large scale for inland navigation in Flanders to eventually contribute to its development as an environmental friendly alternative to road transport.

id: The Action concerns the studies and pilot implementation to be carried out to enhance the level of shore power services for inland navigation in Flanders. It includes the implementation of a uniform payment system and the development of its dedicated web application
title: and the installation of shore power boxes in three different locations.

id: In order to design a uniform exploitation and payment system for shore power in Flanders
title: market  surveys  and  cost-benefit  analysis  will  be  undertaken
created: as  well  as  the  design  and  the  operation  of  a  single  web  application  platform  for  accessing  shore  power  services.  The  Action  will  deploy
project_type: monitor and evaluate a pilot project aiming at installing and adapting existing and new shore power supply to connect to the web application and support the proposed payment system in three different locations.

id: The Action will also develop a strategy to stimulate the expansion of this environmental friendly technology by investigating on how a national network of shore power facilities should be expanded to meet the rapidly growing demand.

State of progress on 31 December 2014:
The pilot is almost completely deployed. The implementation of a uniform payment system and the development of its dedicated web application took longer than planned and are almost completed. The strategy to expand the solution to Flanders is to be launched in 2015.

---

Plans for establishing a locomotive service point at the Port of Hamburg to create capacities for hinterland connections (rail) and the port's rail network

---

 

---

The Action deals with rail improvements in Port of Hamburg by conducting preparatory studies for construction of a locomotive service point in the Port.

id: Rail freight transport plays an important role in the connection of the Port – Europe's third busiest - to the European hinterland. 11% of the entire German rail freight transport and around 34% of containers transported by rail use the Port's railway as point of origin and destination. The average number of freight trains per day will rise from the current 220 to 400 per year by 2020.
The increasing numbers of freight trains are also connected to a substantial increase in light runnings between the Port and the German rail network.  Even today
title: for  this  purpose  around  400  individually  driven  locomotives  travel  each  week  between  the  Port
created: Hamburg  and  Maschen  (nearest  locomotive  service  point).  By  having  a  locomotive  service  point  in  the  Port
project_type: its operational track will be relieved of these light runnings.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Although the implementation of two of the five activities is slightly delayed
title: the project is expected to be completed as planned.

The objective of the proposed Action is the construction of a new stretch of motorway including the motorway structures to raise capacity

title: 2012-DE-91086-P
contents:
2012-DE-91086-P

---

Quality and capacity upgrade of the railway system in the seaport of Bremerhaven

---

 

---

As a leading seaport among North-western European ports
topics: Bremerhaven  is  inter-linked  to  main  European  trading  regions  not  only  via  short  sea  services
image: but  in  particularly  also  via  railway  connections  to  the  Benelux  states
column8: Germany
column9: the  Iberian  peninsula
column10: the Baltic States and Central Eastern Europe.

id: The main objectives of the project are a substantial technical upgrade and expansion of the existing railway capacity and efficiency in the port. The project lays the foundation for further increase of today’s very high share of rail at Bremerhaven hinterland modal split (45% for container and 80% for automobile traffic). Forecasts expect rail traffic growth to reach 770 trains per week by 2025.
Due to the overload of port rail infrastructure
title: existing  infrastructure  insufficiencies
created: accessibility  and  productivity  of  the  seaport  and  the  whole  network  are  hampered.  The  port  rail  system  has  become  increasingly  sensitive  to  disturbances  of  operations
project_type: breakdown  of  infrastructure  and/  or  management  systems
contents: adverse weather conditions.

id: The project aims to remedy the situation and cope with long term traffic growth within the port and on the hinterland network and ensures economic and environmentally friendly transport of containers and automobiles relevant for the Union's single market and the Community’s growth.
More precisely the Action will expand the capacity in the 'Kaiserhafen' and 'Insumer Deich' shunting yards by adding tracks and increasing track length to 700-750 meters.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is ongoing by preparation of the construction sites. All contracts signed. The main works are foreseen in 2014 and 2015.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:

.pdf (199.4 KB)

---

Construction of a second lock at Zerben

---

 

---

The Action is part of a Global Project which aims at upgrading by 2018 the Elbe-Havel Canal to Class Vb inland waterway standards.

id: The Action specifically addresses the bottleneck at Zerben and foresees the partial construction of a new lock chamber and other necessary river engineering works to comply with Class Vb standards.
It consists in particular of:
<div  style= "text-align:  justify; ">The  excavation  pit  for  the  lock:  260  m  long
title: 35 m wide and 17 m deep below the current terrain level.

id: <div  style= "text-align:  justify; ">The  replacement  of  the  upper  weir:  the  layby  basin  of  the  new  second  chamber  will  be  built  on  top  of  the  old  upper  weir
title: which will therefore be reconstructed at a slightly offset location.

id: The adaptation of the upper layby basin: it will be widened at its southern end by relocating the banks. Sheet-piling will be driven to secure the new bank. This new vertical wall will be developed to serve as a berthing and staging area for commercial shipping as well as a starting point for vessels waiting to enter the second lock chamber.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
All 3 activities have started and are progressing faster than planned.

As  a  result  of  the  study  and  the  eventual  completion  of  the  corresponding  works

Construction of the second Mosel lock in Trier

---

 

---

The proposed Action is part of a larger scheme aiming at improving navigation on the Mosel River from Koblenz to Trier by building a series of second lock chambers.

id: It concerns the construction of a second lock at Trier with a dimension of 210 x 12.5 m
title: equivalent  to  Class  Vb  waterway  standards.  Due  to  the  limitation  of  the  funding  period  until  the  end  of  2015  the  works  undertaken  encompass  only  a  part  of  the  construction  of  the  lock  chamber;  the  works  undertaken  include  new  separation  moles  in  the  upper  and  lower  forebays
created: the digging of the building pit as well as the construction of the lock's bottom plate. The first part of the lock chamber walls will also be started under this project.

id: Due to the environmental impact of the project the implementation of an environmental compensation measure is also obligatory. Covering a total area of 14.8ha
title: the Monaise region along the Mosel River will therefore be rehabilitated and on a former agricultural land a flood plain area will be created.

id:

The tender for the civil engineering works of the lock chamber was awarded. All construction works are only planned from 2014 onwards.

topics: today  single-track
image: represents  an  important  bottleneck  at  the  TEN-T  trans-boundary  railway  corridor  from  North  Germany  through  Jutland.  More  than  80%  of  all  import  and  export  transport  on  rails  to  and  from  Denmark

The Action is part of the Global Project
topics: The  East-West  Corridor
image: a  long-term  strategy  to  complement  activities  of  the  Danish  conventional  line  going  from  Esbjerg  to  Øresund  via  the  Great  Belt  link  and  Copenhagen.  The  aim  is  to  take  direct  benefit  of  the  results  of  several  priority  projects

---

Kongsted safe parking area

---

 

---

The global project is a vital part of implementation of the Danish Rest area strategy
topics: in line with Directive 2008/96/EC on road infrastructure safety management.

id: The global project will increase the capacity for cars and especially trucks on the motorway between Køge and Ringsted. On this rest area there will be 64 parking spaces for passenger cars and 35 parking spaces for trucks. There will also be established 200 m of length parking for special transports (extra-long vehicles).
To make the area safer at night
title: the  rest  area  will  be  illuminated.  This  project  will  replace  three  less  safe  rest  areas  and  replace  them  by  the  new  safe  and  secure  area
created: where  the  truck  parking  capacity  is  bigger  than  the  sum  of  the  old  ones.  At  the  same  time  it  will  serve  as  a  pilot  project
project_type: focusing on how to develop appropriate/ the best possible type of safe parks in Denmark.

id: The Action concerns works for the implementation of a safe and secure rest area on the E20 motorway in Denmark. Activities range from the final design to the construction and inauguration. They also include the implementation of an ITS system informing drivers on parking availability.

All 3 activities (Planning and design of rest area
title: call  for  tender  and  contract
created: Construction works and inauguration and Additional works including ITS) are in progress. While finishing works remain in 2014 the rest area has been inaugurated already.

------

The Action concerns all remaining studies necessary to tender the works for the construction of the northern border section of the Ionian Highway. This section of approximately 70 km
topics: from  the  end  of  concession  (Egnatia  Odos–Ionian  Highway  Interchange)  to  Kakavia
image: is  the  cross-border  point  of  the  country's  road  connection  to  the  EU  and  Albania.  These  studies  and  the  subsequent  works  will  contribute  to:  i)  satisfy  the  increased  demand  for  the  movement  of  passengers  and  cargos  to  and  from  Albania
column8: ii)  connect  North-West  Greece  with  Italy
column9: Slovenia  and  the  other  EU  Member  States
column10: through the sea corridors that pass from the port of Igoumenitsa (primarily) and Patra (secondarily).

title: and ii) three interchanges along the final 16 km from the Agioi bridge to Kakavia. They include:

id: • Geological (Geophysical) studies Geotechnical Investigations and Evaluation of Geotechnical Investigations
• Preparation of Safety and Health Plan and Safety and Health File (SHP and SHF)
• Special Architectural Design of Vortopos archaeological site
The Action is complementary to the already co-financed Action 'Ionian Highway (Western Axis) from the end of concession to Kakavia' - 2007-EL-90901-S.

title: 2012-ES-91148-S
contents:
2012-ES-91148-S

---

Interzalia: Intermodal Station Project in Zalia

---

 

---

The Action concerns studies for the design of an intermodal station framed within the Area of Industrial and Logistic Activities of Asturias. The creation of the intermodal station will make this area the most important logistics space in the north-west of the peninsula. The intermodal station will facilitate process optimisation and favour synergies between customers and users
topics: improving traffic efficiency and freight distribution between the areas connected by the trans-European Transport Network. It will improve the port to port transport and develop sea routes for the transport of freight entering and leaving the ports of Gijon and Aviles. It will increase the railway participation share in land freight transport and improve road/rail and rail/sea transport and the logistic efficiency in the freight transport of the influence area of the intermodal station. The intermodal station will increase the modal shift from road to other modes of transport (sea/rail).

id: The main objectives of the Action are to:
Provide the ZALIA logistics platform with the detailed design of the multimodal terminal and the road access to it.
Study the freight volumes per mode and per type.
Provide solution for the management model of the intermodal terminal.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
Tender for the studies for the selection of exact location and development of the optimum alternative of the intermodal station and road accesses has been launched.

The Action plays a key role in the improvement of intermodal transport

image: North Africa and Italy through the removal of existing bottlenecks.

id: The main objectives of the proposed Action are:

title: facilities and services of the Port of Barcelona for a better integration of the different transport modes;

id: To integrate the new terminal with the city of Barcelona through new connections and new traffic system;

<div  style= "text-align:  justify; ">To  contribute  to  the  establishment  of  the  sea  transport  as  a  viable  alternative  to  road  haulage  and  as  an  efficient  and  environmentally-friendly  transport  mode
title: specially  between  Spain  and  Italy
created: and between Spain and North Africa;

id: To promote the reliability and frequency of short sea shipping and particularly of the motorways of the sea;
To contribute to the increase of the modal shift from road to both rail and sea;
To better integrate short sea shipping more fully in door-to-door freight transport services;
To reduce the external costs by 82% (about €2.695 million) and CO2 emissions by 62%.

title: 2012-ES-91171-P
contents:
2012-ES-91171-P

---

Efficient Operations and Environmental Performance Improvement of the Port of Bilbao

---

 

---

The level and quality of infrastructure have a direct effect on the port business productivity and growth
topics: especially during the period of economic transition. Time is crucial in the fast moving maritime market. Berthing and loading phases have to be kept to a minimum and delays avoided. Construction of upgrades and refurbishment works often has to work around tidal possessions with structures designed to suit. Vessel characteristics vary widely and there are compatibility complexities in combining high speed and conventional vessel on the same berth.

id: In order to achieve the sustainable development of the Port of Bilbao 3 key areas for improvement are financed by this Action are the following:
Investments to increase the port operations in the Sollana area by lengthening of the Punta Sollana Breakwater and offering a safer maritime access to that area:
For safe and efficient maritime operations within port area
title: the depth of the Axpe docks will be increased and its quayside will be reinforced.

id: The Ro – Ro linkspan will be improved with the purpose of allowing RoRo vessels and RoPax ferries to berth safely at quays that are otherwise unsuitable because of their size and shape and/or because of tidal conditions. This will increase level of environmental safety and efficiency for cargo handling operations.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The works in the 3 key areas have started and are progressing.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:

.pdf (231.2 KB)

---

id: The transition towards an LNG bunkering supply network requires a doubleaxis action. On one side
title: the  existing  and  future  maritime  fleet  needs  to  be  adapted  in  terms  of  technology  of   ngines  and  storage.  On  the  other
created: terminals and other facilities at ports need to be upgraded or developed in order to deploy a full supply chain providing enough security of supply.

id: The Action will consist of studies to address both maritime fleet and port facilities transition simultaneously
title: reducing the time-to-market of the LNG Bunkering Service in the Spanish  mediterranean ports.
a  study  will  be  conducted  to  analyse  the  technical
project_type: economic  and  legal  aspects  of  LNG  bunkering  vessel  operations  enabling  medium  term  deployment  (2015-2020).  It  will  include  a  detailed  evaluation  and  design  of  an  optimised  LNG  supply  chain  in  key  Spanish  ports  of  the  Mediterranean  Sea  (the  ports  of  Barcelona
contents: Valencia  and  Cartagena)
topics: based on existing onshore infrastructure and a LNG bunkering vessel aiming to offer a flexible supply to a set of nearby locations.

id:

Market tests are on-going and studies for the interaction of the supply vessel with the existing LNG terminals and ports infrastructures have been completed
