The objective of the Action is to develop a hub for LNG as fuel for the Port of Ferrol in the northwest of the Iberian Peninsula.

id: It focuses on the design of the necessary facilities
title: infrastructure  and  procedures  in  order  to  supply  LNG  as  fuel  along  the  entire  port  logistics  chain:  from  the  port  services  to  ships  navigating  on  the  Atlantic  corridor
created: which belongs to the Motorway of the Sea Western Europe.

id: LNG is rapidly emerging as a more environmentally friendly fuel for the shipping sector and its uptake is encouraged by the European Union.

The studies contribute to climate change mitigation and to the reduction of the impact of transport on the environment. The results will be disseminated among stakeholders and the project can be used as an example for the promotion and for policy making in the field of sustainable transport.

The Action concerns Rail Freight Corridor 2
image: to be established by 10 November 2013 in compliance with EU Regulation 913/2010.The aim of the Action is to to increase the efficiency of the corridor by:

id: • Improving the Corridor performance management with better monitoring and the implementation of an action plan
<li>Updating  the  Corridor  Information  Document  to  make  it  more  transparent
title: complete and user-friendly

title: 2012-EU-94167-S
contents:
2012-EU-94167-S

---

SWIFTLY Green (Sweden-Italy Freight Transport and Logistics Green Corridor)

---

 

---

SWIFLTY Green aims to develop a toolbox for green issues in the context of TEN-T planning. It will consist of guidelines
topics: tools and recommendations for greening of transport and will be based on best practice and results from a thorough mapping and analysis of previous and on-going projects. The resulting Green Corridor Development Plan could give input for the further planning and implementations of the TEN-T Core network corridors. It is also envisaged that the toolbox will stimulate the transport and logistics sector and industry to implement efficient and sustainable transport solutions.

id: Developing a set of measures for greening the transport corridor based on solutions implemented both at Member States and European Level.
Delivering a methodology to assess the performance of the implemented measures. The proposed measures will be tested and validated through pilot and business cases.

Developing a tool box consisting of a set of guidelines and recommendations for actions to be implemented by the relevant authorities at the appropriate governance level in order to enhance TEN-T corridor management.

State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is progressing as planned. Preparatory work is undergoing to allow for the mapping of the corridor and the greening measures to be identified.

Development of the Madrid–Lyon axis on the TEN-T Mediterranean Corridor (CLYMA)

---

 

---

The CLYMA project aims to provide the necessary tools to create an integral transport corridor which identifies and connects the main nodes
topics: facilitates the interoperability within and between the various transport modes and the fluid transport services for freight and provides for a more sustainable transport by applying new technologies and concepts for infrastructure planning and management (green corridor concept).

id: The Action consists of the implementation of the corridor approach to a section of the Mediterranean corridor
title: concretely  to  the  Western  part  of  the  corridor  and  specifically  to  the  Madrid–Lyon  axis.  This  axis  includes  Madrid
project_type: Zaragoza
contents: Lleida
topics: Tarragona
image: Barcelona
column8: Girona
column9: Spanish–French  border  through  Le  Boulou  and  through  Port  Bou
column10: Perpignan
column12: Montpellier

id: The main objectives of the Action are:
-       To analyse the current and future situation of the Madrid–Lyon axis
title: especially the missing links in terms of infrastructure and services.

id: -       To study the development of an intermodal corridor in order to improve modal shift.
-       To develop management structures for intermodal nodes as a pilot system for a managerial structure for the whole Corridor.
-       To develop the "green corridor " concept in the Madrid–Lyon Axis as a pilot system extensible to the whole Corridor.
-       To develop a strategic and operational plan for ICT integration among the Axis extensible to the whole Corridor.
-       To develop strategic actions in the nodes of the Axis to solve infrastructure capacity needs.

image: Build
column8: Finance

column10: a  32km  highway  section
column11: is €265 million. The Finnish government has decided in favour of PPP procurement in order to accelerate the realisation of the project in light of limited budgetary resources and the significant increase in traffic.

id: Please note that the present document is for information purposes only. Only the content of the individual Commission Decision (under preparation) can be considered legally binding.

title: which  are  required  to  provide  necessary  information  for  the  risk  management  of  the  PPP  contract.  Furthermore

project_type: an  important  consideration  in  the  relatively  small  Finnish  market.  In  addition
contents: further  TEN-T  financial  support  will  be  explored
topics: in particular the suitability of EU financial instruments.

Improvement of the efficiency of intermodal Ro-Ro platform in the Port of Dunkirk

---

 

---

The Global Project aims at the new design and extension of Dunkirk Port's RoRo terminal to satisfy the current and future steady traffic growth. The RoRo traffic has increased tenfold since 2000
topics: with a traffic volume yearly growth of 10.6% in 2012.

id: The current terminal setup and design requires a stopover time of two hours for 12 calls per day. The RoRo terminal is at the capacity limit
title: with no potential for development or growth.

id: The Action aims at the execution of construction works to re-design and extend Port's RoRo terminal to improve efficiency
title: smooth  traffic
created: reduce the stopover time of vessels and increase frequencies.

title: the  Port  of  Dunkirk  requires  the  reorganization  of  the  terminal  platform  layout
created: the relocation of facilities and the installation of technical facilities.

id: Reducing the stopover time will permit to extend the number of calls per day to 13 or 14 calls a day. To gain one call per day
title: one vessel needs to gain 15 minutes per call in Dunkirk and in Dover.

id:

The project is progressing overall according to planning.

The Action constitutes an essential preparatory work for the implementation on the Italian railway network of the Commission Regulations (EC) No 62/2006 of 23 December 2005 and (EU) No 328/2012 of 17 April 2012 concerning the technical specification for interoperability relating to the telematics applications for freight subsystem of the trans-European conventional rail system (TAF TSI).

The Action encompasses 6 activities:
1.    Train Running Information and Train Delay Cause Function

3.    Train Forecast Function
4.    Train Enquiries Function
5.    Train preparation Function
6.    Short term path request Function

The Action will develop the above functions within the Trenitalia systems
topics: harmonising them with the existent business processes and realizing a pilot for testing the results.

title: 2012-IT-91076-S
contents:
2012-IT-91076-S

---

365 Po River System - Preliminary Project to improve navigation from Cremona Port to the Adriatic Sea

---

 

---

The Study aims
topics: in  the  framework  of  a  Global  Project
image:
to upgrade the capacity of the Po River where navigation is currently not possible on a year round basis. The goal of this Action is the completion of a pre-feasibility study exploring both a short/medium (free stream) and a long term (regulation) solutions to upgrade the Po navigability and guarantee navigation at least 300 out of 365 days peryear. The study outcome will serve as basis for decision-making on eventual technical solution to be followed. The study will also look at the possibility of financing these works through the establishment of a Public-Private Partnership to create power plants for producing hydraulic electricity.

The Action encompasses four Activities:
•    Activity 1 – Project management
column8:
communication and dissemination
•    Activity 2 – Pre-feasibility study for the upgrade of the Po navigability
•    Activity 3: Environmental assessment of the current status of Po and study of the environmental impacts of the two solutions (free stream
column9:
regulation);
•    Activity 4 – Socio-economic impact of the upgrade of the navigability of Po River

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The preparatory works for launching the tenders for all Activities have been completed. Preliminary analyses for Activities 2 and 3 have started. These analyses will contain the following: inventory of the current bottlenecks hindering the Po navigation
title: bathymetric  measurements  and  data  collection  on  the  hydraulic  and  geomorphology  situation
created: analysis of the free stream and regulation hypothesis.

Study aimed at the execution of the preliminary project and the legal
topics:
economic and financial analysis for the implementation of a PPP model on the Bari Heavy Vehicle Road.---

 

---

The main objective of the Action is the analysis of the feasibility of procurement through a PPP model of a heavy vehicle road
image: connecting  the  TEN-T  Port  of  Bari  and  the  main  road  system
column8: in order to improve the accessibility of the port. The construction of a heavy vehicle road aims at reducing congestion and mitigating the impact of heavy traffic on the urban area. It is estimated that the construction of such an interconnection from the Port of Bari to the highway would reduce the emissions of pollutants by about two-thirds.

id: The activities of the proposed Action include the preparation of technical and design aspects of the preliminary project as well as the preparation of economic
title: financial and studies for public- private partnership models that could be utilised to procure the project.

id: The studies aim at identifying the most suitable project solution available for the transit of heavy vehicles from the port terminal of Bari to the ring road of the city. At the end of the preliminary studies and investigations a decision for one of the identified traffic routes will be taken. The length of the different routes ranges from 4.0 to 5.6 km in length and an investment volume from €80 to €160 million. Finally on the basis of the financial
title: legal and technical studies a decision in favour or against a PPP to procure the project will be taken.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is ongoing. There have been some delays to the start of certain activities due to administrative procedures that have led to an extension of the end date of the Action by six months to 15 June 2015.

2012-NL-93121-S

---

Phase 2 Implementation study to prepare the start of the PPP procurement to improve maritime access to the TEN-T network at Amsterdam

---

 

---

Please note that the present document is for information purposes only. Only the content of the individual Commission Decision (under preparation) can be considered legally binding.

id: The sea lock complex at Ijmuiden is the physical access point which connects the North Sea with Amsterdam Seaports and is used intensively by shipping traffic. Due to the increasing size of ships a greater proportion of such traffic can only be processed via the largest of the four locks in this complex. If not addressed
title: the  sea  locks  will  reach  maximum  capacity  soon  and  result  in  delays

id: The Action consists of studies preparing the sea lock at IJmuiden for procurement through PPP
title: which  will  be  the  first  DBFM  (Design-Build-Finance  and  Maintain)  project  for  large  maritime  infrastructure  in  the  Netherlands.  The  Action  forms  phase  2  of  the  project  preparation;  the  first  phase  was  supported  by  a  TEN-T  grant
created: 2010-NL-93302-S.  The  Action  covers  studies  necessary  for  launching  the  tender
project_type: such  as  finalising  the  spatial  planning  procedure
contents: the completion of a formal Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) together with further technical studies to determine output specifications that will contribute to the completion of the tender documentation and DBFM contract.

id: The main objectives are to advance the maturity of the global project in order to start the procurement procedures utilising a DBFM model. With this extension
title: the  lock  capacity  can  grow  to  an  estimated  125  million  tons  p.a.  The  expected  investment  volume  of  the  project  is  €740  million.  Furthermore
created: innovative financing through project bonds is being considered and the Action will contribute to the development of a standardised documentation for PPP for large-scale maritime infrastructure projects.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment has issued a tender for a DBFM contract in April 2014. Commercial and financial close on the project is expected in the third quarter of 2015.

title: 2012-SE-91084-P
contents:
2012-SE-91084-P

---

Rosersberg intermodal terminal. Construction work for transfer-yard

---

 

---

The Rosersberg Intermodal Terminal Project addresses the need to minimize the transportation of goods by road and rail through central Stockholm. It will contribute to increased capacity and efficiency of goods transportation in the TEN-T network surrounding Stockholm. One of the cornerstones of the plan is the creation of more effective connections to and from intermodal nodes
topics: i.e. road and rail links.

id: The proposed Action is about the development of the transfer yard
title: which will connect the East Coast Line with two terminals: the Stockholm North Intermodal Terminal and the Postal Terminal (“Postens terminalområde”).

id: Three new tracks will be constructed to the west of the East Coast Line in Rosersberg. The transfer yard will be connected to the East Coast Line to the north and south of Rosersberg. The rail crossing at Slottsvägen will be rebuilt to accommodate three tracks. An existing subway south of Rosersberg Station will be extended to provide room for the third track. An existing subway south of Rosersberg Station will be extended to provide room for the third track.
As a result the Rosersberg Intermodal Terminal will:

title: mainly through increased competitiveness of multimodal transport and stimulating regional economic activity and employment.

id: divert large volumes of traffic away from central parts of the city and improve conditions for all categories of local road users
improve conditions for long- and short-haul heavy goods vehicles by increasing safety
title: reducing journey times and enabling better coordination within supply and distribution networks across different transport modes

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The progress of the Action to date is generally according to the planned schedule and budget
title: apart  from  Sub-Activity  1.3
created: which  has  incurred  a  delay  of  about  5  months.  This  is  not  expected  to  have  any  impact  on  the  final  date  of  the  Action
project_type: as  planned.  The  project  shows  a  quasi-equal  technical  and  financial  progress
contents: of around 60%.

id: Söderenergi annually receives around 1

image: 000  tonnes  via  truck  and  200
column8: 000  tonnes  via  rail  (which  still  includes  transport  via  road  from  the  train  station  to  the  plant).  The  Igelsta  port  is  expected  to  be  able  to  handle  a  further  50%  increase  in  volumes  of  renewable  and  recyclable  fuels  (mostly  dry  bulk).  The  redesign  and  construction  of  the  Igelsta  port  is  expected  to  support  a  modal  shift  to  sea  transport  of  250
column9: 000  tonnes  in  the  short  term  and  substantially  more  in  the  medium  to  long  term
column10: of  recyclable  fuel
column11: arriving to Söderenergi either by road or by rail.

id: The Action is vital to achieve the objective of the Global project (i.e. to optimise the logistics of the port to support a modal shift from road/rail to ship) since it consists of a number of analyses which will study and highlight existing physical and economic conditions regarding the port and transport via sea.
The Action aims at increasing the maturity of Söderenergi’s implementation plan through the completion of all necessary environmental and/or design studies
title: with  a  view  to  obtaining  the  necessary  internal  and  external  permits  for  reconstruction  of  the  Igelsta  port

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is ongoing. The detailed design study and the geotechnical studies have been completed as planned as well as the risk analysis. The results so far show that the bottlenecks preventing an increased volume of fuels arriving via ships rather than road are related to the handling equipment as well as lack of storage facilities
title: rather  than  the  extension  of  the  quay
created: which was the initial analysis. This means that the storage and fuel handling operation needs to be more extensive.

---

 

---

The Global Projectincludes doubling of all year loading capacity at the deepwater port in Luleå from 9 to 20 million tonnes. A major step forward to make this possible is to conduct the studies suggested in this Action
topics: preparing for permission from the Land and Environmental Court to go ahead with the construction work.

id: Under current circumstances the maximum draught of ships that can use Luleå is limited to 10.90 meters. This allows an approximate maximum ship size of 55 000 dwt to be fully loaded in Luleå today. This restriction leads to that some larger ships leave the port short-loaded
title: with  un-necessary  high  transport  cost  per  ton  cargo  as  a  result.  The  same  procedure  is  sometimes  the  case  for  incoming  large  shipments  of  coal  and  coke  to  the  steel  works
created: when  a  partial  discharging  by  lighter  must  be  done  before  entering  the  port.  This  is  not  only  an  expensive  and  time  consuming  operation
project_type: at  about  €50

topics: that  increases  insecurity  about  delivery  time
image: decreases  safety
column8: and  furthermore
column9: good weather conditions are necessary during the 2–3 days needed.

---

Improving access to the TEN-T Core Port of Felixstowe/Harwich: Haven Channel deepening project

---

 

---

The development of the next generation of container ships will require European ports to ensure that they have access routes which can safely accommodate them. Harwich Haven Authority is the statutory harbour authority covering the ports of Felixstowe
topics: Harwich
image: Mistley and their seaward approaches. The ports handle significant amounts of containerised traffic from deep sea and short sea shipping routes.

id: This Action concerns studies related to deepening the navigation channel and approaches to the Port of Felixstowe
title: located  in  Harwich  Harbour
created: to increase the maximum size of vessel which can be handled and to reduce the tidal restriction on current and future vessels.

id: The deepening will increase the main channel depth from the current 14.5 metres below chart datum to 16 metres below chart datum. Dredging to achieve this requires the removal of up to 23 million cubic metres of material.

State of project on 31 December 2013:
The soil testing has been completed
title: site  investigation  operations  and  the  seismic  survey  are  on-going.  Computer  modelling  of  water  flows
project_type: waves
contents: and sedimentation as well as the environmental studies have started.

2012-EU-40006-S

---

Accelerating the deployment of advanced FDP capabilities in Europe

------

The Action falls within the global project of the Single European Sky (SES) and its R&D programme SESAR (SES ATM Research) looking for significant improvements in the performance of Air Traffic Management (ATM) in Europe through the implementation of advanced and cross-borders interoperable Flight Data Processing (FDP) systems

id: The Action is a Study to support the achievement of improved ATM performance (safety
title: capacity
created: flight-efficiency  and  cost  effectiveness)  by  accelerating  the  development  and  thus  implementation  of  advanced  FDP  capabilities  into  the  European  Area.  The  Action  aims  to  achieve  the  coordinated
project_type: harmonised and collaborative development of key elements of the future European FDP infrastructure and to support the Interoperability (IOP) of competing platforms. The Action will therefore pursue the implementation of a network model and a data model for the IOP of ATM systems in accordance with the requirements of the SES.

id: The study is expected to make a positive contribution to global interoperability
title: in particular to the successful and timely implementation of interoperable FDP systems which can support the SESAR operational concept and the associated operational improvements from the European air traffic management master plan.

id: The study will be undertaken by members of the "A6 " group of Air Navigation Service Providers: AENA (Spain)
title: Austro  Control  (Austria)
project_type: DSNA  (France)
contents: ENAV  (Italy)
topics: IAA  (Ireland)
image: LFV  (Sweden)  and  NATS  (UK)
column8: involving  eight  EU  Member  States  in  total.  Austro  Control
column9: IAA  and  LFV  are  members  of  the  NORACON  consortium
column10: which constitutes the sixth member of the A6 group.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2013:
The Action is on track and should reach the set objectives and the expected results as planned.

---

Inception and development phase of the Centralised Services Programme

------

This project relates to the development and operations of Centralised Services by Eurocontrol as part of a Global Project contributing to the key objectives of the regulatory and research and development pillars of the Single European Sky initiative.

id: The concept of Centralised Services introduced by Eurocontrol supports actions aiming to consolidate and accelerate the process of ATM reform in Europe. It addresses the inefficiencies of air navigation service provision by defragmenting the European ATM system and facilitating the timely deployment of SESAR (Single European Sky ATM Research).
The Centralised Services support air navigation services at a central
title: pan-European  level  for  increased  harmonisation  and  cost-efficiency.  They  avoid  multiple  investments  and  will  lead  to  reduced  infrastructure  costs.  They  also  support  the  cooperation  of  Air  National  Service  Providers  and  EU  Member  States
created: and  help  achieve  the  EU  cost  efficiency  performance  targets  as  well  as  other  key  performance  indicators  relating  to  capacity
project_type: safety and       environment.

title: this  project  covers  feasibility  studies  and  preparatory  activities  for  six  specific  Centralised  Services
created: to be delivered before end of 2015.

---

New European common services provision for PENS2 and DLS

------

European air navigation service providers have joined forces to prepare the grounds for the future European air traffic management (ATM) system. They will address in particular two major ATM communication infrastructures:

id: • The next generation of Pan-European network services enabling the exchange of air traffic information
• The data link services improving the communication between the pilot and the control tower with digitalised computer messages

The aim of this project is to analyse the technical and business needs of both the next generation of Pan-European network and data link services to ensure high-quality and efficient services ultimately leading to safer and 'greener' European air traffic. It involves members of the A6 alliance
title: a  group  of  air  navigation  service  providers  from  Germany
project_type: France
contents: Italy
topics: Sweden  and  the  UK
image: representing more than 70% of European air traffic. Key industry stakeholders in the field will be consulted by the study team.

id: The study is expected to make a fundamental contribution to the Single European Sky initiative (SES)
title: which  aims  to  increase  Europe's  airspace  capacity
created: reduce the risk of accidents and the environmental impact of flights and cut costs for passengers.

European ITS Platform +

------

The European ITS Platform+ (EIP+) is the follow up of the European ITS Platform (EIP). It will carry on its activities towards ITS interoperability and harmonised deployment in Europe.

id: The EIP+ project brings together Member States authorities
title: road  operators  and  relevant  decision  makers  to  monitor  the  EasyWay  deployment  guidelines
created: evaluate  the  impact  of  ITS  projects  on  a  pan-European  scale
project_type: as well as disseminate best practice.

id: The EIP+ provides a helpdesk and user support facility to further advance the EasyWay initiative. The EIP+ also fosters international cooperation on ITS
title: in particular among the ITS "works " projects funded by the TEN-T Multiannual Call 2013.

id: The EIP+ works on consensus building among relevant ITS stakeholders to ensure appropriate harmonisation of existing and future ITS services in line with the EU policies and objectives.
-       Monitor the application of EasyWay Deployment Guidelines
title: including  a  Helpdesk  and  User  Support  facility
created: in the harmonised ITS deployments on the pan-European roll-out implementations of Corridor projects (Works)

Ursa Major

------

URSA MAJOR will deploy Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) services on German
topics: Italian  and  Dutch  highways  to  improve  international  freight  traffic.  The  project  mainly  addresses  truck  parking
image: navigation and congestion issues to improve road safety and security.

id: The project aims to improve and support ITS services for international freight traffic on the main roads linking North Sea ports
title: the  Ruhr  and  Rhine  area
created: as well as metropolitan areas in southern Germany and northern Italy. Austria and Switzerland are also involved in the project in their role of transit countries.

id: URSA MAJOR will provide direct user benefits to international truck drivers and hauliers (better truck parking
title: better  navigation
created: less delays and less uncertainties). It also strengthens the European economy by an improved transport of goods through Europe.

id: -       Develop the Intelligent Truck Parking service based on common European standards
title: to allow available and safe and secure truck parking places

id: -       Provide an enhanced truck navigation service with reliable information on travel road conditions
-       Increase the level of ITS service support for freight traffic by filling traffic management gaps in the network
title: to reduce delays due to traffic congestion

id: URSA MAJOR is named after the constellation
title: as  the  corridor  has  almost  the  same  shape.  In  Europe
created: URSA  MAJOR  is  visible  every  night  throughout  the  year  and  never  disappears  below  the  horizon.  Likewise
project_type: the cooperation launched in URSA MAJOR is expected to offer fixed and permanently visible ITS services in the concerned area.

Crocodile

------

CROCODILE sets up and operates a data exchange infrastructure that will be used to exchange data and information between all involved public authorities and private partners.

title: traveller information services will be harmonised and provided along the corridor. The specific focus of CROCODILE will be on safety-related information services and truck parking information services.

id: CROCODILE is also expected to foster cross-border coordination of strategies and services
title: implement  cross-border  ITS  applications  for  travellers
created: improve the efficiency of traffic flows and reduce congestion.

id: CROCODILE mainly focuses on the implementation of DATEX II nodes for data availability and exchange. To ensure the most appropriate data availability
title: CROCODILE  will  set  up  additional  data  collection  infrastructure  relevant  for  road-safety  and  truck-parking  information  services.  At  the  same  time
created: to  guarantee  access  to  data  by  the  users
project_type: CROCODILE Member States and partners will set up access points in accordance to EU Regulations and Guidelines.

title: the main objectives of CROCODILE are to:

id: -       Implement infrastructure and processes in accordance to the needs identified in Commission delegated regulations (EU) No 886/2013 and (EU) No 885/2013 to form the basis for service deployments
-       Foster cross-border coordination of ITS strategies and services
-       Provide information services to truck drivers on parking space availability
-       Implement services for user information on safety critical traffic information through cross-border ITS applications for travellers
-       Improve the efficiency of traffic flows and reduce congestion

NEXT-ITS – North European Cross-border ITS

------

NEXT-ITS contributes to the delivery of continuous Real-Time Traffic Information and Road Safety Related Traffic Information on the Nordic section of the Scandinavian-Mediterranean corridor
topics: in  accordance  with  the  EU  ITS  Directive  2010/40/EU
image: focussing in particular to its Priority Actions (b) and (c).

id: The aim of the NEXT-ITS project is to establish the organizational and technical framework required to offer seamless
title: harmonized and interoperable ITS services in a corridor with increased presence of Heavy Goods Vehicles and limited possibilities to alternative routes.

id: NEXT-ITS will improve the quality of services through higher quality of data. This is achieved through improved data management in Traffic Centres and adding new and innovative ways to acquire extra and complementary data.
NEXT-ITS will extend the coverage of ITS services offered along the corridor (filling the current gaps in service provision)
title: especially  to  cover  sections  with  particular  needs
project_type: urban interfaces etc.

id: In order to increase reliability and efficiency of the ITS travel information
title: road weather monitoring facilities will be upgraded and extended along the corridor.

id: NEXT-ITS will also provide additional channels to deliver services to users
title: taking  into  account  latest  trends  and  users  behaviours
created: i.e.: development of app-based and extended internet services to include mobile users.

MedTIS _Mediterranean Corridor deploying Traveller Information Services

------

MedTIS is an Intelligent Transport System (ITS) deployment project aiming at coordinated implementation of travel time and traveller information services on the TEN-T Mediterranean Corridor.

id: The corridor embeds two major critical sections
title: the  Pyrenees  and  the  Alpine  crossings
created: and  runs  on  a  continuous  stretch  of  6
project_type: 760  km  European  motorways  including  various  typologies  of  traffic  (daily  recurrent
contents: seasonal
topics: heavy  goods  vehicles  density
image: conurbations
column8: long  distance  travellers
column9: etc.).

id: By informing the travellers on traffic and driving conditions and travel time
title: MedTIS aims to maintain a high level of safety and network efficiency. The action will coordinate the wok of road-operators and relative IT deployments.

id: MedTIS will ensure the interoperability and continuity of ITS services across different Member States and road operators. More specifically
title: MedTIS  will  implement  service  continuity  to  better  manage  cross-border  sections
created: in particular freight traffic and peak traffic conditions.

id: End user services will be enhanced through data aggregation from neighbouring networks and information on Variable Message Signs (VMS) will be harmonised across the entire Corridor.
The action will be implemented by France
title: Italy
created: Spain and Portugal and will involve 22 implementing bodies.

BRIDGE - Building the Resilience of International & Dependent Gateways in Europe

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The Dover-Calais Motorways of the Sea bridge
topics: part of TEN-T Priority Project 21 (Motorways of the Sea)
image: is  considered  as  a  key  logistical  corridor.  By  2030
column8: a  growth  in  freight  traffic  is  forecast  to  increase  by  40%.  In  order  to  meet  the  demands  of  the  market  and  support  the  resilience  of  the  corridor
column9: this project will upgrade the link investing in innovative solutions to adapt and enhance current infrastructure in both ports and improve traffic management across multiple modes.

id: The main objectives of this project are to:
<li>Improve  the  existing  maritime  link  to  achieve  a  viable
title: regular and frequent traffic (on average 41 return crossings per day) where freight is predominant

id: • Improve access to peripheral and island countries by connecting mainland Europe with the UK and indirectly with Ireland and concentrate the freight traffic to and from Ireland through the Dover-Calais sea route

<li>Enhance  the  efficiency  and  reliability  of  the  sea  link  and  address  bottlenecks  within  the  ports  and  their  hinterlands  through  traffic  management  improvements  at  the  Port  of  Dover
title: major  berth  enhancements  at  the  Ports  of  Dover  and  Calais
created: as well as a multimodal platform which includes a rail terminal and an innovative electronic logistics management system aimed at improving the unaccompanied freight flows in the Port of Calais

Into the future - Baltic So2lution

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The pilot project
topics: part of part of Priority Project 21 (Motorways of the Sea)
image: aims  to  minimize  the  emissions  of  transport  routes  along  the  Motorway  of  the  Baltic  Sea  by  introducing  an  innovative  and  environmentally  friendly  transport  model  and  a  generic  low-emission
column8: dual-fuel engine technology package that would be suitable both for new-built and retrofitted vessels.

id: A LNG driven product tanker will act as a first test bed for the low-emission technology package
title: operating mainly between Sweden and Finland and stopping at 21 different ports and terminals. The project is expected to increase the demand of LNG in the area and promote the deployment of LNG bunkering infrastructure in the ports according to the EU legislation on alternative fuels infrastructure. A lack of LNG bunkering infrastructure is currently a clear bottleneck in the Baltic Sea.
the  project  will  support  the  objectives  of  the  Global  Project  which  aims  at  finding  solutions  to  reduce  emissions  from  maritime  transport  in  a  safe
created: environmentally  sustainable  and  technically  viable  way.  Among  others
project_type: it  will  support  the  development  of  a  strong
contents: safe and competitive shipping sector and contribute to the successful implementation of the Motorways of the Sea in the Baltic Sea region. It will also help the shipping sector to comply with the Sulphur Emission Control Area (SECA) entering into force as of January 2015.

Sustainable Trelleborg-Swinousjcie MoS services based on upgrading port infrastructure
topics:
developing intermodal transport and integrating hinterland corridors---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The project
image: part of Priority Project 21 (Motorways of the Sea)
column8: covers  works  and  studies  with  the  objective  to  develop  the  Motorways  of  the  Sea  infrastructure  at  the  Port  of  Trelleborg
column9: upgrade  ICT  in  Trelleborg
column10: and prepare grounds for the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) bunkering facility at Świnoujście.

id: By the extension of its fairway
title: the  Port  of  Trelleborg  will  ensure  safe  and  efficient  ship  manoeuvres  and  increased  sea-based  capacity  and  accessibility.  Two  breakwaters  and  two  pier  heads  will  be  built
created: and an on-shore power supply will be established at the Port of Trelleborg.

id: The intermodal terminal will be enlarged and upgraded in the new eastern part of the Port of Trelleborg. 70% of storm and rainwaters will be treated before entering the Baltic Sea thanks to modernisation of the infrastructure. The required ground works
title: erection of drainage and water management systems as well as the establishment of monitoring and steering devices at the terminal will be carried out.

increased  safety  and  quality  of  trailer  handling  at  the  Port  will  be  ensured  by  the  modernisation  of  the  port  operations.  The  new  facilities  will  be  allow  the  immediate  coordination  actions  and  reporting  to  integrated  transport  chain  actors.  A  new
created: state-of-the-art and efficient port traffic management system will strengthen Trelleborg-Świnoujście maritime link. A study on the LNG organisation will be commissioned by the Port of Świnoujście.

title: the  maritime  link  between  Trelleborg  and  Świnoujście  will  be  able  to  prepare  for  proper  handling  of  the  shipping  lines'  ferries
created: which are expected to be up to 40% larger than the currently deployed ships.

Part of Priority Project 21

The main objective of the Global Project is to enable a gradual but rapid transition towards the viable supply of LNG (liquefied natural gas) for a fleet of vessels operating in the SECA and within EU.

title: part of Priority Project 21 (Motorways of the Sea)
project_type: namely the:

id: • Installation of small scale equipment for LNG bunkering in the Zeebrugge terminal (Belgium) to break down large quantities of LNG into smaller ones for further distribution in the North Sea and the Channel region. Zeebrugge would become the first European terminal open to the public for this kind of operation.
<li><span>Equipment  of  three  ferry  berths  with  automatic  quick  release  mooring  hooks

title: 2013-EU-21006-S
contents:
2013-EU-21006-S 

---

Deployment of next generation scrubber technology for clean and sustainable short sea shipping in the North Sea ECA

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The North Sea
topics: including  the  English  Channel
image: is one of the busiest seas in the world. The traffic intensity is high and it is an important transport network connecting the UK with the EU mainland. The North Sea ECA is characterized by a large share of short sea shipping.

title: part of TEN-T Priority Project 21 (Motorways of the Sea)
created: is  a  pilot  action  aiming  to  overcome  technical  and  operational  barriers  related  to  the  introduction  of  hybrid  scrubber  technology.  It  helps  to  address  the  environmental  challenges  faced  by  the  short  sea  shipping  in  two  ways
project_type: namely by:

id: <li>Deploying  and  studying  a  unique  prototyped  hybrid  scrubber  system  that  will  be  installed  on  a  ferry  (P&O  Ferries)  operating  on  a  strategic  transport  route  between  the  UK  and  the  EU  mainland  (Hull-Rotterdam).  The  new  system  has  three  different  modes:  open  loop
title: closed  loop  or  dry  (bypass)  condition
created: and  incorporates  a  sophisticated  two-stage  design  which  significantly  reduces  particulate  matter  discharge.  This  technology  will  give  ship  operators  a  viable  business  case  and  ensure  compliance  with  legislation.  Moreover
project_type: it  anticipates   upcoming  legislation  which  is  stricter  than  the  SECA  2015  by  enabling  a  fully  closed  loop  operating  mode.  The  design  flexibility  makes  this  hybrid  system  the  ideal  solution  for  greening  waterborne  transport.  The  performance  of  the  scrubber  will  be  compared  in  a  special  study  with  emission  results  from  ferries  using  purely  SECA  compliant  fuel
contents: both on the Hull-Rotterdam and Dover-Calais routes.

id: <li>A  port  impact  study  on  the  new  technology's  impact  on  the  environment
title: including  SO2
project_type: CO2
contents: and particle emissions in order to facilitate the uptake of the technology in the EU.

id: Total project cost covered by this Decision:
Download the Info Sheet about this project:
.pdf (248.2 KB)

P&O North Sea Ferries BV
P&O Ferries France SAS

ATLANTICA OPTIMOS

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

This project
topics: part  of  TEN-T  Priority  Project  21  (Motorways  of  the  Sea)
image: covers  the  link  between  Nantes  St-Nazaire  (France)  and  Vigo  (Spain)
column8: mainly dedicated to unaccompanied road transport.

id: It aims at upgrading the existing maritime link between the two ports into reliable and frequent Motorways of the Sea open to modal shift traffic. This new integrated service will start operating in 2014 with three rotations per week. The plan is to move into a fourth rotation by July 2016 when occupancy ratios are satisfactory.

The project will develop the infrastructure capacity and upgrade the interface between terminals and the hinterland connections. A new Ro-Ro berth at the Port of Nantes Saint-Nazaire's Montoir-de-Bretagne Ro-Ro terminal will be constructed and a floating ramp will be installed at the Port of Vigo to replace the current fixed ramp for an improved embarkation/disembarkation process.

topics: TRAINMOS  global  project  aims  at  promoting  the  EU  multimodal  transport  system  and  enabling  a  smart
image: sustainable and inclusive connection of the European regions and neighboring countries.

id: The objective of TRAINMOS II is to establish the content of a modular MSc/Post Graduate Diploma/Certificate/Continuing professional development (CPD) programme with a number of modules
title: and  start  the  accreditation  process.  The  project  targets  university  graduates
created: but also professionals working in different sectors of the multimodal transport chain.

id: TRAINMOS II will develop a second step of the Global Project
title: taking  into  account  some  emerging  needs  in  terms  of  transport  and  sustainability
created: as  well  as  the  challenges  identified  in  the  European  Maritime  Area
project_type: building  upon  the  knowledge  and  the  tools  already  generated  in  TRANIMOS  I
contents: delivering new contents and improving the existing IT tools.

id: The main expected outputs will be to:
-    Deliver a specific tool to match the demand and offer related with training and job on the maritime logistic sector
-    Design and provide training modules according to stakeholder needs
-    Design a master science MSc based on the created training modules
-    Draft an agreement among the universities to provide the MSc based on the Training Management System (TMS) training modules and experiences
-    Provide a system of recognition of the credits obtained by each single participant
The content of the courses and other relevant information will be available through the portal onthemosway.eu.

Development of North Adriatic ports multimodal  connections and their efficient integration into the Core Network (NAPA STUDIES)

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The main project's objective is to contribute to the development of the North Adriatic Ports as points of interconnection between the sea transport and other modes of transport through the creation or improvement of hinterland access linking the ports to the TEN-T Network via rail and inland waterways connections.

id: Specific objectives of the action are:
-    Carry out advanced analysis to prepare future investments in North Adriatic Ports and Motorways of the Sea
-    Promote cooperation and agreements between ports
title: freight operators and inland terminals in order to improve the services supply

id: -    Promote sea-rail freight intermodal efficient solutions and fostering the integration of ports into the Core Network Corridors and Rail Freight Corridors crossing the North Adriatic area
-    Foster sea-river co-modal services and integration of the sea port of Venice and Chioggia into the Po river system
-    Promote investments in Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) to improve the efficiency of the short sea shipping and its interconnection with other transport modes

The project will carry out studies and designs preparing major investments for the development of the North Adriatic ports hinterland connections (specifically railway and inland waterways) and port-sea access

---

Pilot Implementation of a LNG-Propulsion System on a MoS Test Track in the Environmental Model Region 'Wadden Sea'

---

Part of Priority Project 21

---

The specific objective of this Motorways of the Sea project is to deliver the pilot development and testing of the innovative methodology for LNG retrofitting. One of the vessels that are operating the Borkum service will be converted to LNG by retrofitting its propulsion system in an innovative manner.

id: The project constitutes the continuation (Phase 2) of a previous action MariTIM implemented under INTEREG IV which is an R&D project with feasibility study.
Based on the findings of this R&D project
title: the first vessel under German flag will be retrofitted and equipped with LNG propulsion. The pilot project takes the function of the demonstration project in the framework of the LNG Master Plan in the Wadden Sea and will aim to drive the development of the accelerated introduction of LNG in the Wadden Sea.

id: This in turn will contribute to the realisation of the general objective that is to establish the Wadden Sea as an environmental model region for both
title: the accelerated introduction of LNG as alternative fuel for ships.

id: The project will also contribute to achieving the objective of the Sulphur Emission Control Area
title: to reduce the SOx to 0.10% as of January 2015.

This project is part of TEN-T Priority Project 17 (Railway axis Paris-Strasbourg-Stuttgart-Wien-Bratislava) and a larger Global Project aiming to enable the continuous four-track operation of train services for the Salzburg-Vienna connection. The works
image: which  have  been  partially  completed
column8: will improve the efficiency of the line for both cargo and high-speed passenger trains. Operational simulations have shown that an additional two-track line is urgently needed on these rail sections to meet capacity shortages.

id: This particular project is a study preparing the construction of a new two-track line between Linz and Wels
title: to complement the existing two-track line. The new line also integrates the Blue Danube Airport in Linz to promote intermodality.

---

Studies on the Priority Project of common interest: The Seine-Scheldt inland waterway network - cross-border section between Compiègne and Ghent

---

Part of Priority Project 30

---

This project
topics: part of the larger Global Project and TEN-T Priority Project 30

title: concerns a link of the Seine-Scheldt waterway which is currently inaccessible to large gauge vessels along its entire length and is a major bottleneck for inland waterway transport.

id: It consists of several studies focusing on the cross-border section of the canal between Compiègne (France) and Ghent (Belgium). Its aim is to increase the canal's capacity and improve the level of services provided by the waterways.
The different activities are designed as measures of support for the Global Project and include studies focusing on:
• Upgrading the Quesnoy lock to a large gauge network
• Modernising the Nord-Pas-de-Calais network in order to improve its infrastructure for the period 2010-2040
• Upgrading the Deûle and a new trajectory of the Deûle-Lys axis for class Va vessels
• Upgrading the Oise river to Vb gauge
• Raising the Mours bridge and temporary lowering the Isle Adam canal pound

contents:
2013-IE-26008-S 

---

Dublin Port Alexandra Basin Redevelopment Project - Creating Capacity and Removing a Bottleneck on an Inter-Modal Transfer Point on Priority Project 26

---

Part of Priority Project 26

---

The project
topics: part of TEN-T Priority Project 26 (Railway/road axis Ireland/United Kingdom/continental Europe)
image: covers a set of preparatory studies leading to the implementation of the construction works (the Global Project). It consists of:

id: 1. The preparation and lodgment of planning applications including an EIA
2. The handling of the verbal hearing process
3. An economic and financial assessment
4. Preparation and application for all relevant permissions
title: licenses and consents

id: 5. Procurement of detailed design services
6. Delivery of the detailed design and tendering documentation for the construction phase.

The Alexandra Basin Redevelopment (ABR) Global Project aims to handle expected customer needs and comprises the reconfiguration of the basin in the Dublin Port to accommodate larger ships. It will also allow for the changing operational needs of shipping service providers and a substantial increase in Port capacity through multipurpose berths for multiple modes. This will ensure that the Dublin Port can increase its overall throughput from the current 28 million tonnes to 60 million tonnes by 2040.

------

The Paris-Lyon high speed rail line is one of the world’s busiest
topics: handling  one-third  of  all  national  high  speed  traffic.  This  line  has  currently  reached  its  maximum  of  13  trains  per  hour  at  peak  traffic  times.  The  larger  Global  Project  will  increase  capacity  and  meet  train  path  needs  at  peak  hours
image: estimated  at  14  paths  in  2020
column8: 15 in 2025 and 16 in 2030 and thereafter.

id: The present project concerns the following initial studies aiming at identifying and specifying the necessary steps to leverage achievement of the Global Project's performance targets
title: namely to:

id: -    Gauge potential developments in demand for services on the Paris– Lyon corridor
-    Establish when saturation point will be reached: i.e. to determine from what point will it be impossible to cater to demand
-    Design timetable graphs corresponding to this demand
-    Agree on the improvements needed to relieve congestion on the line and cater to the expected demand
-    Assess the performance standards that could be attained through investment

title: 2013-EU-92055-S
contents:
2013-EU-92055-S 

---

CORRI-DOOR

------

The overall objective of the project is to foster Electric Vehicle (EV) deployment in France within a short timeframe. It will develop an understanding of all technological
topics: environmental  and  end  user  requirements  to  enable  the  viability  of  an  interoperable  fast  charging  network  in  France  and  in  Europe.  There  are  three  specific  objectives
image: namely to:

id: 1. Test the use of EV infrastructure in a full live trial in France along the main TEN-T axes and French highways linking together large urban areas and suburban population centres. This objective will be met by deploying
title: testing
created: operating and monitoring a pilot of 200 new interoperable and multi-standard fast charging stations.

id: 2. Ensure full national interoperability within the pilot-scale network of 200 fast charging stations. Recommendations about interoperable connections with other already existing EV charging networks in France and neighbouring countries will be established in order to ensure full replicability across Europe.

3. Develop and validate innovative business models supporting the deployment of a fast charging infrastructure. This objective will be met by comparing the data processed during the pilot with available benchmarks from other European EV infrastructure systems.
The consolidated results of the project will be widely disseminated at national and European levels. They will provide a roadmap for France
title: and  possibly  other  Member  States
created: and support decision-making on nationwide roll-outs of EV infrastructure.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2014:
Beneficiaries have started to deploy the pilot of 200 fast charging stations but face permitting and regulatory issues which delay the whole process. Interoperability related tasks are on going.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:

.pdf (242.7 KB)

title: 2013-NL-92070-S
contents:
2013-NL-92070-S 

---

Electricity Connection Points - Greening the European temperature controlled transport network

------

The project’s overall objective is to prepare and launch a European wide network of electricity connection points (ECP network) for supplying electricity to trucks with temperature controlled cargo holds during (un)loading and rest periods
topics: as  a  replacement  for  the  current  on-board  diesel  generator/engine.  The  benefits  are  a  decrease  of  CO2
image: NOx
column8: and PM emissions and a reduction of noise pollution.

id: The project has two specific objectives
title: namely to:
addressing  conditions  for  infrastructure  requirements
project_type: service concepts and spatial planning and to elaborate a comprehensive strategy with a detailed roadmap and appropriate guidelines and recommendations for the implementation of an ECP network along the TEN-T Corridors in Europe.

id: 2. Carry out a real life trial and to test
title: operate
created: and  monitor  the  deployment  of  an  ECP  network  in  40  locations  along  TEN-T  Corridors  throughout  Europe.  The  trial  covers  the  main  area  of  the  temperature  controlled  transport  network
project_type: and differentiates between the United Kingdom-Spain axis and the Netherlands-Germany-Italy axis.

id: The knowledge gained in this project will lead to the development of a roadmap towards the deployment of a pan-European open access ECP network for temperature controlled transport. The project results will be disseminated widely at local
title: national and European levels of decision and policy makers.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2014:
The beneficiary has started the study and the real life trial with three out of the ten planned ECPs locations in 2014. This is due to longer negotiation phase and unexpected legal difficulties.
Total project cost covered by this Decision:

Pilot development of an LNG propulsion system for combined passenger and freight transport with a view to provide year-round supply to the peripheral region of Helgoland

---

 

---

The project concerns the construction and pilot deployment of a LNG propulsion system for a ferry between the port of Cuxhaven and the island of Helgoland.

id: The development covers the innovative concept and design
title: implementation  and  installation  of  the  LNG-propulsion  system  and  its  required  components
created: as well as a pilot study on the implementation resulting in recommendations on best practices.

id: • Reduce the sulfur and other emissions from the ships through the use of LNG and thereby contribute to the protection of the North Sea as an ECA area. It will be subject to MARPOL VI regulation on sulphur emission reduction as of 1 January 2015. The low emissions will also contribute to protecting the nearby Wadden Sea nature reserve
• Relieve the traffic by combining passenger and freight transport on the same vessel
• Ensure faster transport than with the current ferries using conventional fuel
• Contribute to the safeguarding of the island as an attractive location both for permanent inhabitants and seasonal visitors
• Prepare the legal base for vessels with LNG propulsion to operate in the harbor Cuxhaven e.g. to allow safe refueling and loading/unloading of freight

topics:
a Solution for Archipelagos far from LNG Storage Plants------

Difficult access to alternative fuels in some regions hampers the reduction of the related gas emissions and decarbonisation of European transport. This project will study existing solutions in the Canary Islands and other remote areas regarding the access to natural gas.

id: It will study the introduction of LNG (liquefied natural gas) and CNG (compressed natural gas) in the Canary Islands
title: as  a  way  of  stemming  oil  dependence  and  reducing  overall  energy  costs.  To  achieve  this  aim
project_type: port authorities and the private sector will join forces to establish the most appropriate logistics chain to supply LNG in the archipelago.

id: The project will identify market demand for LNG and CNG in Islands for the short and medium term and evaluate the actual cost of its delivery there. A storage and supply analysis will also be undertaken
title: combined with other safety and security assessments. A feasibility study regarding the adaptation of this solution to other European remote areas will be carried out.
in  order  to  disseminate  the  results  among  all  stakeholders  at  national  and  European  levels
created: appropriate activities will be ensured throughout the project's implementation period.

id:

The beneficiary has started the study and first preliminary results are expected in 2015 as planned.

LNG uptake in the UK: a real-life trial with the first small scale bunkering infrastructure in Teesport and innovative LNG vessels

------

The aim of this project is to realise a breakthrough in the application of LNG (liquefied natural gas) for short sea shipping through a dedicated LNG supply and demand chain in the UK. It will show the viability of LNG as a significantly environmental sound alternative to present marine fuels and its potential for short sea shipping in the UK and the North Sea.

id: It will deploy a LNG bunkering facility in the port of Teesport and carry out a real-life trial in two vessels (ethylene carriers) propelled with an innovative LNG fuel system.
It will also demonstrate the potential of LNG in UK marine and road transport through technical and market studies
title: in order to help advance the roll-out of LNG technology in the UK.

id: The results of these studies will be widely disseminated at local
title: national and European levels.

Smart Energy Efficient and Adaptive Port Terminals (Sea Terminals)

------

This project will pilot nine real-life trials of last generation port container machinery and energy management systems to reduce pollutant carbon emissions and increase the energy efficiency in the ports of Valencia (Spain) and Livorno (Italy).

title: it will focus on implementing a smart energy management system including dynamic (on-demand) lighting for the entire container terminal. It will also look at adapting equipment such as cranes and tractors to alternative fuels - LNG (liquefied natural gas) and electricity.

id: The new system is expected to significantly reduce the current energy consumption in the port container terminals. A piloted crane could potentially use up to 50% less fuel than a standard full diesel crane
title: and the dynamic lighting could reduce energy consumption by 30%.

id: The pilot results will be made public in five events organised throughout the duration of the project. In addition
title: standards and policy recommendations based on the project results will be formulated to encourage the adoption of these technologies by a critical mass of port container terminals in the EU.

This project is the second part of a larger project (HIT – Hydrogen Infrastructure for Transport) aiming to establish a network of European hydrogen refueling infrastructure and enable long distance travel with fuel cell cars. It will develop national implementation plans for Belgium
topics: Finland
image: Poland and a regional implementation plan for the city of Riga (Latvia). Furthermore it includes the pilot deployment and testing of three hydrogen refueling stations with specific innovative elements in Finland and Sweden along the TEN-T network.

id: The project will also analyse and disseminate the study results in Europe
title: including a hydrogen road tour along the Scandinavian – Mediterranean and North Sea – Baltic Core Network Corridors.

Sustainable Maritime Transport with LNG between Greek mainland and islands in the Archipelagos (ARCHIPELAGO-LNG)

------

This project covers a study aiming to promote the use of LNG (liquefied natural gas) as a marine fuel in the passenger and shipping sectors of the Greek islands
topics: in order to reduce supply costs and the environmental impact of oil derivative-based fuels. The main objective is to motivate and to provide the Greek authorities with the necessary tools in order to adopt a regulatory framework for the bunkering of gas-fuelled (LNG) ships in the region by:

id: <li>Identifying  the  key  technical  and  economic  framework  of  small-scale  LNG  as  marine  fuel  value  chain  in  South  Aegean
title: e.g.  main  supply  chain  options
created: required  retrofits  and  infrastructure  in  ports

contents: business plans for each operator

title: using the South Aegean region as a reference

id: The project will bring together key Greek stakeholders representing a cross-section of the LNG as marine fuel supply chain - including national ministerial and regional authorities
title: LNG  suppliers

title: 2013-IT-92050-S
contents:
2013-IT-92050-S

---

Study for the development of the green mobility in the port of Civitavecchia through the implementation of the pilot technology REWEC 3

------

The project is part of a larger project aiming to reduce the emissions produced by the services and terminal activities of the Port of Civitavecchia by installing renewable energy systems expected to satisfy at least 55% of the port's total energy needs by 2020. It will carry out a feasibility study
topics: including  a  pilot  project
image: to convert wave energy into electricity to be used in port activities.

id: -    Test the wave energy absorbers system REWEC3 (REsonant Wave Energy Converter/3) to demonstrate its cost efficiency
-    Evaluate the possible future introduction of green mobility (i.e. electric vehicles) in port operations
-    Study storage options for the green energy produced by the Port
If successful in demonstrating the cost efficiency of the REWEC3 system
title: the  introduction  of  green  mobility  and  the  storage  of  the  produced  energy
created: the project will pave the way to the installation of eight REWEC3 systems for 136 turbines.

title: 2013-NL-92007-S
contents:
2013-NL-92007-S

---

Pilot deployment of emissions reduction technologies on general cargo vessels on North Sea and Baltic MoS corridors

------

This pilot project will install and test the latest scrubber technology that uses sea water instead of fresh water in an open loop to reduce the sulphur emissions on maritime transport in compliance with new EU Regulations. The new cleaning system is expected to bring a number of economic and environmental benefits: ships will no longer need to carry supplies of fresh water or transport/use chemicals for water treatment. In addition
topics: more space will be available for cargo.

id: The latest scrubber technology will be tried out on three different types of cargo ships
title: which  all  together  represent  the  most  common  general  cargo  vessels  in  the  water  trade  routes  of  the  North  and  Baltic  Seas.  The  project  results  will  be  shared  with  key  transport  stakeholders  and  decision  makers
created: and  could  facilitate  introduction  of  the  technology  at  EU  level
project_type: enhancing the competitiveness of short sea transport compared to other modes.

title: 2013-NL-92062-S
contents:
2013-NL-92062-S 

---

Study including pilot deployment to determine the viability of LNG as an alternative fuel for medium and long distance road transport (LNG4Haul)

------

The project's overall objective is to seed the growth of the LNG (liquefied natural gas) road infrastructure and contribute to European renewable energy targets by establishing an operational market for LNG within a short period of time.

id: <li>Build  a  LNG/LBG  (liquefied  bio  gas)  supply  chain  at  pilot  scale  in  The  Netherlands  to  expand  the  scope  of  the  current  LNG/LBG  use  towards  medium  to  long  haul  dispatches  and  ultimately  roll-out  a  European  LNG/LBG  network  for  road  transport.  The  pilot  LNG/LBG  fuelling  stations  will  be  constructed  at  Nieuwegein
title: Heteren
project_type: Utrecht and Geldermalsen.

id: <li>Eliminate  the  risk  perceived  by  logistic  service  providers  in  switching  to  LNG  as  a  fuel  for  medium  to  long  distance  road  transport  due  to  a  lack  of  operational  data.  A  study  including  data  collection  from  the  pilot  operations  is  crucial  to  overcome  current  obstacles  and  show  the  economic  viability  of  LNG/LBG  as  a  transport  fuel.  The  data  will  feed  the  study  and  new  business  models  for  a  switch  to  LNG/LBG  as  a  fuel  for  road  transport  and  the  results  from  the  data  analysis  will  be  disseminated  to  the  industry
title: main stakeholders and decision makers at the European level.

id:
State of progress on 31 December 2014:
The beneficiary has started the pilot deployment
title: hampered  by  significant  permitting  issues  and  unstable  regulatory  environment.  The  study  is  under  elaboration

The project aims to set a national policy framework for LNG (liquefied natural gas) in road transport to accelerate its uptake as an alternative fuel for freight transport in the context of the TEN-T network Corridors

title: to ensure in particular that LNG heavy duty vehicles can travel all along the Portugal/Spain – rest of Europe TEN-T road axis.

title: national and European levels.

Biomethane and LNG in the North for growth and competitiveness in EU (BioGaC)

---

 

---

The study covers the pilot deployment of two new CNG (compressed natural gas) filling stations in Härnösand and Umeå
topics: as  well  as  improves  existing  stations  at  Sundsvall  and  Skellefteå  in  northern  Sweden.  The  aim  is  to  increase  the  number  and  density  of  the  CNG  filling  stations
image: encourage the use of CNG and create a market opportunity for CNG/LNG (liquefied natural gas) investors.

id: The project's results will be used to develop best practice for new actors in the CNG market and support decision-making for other possible CNG filling stations. The project will also provide solutions on how to accelerate market development of both CNG and LNG infrastructure along the roads in specific regions where the distance between urban centers and gas distribution grids is too long
title: or where such a grid does not exist.

title: 2013-SK-92040-S

2013-SK-92040-S 

---

Commercial deployment of interurban EV freight logisics infrastructure
topics:
including comparison study of battery swap and fast charge technology------

One of the main obstacles of using electric vehicles for light freight transport is the lack of charging facilities along the road network. This project will help to mitigate this problem in Slovakia through a pilot deployment of two energy hubs (both consisting of battery swapping and fast charging stations) for light commercial electric vehicles enabling electric freight transport between cities.

id: The project consists of studies that will analyse in detail the technical
title: economic and environmental aspects of light commercial electric vehicles use. Results will be shared with the relevant authorities and transport stakeholders.

id: The project is expected to facilitate and develop the use of e-mobility services in the Slovak market and help to reduce the environmental footprint of freight transport.

title: 2013-DE-92024-S
contents:
2013-DE-92024-S

---

Parking Space Management in the Port of Hamburg

------

The study will look into ways to improve the utilisation rates and cost-effectiveness of existing infrastructure and facilities in the Port of Hamburg by introducing an intelligent traffic management system in both the existing and planned truck and car parks.

id: The potential benefits of the project are:
• a concept that can be transferred to other ports and locations with high industrial and non-industrial activity
• an increased utilisation rate and cost-effectiveness of the transport infrastructure by providing information about parking space availability
<li><span  lang= "EN-US ">reduced  traffic  volumes  and  fuel  consumption
title: as well as less damage to the environment due to less trucks looking for parking bays

id: • better road safety and conditions for truck drivers who will no longer have to park randomly along the roads
<li><span  lang= "EN-US ">more  reliable  transport  processes  and  easier  planning  of  driving  times  and  rest  periods  in  line  with  parking  space  availability
title: time windows to provide or deliver goods and traffic information

id: The study's outcomes will be used by the port authority to take decisions on the future implementation.

2013-FR-92004-S

---

SCOOP@F - Part 1

------

Cooperative intelligent transport systems (C-ITS) embrace a wide variety of communications-related applications between vehicles
topics: road  and  communication  infrastructures  intended  to  increase  travel  and  operational  safety
image: while improving the quality of travel overall.

id: The SCOOP@F Global Project aims at deploying C-ITS from 2014 onwards in France. It will equip 3000 vehicles and 2000 km of streets
title: intercity roads and highways. Part 1 of SCOOP@F deals with the study and pre-deployment phase.

id: Five test sites will be created on intercity roads in Ile-de-France and Bretagne
title: the  Paris-Strasbourg  highway
created: Bordeaux and its bypass and county roads in the Isère.

title: roads  and  vehicles  will  communicate  through  wireless  networks
created: i.e. using both wi-fi routers (along the road and embedded receptors in the vehicles) and public GSM networks.

id: Vehicles will exchange information about their position
title: speed
created: road  obstacles  and  other  details  with  the  infrastructures  and  other  connected  vehicles.  Roads  will  broadcast  information  about  traffic  conditions
project_type: works
contents: speed  limit
topics: road  accidents
image: etc.

id: The data will be gathered by road managers as traffic information to help them react faster in case of emergency. The system also increases safety for workers in construction zones
title: since an alert will be sent to each and every connected vehicle to warn them about the works.

The current Action is part of Project of Common Interest (PCI) 3.24 Hydro-pumped storage in Greece (Amfilochia) which consists of two independent upper reservoirs (Agios Georgios and Pyrgos) and a common lower reservoir (Kastraki Lake). The equipment for energy production and energy pumping will be installed in two independent powerhouses located near the Kastraki Lake. The existing infrastructure will be upgraded
topics: helping to reduce the environmental impact and avoid the construction of a new “lower” reservoir.

id: This specific Action's aim is to prepare the detailed design studies
title: including  the  tender  documents  for  the  Agios  Georgios  and  Pyrgos  reservoirs.  Its  deliverables  include  the  detailed  design  reports
project_type: the decision on the environmental terms approval and the tender documents for the Agios Georgios and Pyrgos reservoirs.

contents:
Studies and preparatory actions for the construction of the Greek part of the 2nd interconnector between Bulgaria and Greece (Project No. 3.7.1 Maritsa East 1 (BG)- Nea Santa (EL))

---

3.7.1-0018-EL-S-M-14

---

CEF ENERGY - Part of Project of Common Interest 3.7.1

---

The Action is a part of the Project of Common Interest (PCI) 3.7.1 that concerns the construction of a new AC 400kV single-circuit interconnector of approximately 151 km with transfer capacity of 1500MVA (thermal limit) between the Maritsa East substation in Bulgaria and Nea Santa substation in Greece. The aim is to reinforce the existing 400kV regional grid
topics: further  increase  cross-border  exchanges  and  accommodate  the  expected  future  renewable  energy  generation  in  northeast  Greece
image: as well as in the northeast and southern regions of Bulgaria.

id: This specific Action involves part of the interconnection transmission line Maritsa East 1 (BG) - Nea Santa (EL) within Greece up to the Bulgarian border crossing
title: with a total length of approximately 29 km. A relevant Action is also undertaken by the Bulgarian TSO (ESO-EAD).

id: The objectives are to prepare the application file in order to proceed with the environmental permit granting process and define all of the technical details required for construction. In addition
title: a detailed cost-benefit analysis and business plan for the entire PCI will be prepared that will allow an investment request to be submitted to relevant national regulatory authorities of Bulgaria and Greece.

The current Action is part of Project of Common Interest (PCI) 4.3
topics: which aims to address the synchronous operation of the Baltic States' electricity system with the European continental networks.

id: The Action's specific goal is to complement a 2013 feasibility study by the Baltic States' Transmission System Operators
title: by  providing  the  final  technical  requirements  for  a  large  scale  generating  unit  to  be  integrated  into  the  Baltic  electricity  system. project_type: technical  measures  or  operational  limitations  (if  no  other  measures  are  available)
contents: as well as the implementation plan.

id: Its main deliverable will be to set up the package of the final technical requirements necessary for the integration of the large scale generating unit into the transmission network.
